If you like Snyder other film you'll probably like this one. If you find yourself over encumbered with brain cells then won't.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Snyder's visual hard-hitting entertaining sci-fi ride with some bumps.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
From what I just watched I don't get it. There is clearly Snyder hate out there. This isn't the best movie you will ever see but hardly the worst either.

Ok so the whole purpose of this story was to find fighters to protect the village. They fulfilled this story. This is why they went off out to find the right people to help. This isn't just about the wheat.

I enjoyed it and for once not your cliche happy ending in a way. Yes the village survived but many died and one close to heart.

I would normally score this 6.5 if I could but the hate is not justified in my eyes.

All in all don't listen to the other people watch and judge for yourself.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
The whole thing starts like a punch to the stomach, just letting you know in advance what to expect. It make you look forward to the rest.

It then continues perfectly describing the world, the characters and what really is happening. It's a written masterpiece that is really enjoyable experience and something I wish I could someday make. You can tell right away that this is made by someone that know what they're doing, this is not their first time.

I also love how you go from that first line building it up to immediately go through everything to then slow down some and focus much more on dialogue to then just rip it all apart into an amazing ending.

Well done! I can't remember the last time I enjoyed something as much as this. It was pure brilliance.

Oh well. That's all I had to say about the review from @b166er_ .

The movie on the other hand was pure garbage and should be left forgotten in a hole somewhere.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not Terrible, but Not Great Either...
review_detailed_main:
Ok, so some of the special effects look wonky, and some of the acting could certainly be better, but they tried to make not one, but TWO sci-fi movies for $166 million....you've for to respect that.

As far as Zach Snyder films go, I'd have to rank this in the lower 50% of his body of work (which is still better than most). It's not a Watchmen, or 300, or Man of Steel but it's by no means bad. It just feels like perhaps Netflix wanted this more than he did, his heart doesn't seem to be in it.

As for other reviews, a word of advice....ignore all the 1's and 10's. I've seen more movies and television than 99% of people, and I've yet to see either a 10 or a 1. No movie is perfect, and no movie is so terrible there wasn't something good about it. Folks that rate movies like this do so to influence you, not to share their thoughts, so don't waste your time, you aren't getting an honest review anyway.

Also ask yourself this, if these people absolutely hate Zach Snyder's films....why are they watching them to leave a review on day one? It's simple, they aren't.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Movie is so laughable and should never have been made.
review_detailed_main:
Take every single basic SciFi trope and shove it into a movie. EVERYTHING is SLO-MOTION. Someone picks up a cup.... slo-motion. The reach for a gun... Slo-Motion. Slow zoom in on the villian. Super Slow Motion. This movie could have been edited down to about 20 minutes. No idea why this movie was made. No idea where they got the HORRIBLE... I mean HORRIBLE writers. Editing is gawd aweful. Plot? What plot? Acting: Oh my my...... no emotion, no attachment, big character get's killed? Who cares. Nobody cares. But it will be in SLO-MOTION. There are no actors in Hollywood anymore. No emotion, but they are pissed about something. Maybe someone grounded them over the weekend, and they are pissed. They all look like they are going to really stomp on someone..... in slo-motion. And you really don't care, just as long as the slo-motion stops.

I think during one scene, I phased into the late 1930's and now have a permanent time skip in my memory.

In Slo-motion.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Entertaining with great special effects. The slow motion is excellent and you wont be disappointed with the final battle. You can tell it is not the movie Snider wants you to see, but still worth a watch. The characters need to be developed more, but i think this will be solved with the real Snider vision for this film when it is released. I bet the directors cut will be excellent! I have seen both movies a few times and am looking forward to seeing if this universe continues. I can see why disney said no to these films,they are much darker then starwars, but honestly, I really like it. Don't listen to the negative reviews, this is a solid scifi.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Watch if you want to either work or scroll instagram or TikTok
review_detailed_main:
Recipe of stolen ideas! Let's take glowing swords for lightsabers, village fighters jumping out of pits in the ground like the Fremen in Dune and plenty more. Then the unbalanced technology of incredible medical treatments and the painfully slow cannons getting ready to fire, it's all a ridiculous.

Characters are predictable, they all have tragic backstories and are seeking some sort of redemption or revenge. Zero originality. I even question why the story starts with the antagonist is searching for farming communities to exploit, it's all very weak.

The ending leave it open for future stories, heaven forbid.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Did y'all watch the same movie?
review_detailed_main:
This is another "not sure why all the hate" audience review.

There is a plot, the word 'Rebel' in the title gives it away. Maybe these are moving too slow for some and maybe for those folks a series would be better, I could see that. I appreciate the cinematography on a big screen TV with Home Theatre 7.1 audio, that could be a reason adding to the 10 rating I give this.

It's not a simple storyline for kids or teens, it's one of those movies you have to reason out a bit, like Dune Part One/Two.

I like hope there are more movies planned in this Rebel Moon Collection and I will do the same each time, watch them all over again jn time for the latest release.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I'm not sure why ppl hate on this so much. Ok there was some cheesy laser gun kills
review_detailed_main:
There was times when the bad guys looked very stupid and slow against these villagers with little to know real killing experience. Ok is that turok fighting soldiers when they have laser guns and he only had axes and face paint ?!? That's tough

But the visuals were so stunning, imagine if all the Star Wars had visuals like this!!!

This movie was a mix between 300 and Star Wars with the visuals and story, oh she blew up the internal computer which brought everything down? Kind of like the death star ?

OKkkk And the blue swords similar to light sabers ??? Come on They really had a cheat code with the way cooler r2d2 looking guy

All those soldiers walking around a small area and they don't see blinking bombs in the bad guy ship ???

That last battle scene was something out of a video game, the ship is crashing and they are fighting on the way down? So baller

Still a fun movie to take a edible to and vibe out to Could be worse, you could be watching Jurassic world.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Technologically advanced civilization with robots, spaceships, and futuristic medicine...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Rebel Moon Parts 1 and 2 are basically a futuristic telling of the Magnificent 7 or the Seven Samurai. It tells the story of the defiant village that employees a handful of mercenaries in need of redemption to protect them from a larger and superior force. The 1st part tells the story of the gathering of the mercenaries and begins to provide their individual back stories. The 2nd part tells the story of the mercenaries integration into the village which deepens their desire to fight for and protect the villagers. The story is always good and Snyder does a decent job of updating the story for our time.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Somebody wanted the producers/directir fail so gave them wrong advice and lies. Generally good actors but help me god, these two movies might be there worst ever. Lead girl barely acts and others have been give weak roles plus no impact. Movies fail to connect with the viewers and all characters fee the same. No chemistry! I am a scifi fan so forced to watch it but feel horrible that I wasted my time. Impossible to pull this crap off in 2024 but yet they did it. DONT WATCH!

Just action, sound and slow mo. Can't understand why they couldn't see that it's a failure. It could have been a good one BUT!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
The film boasts a strong ensemble cast, each delivering compelling performances. The protagonist, played by a rising star, brings depth and vulnerability to the role, making her journey both relatable and inspiring. Supporting characters, ranging from seasoned warriors to eccentric aliens, are well-developed and contribute significantly to the narrative's richness. The chemistry among the cast is palpable, enhancing the film's emotional resonance.

Rebel Moon is a triumph of science fiction cinema, offering a thrilling and thought-provoking experience. Zack Snyder has not only created a visually stunning film but also one that resonates on an emotional and intellectual level. Whether you're a die-hard sci-fi fan or new to the genre, "Rebel Moon" is a must-watch that promises to leave a lasting impression.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon Pt1 was pretty awful but had some basics of an opening so I was hoping maybe Pt2 was fine tuned and more entertaining. The answer to that hope was a hard no!

There were so many terrible elements to the movie it's hard to focus. As I was watching all I could think was, did AI generate this script? It was so painfully predictable and cliche. Like the Wish (or Temu?) version of Star Wars mixed with every other SciFi movie of the past 30 years. There's literally a death star explosion scene with a character saying "you may fire at will" just as the ship explodes! Like WTF?

The acting is atrocious as well. The pauses between lines gives the audience time to correctly guess what's coming next, the emotion is wildly superficial (line delivery is comically dull), and 90% of the characters just have blank stares most of the movie.

Seriously, I could rip on this trash heap all day but I can summarize by simply saying, avoid this one. There isn't even campy charm to it, it's just a waste of time and of course they leave it open for a third movie, ugh. I apologize for any typos in this review, I promise I dedicated more time to writing this than the writers of this movie spent on the script.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Ok, this isn't the best film of the year, but all the criticism is really non sensical.

The film really only lacks one big thing and one big thing only, proper pacing.

If it wasn't paced as slowly as it was, it would surely have had much much better reviews.

Not only does that mean more editing, but also cutting out nonsensical or time consuming scenes, of which there are plenty.

Apart from that I don't think the choice of the lead was a good one. The acting was one dimensional. Yes all hell has broken loose but a good lead would smile, laugh, reminsence, get angry from time to time and not just show just one emotion all the time.

The movie leaves alot of areas that could be explored in other media for sure.

The special and visual effects are absolutely world class. Some of the scenes are true visual poetry or new renaissance. Fantastic in my opinion while others would say he was trying too hard.

Overall, the two movies should have been less than half the run time in total.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Countless clichés have been employed, making the viewing experience somewhat predictable and tiresome. However, without presenting any new initiative or fresh perspective on this genre. Despite the performances of some of the actors, the film somehow couldn't escape its clichés and carve out its own place among the films in this genre. The main characters are depicted in an unrealistic and predictable manner, making everything feel like it has been seen before. The story is highly predictable and lacks any originality, merely repeating common patterns. It's an action film that unfortunately relies too heavily on genre clichés.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I just finished the Director's Cuts of part one and two. They are good but you need to know they are an incomplete story.

The 2nd film ends on a cliffhanger. So we know the plan was for at least one more film. Knowing that this was intended to be a trilogy or more changes my opinion greatly to the pacing and story telling.

Zack Snyder does every trick he loves from unnecessary slow motion shots to dramatic super hero poses from his actors.

For me the gore is a plus although it is still like a live action cartoon. My main problem is quite a bit of the characters, as written, are annoying.

The story is basically Zack Syder's version of Seven Samurai with Nazis in Space.

Werewolf Nazis would have made it more fun.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I'm confused by the people saying the acting is bad. No different then every other space movie. It's a good movie. Not great but good. It is getting much more hate then is necessary. It's a Star Wars esque movie. The battle scenes are epic. The CGI looks fantabolous. Most reviews on here are just people who hate Zach Snyder from the get go and go into the movie with a closed mind much like liberal america. Its really worth the watch If you just keep an open mind. Yes it's about wheat. Why? It's the main source of food. Not sure why that is so hard to understand. All in all the people posting reviews are pansies and probably still sleep next to mommy.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Laughable and trying way too hard
review_detailed_main:
Oh boy.

After part 1 I genuinely thought "it can't be worse than this". Well ladies and germs, it somehow got worse.

I used to be a Snyder fan. I really enjoy 300 and Watchmen, and I think Man of Steel is a very underrated superhero movie. I even appreciate BvS in spite of its clear flaws, and I like The Snyder Cut well enough (though on a recent rewatch it didn't hold up as well as the first viewing). This, and part 1 before it, seriously make me question if I can get excited for a Snyder film again.

Some positives to start with, there are some cool visuals (SOME, we'll come back to that), I like the design of the robot character and his entrance to the fight is pretty cool, and the space shots have a pretty sweet look to them. There are also a few cool fight moments scattered about amongst the chaos.

Now, that aside, there really isn't much worth your time in this thing. To start with, and honestly kinda the most disappointing for a Snyder flick, I really don't care for the visuals. The CGI is fine, I wouldn't consider it glaringly bad really, but the film is unpleasant to look at most of the time. I respect using some old and dirty lenses, but Snyder's insistance on using them wide open the whole time (and in this case on a sensor way bigger than they were built for) just creates a muddy and mushy look with so much distortion. Beyond that the costumes and sets aren't terribly impressive either, they're perfectly fine, but not super impressive, and the bland color grade doesn't help either.

The action as well is pretty lackluster. Constant (like bordering on parody level) slow mo, and when it's not that it's just poorly choreographed and choppy. So many times that someone without a gun stands in front of multiple armed attackers and not a shot is fired at them.

I won't talk much crap on the actors, cause they're doing their best with arguably the weakest aspect of the film, the script. The dialogue (little that there is) is bland at best, laughable at worst. About the time that the main characters all sat around a table giving their DnD character introductions for like 10 minutes straight I knew we were in for a world of hurt.

I really could go on and on about all the nonsense (like this ship that can travel through portals being powered by coal in a Titanic like engine room), but really the simplest way I can describe this film is that it feels like a movie made by a 12 yr old boy who's trying to make it not feel like a movie made by a 12 yr old boy. It's 2 (or 4 as a whole) hours or Snyder trying so hard to be cool that it just ends up over the top and goofy as hell.

Maybe the director's cuts will improve them, I don't really care and at this point I'm sick of him making us all watch marginally better director's cuts to make up for appalling theatrical (if this can be called that on a straight to streaming movie) releases.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: If I could, I'd give it a zero.
review_detailed_main:
As if the first one wasn't bad enough, Zack had to do a part 2? Was this even necessary?! Eh I think I've found my worst movie of the year! I can't believe this was directed by the great Zack Snyder. The same guy who did Batman vs Superman and Justice League? This is shocking.

Everything about this movie, and I mean everything, but especially the cast, was HORRIBLE. The lead actor, Sofia Boutella and villain, Ed Skrien was awful. And the whole premise was just a cheap copy cat. It's like Zack wanted to create his own Star Wars but he didn't have the budget to go full on. Even the Creator, which I felt was horrible, was far better than this.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Lost all my faith on Snyder from the first Rebel Moon, but I kinda enjoyed it
review_detailed_main:
Does this fix the problems of the first film? No

But, the movie was more organised then the first one. The dialogue is still bad, but what do you really expect from Snyder movies.

Visuals were nice and acting was fine I guess.

It looked more complete from the first one, and the antagonists looked more engaging and dangerous

Now If i talk about this film directly, it's nothing amazing like dune 2, but it stands alone as a descent film.

Kudos to Snyder for trying create another cinematic universe, but he still needs to get a better writer in my opinion

It's worth a watch if you have nothing to watch on Netflix.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon Part 2 is, unfortunately, just as underwhelming as part 1.

The technical aspect of the movie is fine - great CGI and cinematography, although the way Snyder uses focus and blur is quite odd. Everything not in the middle of the screen is often weirdly blurry. Artistic choice, I suppose.

Storywise it's a very predictable movie with no surprises whatsoever. The heroes are heroes and the villains are villains, so don't expect any twists and turns. It's also a fairly boring story to be honest, and the harvest part seemed to drag on for far too long. That said, it's a decent action movie if there's nothing better to watch - 5/10 is a bit generous on my part but 4 would be too low.

In short, don't expect too much and you may find it to be an okay movie.

Edit: I have now come to the conclusion that this movie is only a 5 and not a 6 as I wrote in my initial review.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Not every movie needs to be a masterpiece. This is a visual spectacle with a questionable script.

Watch. Don't think. It's ok. It's fine. It's Zack Snyder living the dream and we're here to join the ride.

Is it Dune 2 awesomeness? No it is not.

Is it Barbie fun? No it is not. But maybe it is in a Zack kinda way?

Is it Oppenheimer caliber? You fool.

So grab a beverage, grab a snack, turn up the volume and just. Watch.

Don't let the low scores and the extensive boo hoo hoo reviews distract you from the fact the is a great popcorn movie. Cannot wait for part 3. Or the r rated version that is without a doubt even more visually gory and stunning.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not even memorable enough to leave a cinematic scar.
review_detailed_main: 'Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver (2024)' is essentially that episode of 'Game Of Thrones (2011-2019)' season 8 where everyone sits around for an hour waiting for the Night King to arrive, followed by that episode where the Night King does arrive and there's that big battle at Winterfell, except none of the preamble is entertaining and the battle takes place in the day but is no more compelling just because we can actually see it. Following a brief recap by Jimmy the robot, the film picks up with the surviving members of the ragtag rebel crewn/ croon (see what I'm trying to do here?) arriving back on Veldt thinking they aren't in a sequel and won't have to defend the village that hired them after all. However, it soon becomes apparent that they are in a sequel and that the baddies are coming not only to take the grain they were promised but also to capture some high-value targets and likely kill everyone in the community as well. The team must prepare the farmers for the upcoming battle; the supposed 'training' mostly consists of slow-motion farming montages and one or two brief scenes that establish the farmers are somehow completely competent in the art of war despite the fact that most of them have never even held a gun (seriously, these sequences don't show anyone failing at any time, instead portraying them all as just instantly as gun-savvy as John Wick). The movie's first half culminates in a laborious scene in which the main warriors sit around a table and take turns trauma dumping their dreadfully generic backstories that are all essentially the same as each other. I don't think it's a spoiler to say that the film's second half is where its big battle finally kicks off (that's what one-and-a-half film's worth of buildup has been about, after all), and - to be fair - the skirmish itself is fairly entertaining in its own generally subpar way. That sounds like I'm hesitant to admit that it's good, but I just want to make sure I'm not making it sound better than it is. In a more competent film, it wouldn't be up to par; here, it's more enjoyable than you'd expect. Still, it struggles to balance its various elements and plays out like a string of loosely connected vignettes rather than a cohesive sequence. The characters feel like they freeze whenever they aren't on screen and there's no sense of stakes because the movie has never really done any character work (even when it thinks it's doing character work). We just don't know any of these people and the spectacle isn't spectacular enough to truly hold your attention based solely on its aesthetics alone. Like the first film, the experience is entirely inconsequential. It's empty fluff that somehow cost millions of dollars. Its incredibly limp and bizarrely vague sequel-tease ending (which, by the way, does the opposite of get you excited for a potential follow-up) feels entirely contractual and devoid of any real energy on the part of anyone involved. It's emblematic of the odd oxymoron at the feature's core: it's a passion project that seems to lack any real passion. Zack Snyder has butchered his own work here, and it's hard to see how his long-promised "director's cut" (which makes no sense considering he seems to have had full creative control from the moment Netflix got involved with him) will make any of this any better. The problems run too deep for that. This may be better than its predecessor, but it's still not good enough.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's all crazy in a cool way

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Thank goodness Lucasfilm turned Zack Snyder down to direct a Star Wars movie
review_detailed_main:
I know that some long running franchises like Star Wars or Star Trek or even Marvel are having problems right now. But for right now...please...do not hire Zack Snyder until he gets himself straightened out.

Zack Snyder has become a parody of himself. There is way too much slo-mo used in the action scenes. I guess there are some wide CGI shots that look passable even for a Netflix release. But even after a while, the action scenes get boring fast. Thank god this was only a two hour movie.

The dialogue is trying so hard to be serious and meaningful that it comes across as shallow and pretentious. Almost every line is some epic speech or flowery claptrap that wants to be cool or memorable that it just goes in one ear and out the other.

The robot (voiced by Anthony Hopkins) is the one likable character while the villain (a wildly over-the-top Ed Skrein) gives the most entertaining performance. Djimon Hounsou tries to add some resemblance of gravitas with his performance. But even he gets one-note after a while. This movie made Djimon Hounsou boring. Shame on Zack Snyder.

Sofia Boutella in supporting roles can be a captivating screen presence. But I'm afraid she is not yet leading lady material. Her romantic scenes with an embarrassed looking Michael Huisman are pretty dreadful. And even that turned out to be a waste of time.

I don't fancy myself as someone that even dislikes Zack Snyder in general. I liked some of his work. I liked Dawn of the Dead, 300, and I actually really enjoyed Man of Steel.

But he needs to hire better writers and to stop taking himself so damn seriously. Just have some fun for once.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: The Director's Cut is the one to see
review_detailed_main:
Although I can relate to some of the reviews regarding the original movies, I found that the Director's cut felt somehow like a different movie altogether. I was reluctant to watch the director's cut, but once you make the choice, you won't regret it. And yes, it is a Zack Snyder movie, and his cut is defintely more like him.

There are still a lot of questions that remain unanswered (the sisters that power the ships, the future of the kingdom and the robot to name a few, there are more), but that is either left open for your own imagination like a good sci fi should, or it leaves an opening for yet another sequel. Either way suits me just fine.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I rated part One a strong 6 to 6.5. Sure that's Average or "Mid" (not a bad thing). The PG13 cuts are slick corporate products at the end of the day.

Part Two is a strong 7 to 7.5.

Yeah the slow motion is cool, the music bangs, the visuals are legendary, sure, sure. We already knew Zack would deliver in these areas. The protagonists story, that's is where Kora stands apart from her contemporaries.

Snyder is doing stuff that no other director has the stones to do. Kora is the one.

As the battle wrapped up, I couldn't shake the feeling that this still feels incomplete.

Not sure if it's a marketing trick or I if simply need more cowbell.

In summary, "It gave what needed to be given"

The next re-watch will be a 4 hour experience.

Bring on the Snydercut of these movies.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
During the total run time I could only think that the director of this movie created "300". How could a guy who created 300, deprived of creativity this much. Unnecessary forced slow motion cuts. Dumbest script. Flat & long emotional scenes that nobody invest in. Cut & paste old action scenes with space weapons..low levels of creativity. Bad acting as the top icing. Literaly first hal of the movie was without any action, just main characters TALKING about how sad thier lives were and trying desperately to attache us to the characters but failing.

I don't know maybe they made it so fast as a cash grab after the first one for NetFlix. What do I have to give to see another movie like 300???

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
"Rebel Moon" is graphically impeccable, and the main antagonist is quite impressive, but that's where the positives end. The script is a disaster, feeling like it belongs in the era of "Idiocracy" with its complete lack of logic and incessant nonsense that seems to bother no one.

From the get-go, with the lengthy scythe reaping of grain, I found myself wondering whether this was a film or an attempt to hypnotize the viewer. Worse still are the chaotic fight scenes where heroes waste ammunition shooting at each other from close range and missing, reminiscent of the worst clichés from "Star Wars" - but without any charm. Really, continuously charging headlong into machine gun fire is true torture.

Another issue is the pacing of the narrative. "Rebel Moon" stubbornly turns every potentially exciting moment into a test of the viewer's patience. The action slows are so predictable and artificial that instead of building tension, they merely prompt yawns.

In summary, "Rebel Moon" could have been a cinematic hit if only someone had devoted more time to refining the script instead of allocating all resources to special effects. It's a production that, despite a dazzling facade, is internally empty and irritatingly absurd. For fans of special effects who can overlook the lack of any narrative coherence, it might be tolerable, but for the rest, it's nothing more than a frustrating waste of potential.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Again Snyder's Cinematography is appalling.

The whole look and feel is something akin to a 1970's episode of Dr Who and compared to a film like The Creator is risible.

The universe created is a cross between Vikings and The Teletubbies, with Michael Huisman looking frankly bemused through out when cast in, the humble farmer in need of help,role.

At least Charlie Humdrum has gone, but there is a reason why Huisman replaced Skrein in Game of Thrones after one episode.

He is two dimensional and has a very limited range, hence the sparse number of appearances over the years, but at least he doesn't attempt some Kind of dodgy accent.

The rest of the cast are not great and even Djimon Honsou seems lost with the sub Henry the fifth dialogue.

That hits on another major issue.

Not since Lucas's terrible Star Wars re-boot has a "major" film contained such terrible dialogue which at least Anthony Hopkins avoid looking embarrassed by, being a robot and all.

All in all a saga to be consigned to the same bin as The Revenge of the Sith etc.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Very good and it is like first Star Wars but actually better. Difference is Star Wars came a long time ago and was new and pretty fantastic when it came.

This isn't new, but pretty much the same storyline and much, much better actors, CGI etc.

It is a pitty this wasn't released in cinemas. Streaming is destroying the experience since I'd say half of the experience of watching a film like this os lost not watching it on a silver screen.

Really enjoyd these two films and hope there is a third one coming... like the first Three Star Wars the story needs a third episode to wrap it up.

So give these to movies a chance. See it undesturbed in a dark room on a big TV set with good sound.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Kora (Sofia Boutella) returns to Veldt with the farmer Gunnar (Michiel Huisman) and the warriors Titus (Djimon Hounsou), Nemesis (Bae Doona), Darrian Bloodaxe (Ray Fisher) and Tarak (Staz Nair). Titus commands the defense of the farmers and asks them to harvest the grains and use them to protect their homes. While waiting for Atticus Noble (Ed Skrein) and his men, they disclose their pasts waiting for the showdown with the mother world's force.

As I mentioned in my review of Part One, Rebel Moon uses the storyline of "Seven Samurai" adapted to a sci-fi. "Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver!, however, is a predictable and boring adventure that follows the Netflix's standard (one black warrior, one Asian warrior, one gay warrior, a powerful - but this time, not beautiful that looks like an androgynous man - lead woman). The plot entwins the past of each other in order to complete the two hours' time schedule. The pacific farmers win the empire, with weapons, tanks is a little too much, isn't it? The worthwhile thing to see are the magnificent special effects. My vote is six.

Title (Brazil): "Rebel Moon - Parte 2: A Marcadora de Cicatrizes" ("Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scars Marker")

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I despise zach snyder. I despised the first rebel moon, however I thought maybe since the spent a whole two hour movie setting up for the next one, I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and maybe it will be worth watching. It was one of the worst pieces of fiction I've ever consumed. Credit where its due some of the scenes were cool looking but i was so uninterest I didn't really care.

No hate to the actors because they were all brilliant but the characters in this film were despicable. They were all diabolical. Literally all the development we get on the characters is a conversation where each character takes turns explaining their backstories. Can you get any lazier than that???? As a result whenever there was a character death I didn't really care because I'd literally no idea who the character was.

One of the worst 2 hours ever. The whole plot is an incoherent mess with stupid little cuts that don't make sense. NO ONE WANTS THE SNYDER CUT FOR REBEL MOON. As soon as the extended editions come out (if you're gonna release a film and be like it'll get good when the extended edition comes out ur either high or really stupid) I'm gonna trash them too. Literally the whole movie was preparation for a stupid battle scene. Might be the least progressive action movie to ever exist. 0.1/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Just watched both back to back, was more fun than most things i've watched in the last year. Dunno anything about these weird tar wars comparisons and names or books, but watching it from beginning to end, it was fun. Some decent action, some fun characters. Only downside is that that there isn't more right now.

Well, i wish certain characters had more screen time and were more impactful also, but whatcha gonna do. All in all, it wasnt nearly as bad as any of the reviews i've been reading. In fact i think it's alot better than many of the things it was being compared to. Dont really understand the hate.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: In my opinion, rebel moon 2 better than dune 2, first of all, this is not a film made for awards, and this is felt from start to finish, have some scene similiar with star wars, it kept me in suspense for the entire duration and I must say that the special effects are well done, some excess but not much, the film is enjoyable and action nice, outstanding and what an ending, unfortunately, it doesn't have any overwrought superheroes, so I can see why most people are so upset by a film they weren't forced to watch, but much better than expected, with tons of action and great acting, the movie was great with intense moments and really stunning effects. Enjoy the movie, without any bias and you will have a splendid time!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Great actors. Such a dumb screenplay and writing. This was pure torture to watch. Suffered almost every minute and it was never-ending. Such a waste of pretty much everything. Hope they won't make any other movies, or at least with a different director or proper writers. I just watched it to see if there's anything potentially surprising. This was such a pain. Save your time from watching this and rather go see friends. Those characters are nobodies playing as if they were epic. Most laughable are the Kens with axes who battle against laser weapons 😃 But surely they must look cool in the first place 🙄

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Like the first part, the movie is very weak, the intellectual level is kindergarten-level. The actors' lines are of rare stupidity, the story likewise, the script seems as if it were made by young children.

The characters lack true motivation, the decisions they make are nonsensical, except for relatively good cinematography and some fairly okay CGI special effects, the rest is below the level of a DVD movie.

Zack Snyder disappoints once again with a cinematic production of the lowest caliber at all levels.

A very bad film from all points of view.

If there were a rating lower than 1, I would give it, because no one will ever bring back the hours lost watching this cinematic garbage... I'm glad it was on Netflix and not in the theater, so I could fast forward through many boring scenes.

A film to be avoided!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Yes, this movie received way too much hate, more than likely from a Star Wars crazed audience. I've never liked that series for it's dated look and trashy sci-fi tropes. This was something new and different.

Sure there was some repetitive stuff and not the greatest of acting but the CGI and slomo cinematography made up for any lack.

I do feel someone's obsession with shaved heads was a little overdone in this movie and it distracted from what was already an arguably weak story...

Do we need a complicated plot in order to follow a movie today? I don't think so. At the end of the day, a movie should be fun and entertaining.

Rebel Moon is all that and more.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Every bit of dialogue is a speech with little to no meaning. No one talks like any of these characters in real life. The romance is unbelievable and completely unnecessary. The story line is not interesting, and far fetched. Villagers propose a deal that would ultimately result in their destruction because they trust the opposing party to keep their word when they have shown over the course of two movies that they never keep their word. Simply a terrible movie.

The fight scenes are much worse than the first movie and are improbable to say the least. People die from what appear to be minor wounds and other characters make full recoveries. Characters that fought for the empire seem to have no clue of its capabilities. Makes absolutely no sense.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Weaker of the two but still good (just about)
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver is actually weaker than Part One. It's a film of two halves as it spends the first half focusing on slow motion farming instead of character development which really hinders the stakes of the final battle. However, that second half is just an hour long battle so it's worth it overall.

Sofia Boutella is still able to give Kora a level of depth that exceeds what's on the page. Djimon Hounsou gets so much more to do and the added depth that he, Bae Doona and Staz Nair get is welcome even if it still isn't enough. Ed Skrein might be the best though with his thoroughly evil performance.

Zack Snyder's direction remains as visually stylish as ever. He's at his strongest in the second half when the focus is on making cool action scenes with his trademark slow motion but the use of that is really beginning to border on self parody. Flaws and all, it's still nice to see a Netflix blockbuster that feels like it was made by a human more than an algorithm.

When it was first announced that both parts were made for around $160 million it sounded so impressive and it still is but this one being set almost exclusively on the one farm makes this universe feel real small. Tom Holkenborg's score has the required bombast and sincerity whilst coming dangerously close to copying his work on Batman V Superman.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Seven Samurai but 7 hours without any emotion
review_detailed_main:
This is a prolonged and I do mean that because there are no less than 20 slow motion shots at every chance they get. It is a colossal waste of time effort and money. They spent the money on effects but didn't bother to write a script didn't bother to develop characters didn't bother to make the viewer emotionally invested.

Yet another bloated Hollywood / Netflix streaming hoping to capture your attention. Don't bother and watch the far superior original seven samurai from which this was ripped off. Or if you want to watch a Western then watch the magnificent seven or even the terrible remake the magnificent seven is 100 times better than this prolonged agony.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: A lot of harsh reviews here, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. I liked part 1 and this is bigger and better. Action from start to finish. Excellent FX and the characters are given more of a back story. It's rushed in over a quick group confessional, but it's enough to give them reason to fight and a reason for us to actually give a damn about them. I like Snyder as a director and I enjoy his style and story telling. It's not a perfect film, but it's a good story and left open for more, which I hope happens. There's a whole unverise out there for them to explore. You can tell Holkenborg has worked with Hans Zimmer. The score is strong and emotional. Sit back and just enjoy the ride.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A slow-mo, cringe-fest nightmare. All style, no substance.
review_detailed_main:
It is little wonder that this ended on the most derivative and unoriginal streaming service.

It is even worse than the first part. From the slow motion being over used, even in the harvesting of wheat (!!!), to the feeling that this could have perfectly been the last 15 minutes of a 90 minute movie, and not four bloody hours.

Ed Shrkein is cartoonishly evil, Sofia Boutella seems to have the range of a constipated beetroot, and Zack has seemingly relegated the writing of the script to ChatGpt.

And that ending... Zack obviously wants to keep churning more episodes of this tripe. Let's hope Crapflix sees that it is really not worth it.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: an act of obscene conceptual terrorism: snyder has liberated the concept of star wars from Star Wars without paying Disney a dime.
review_detailed_main:
This is Snyder effectively curbstomping Lucas and Disney, who never had a chance of producing anything of this caliber. Rebel Moon is better at star wars than Star Wars by every possible metric. This is just a fact. There's no grounds for debate, and it isn't close. Unhampered by a busted failure of a canon, space wizard incest shenanigans, manipulative muppetry, or trash hippie metaphysics, RM presents an extravagant and gloriously integrated audiovisual spectacle with delightful, delicate conceptual twists on genre conceits in abundance. The PG-13 version works well enough for what it is, but you're really gonna want to do yourself a favor here and pick up the clearly definitive and quite ultraviolent R-rated directors cut.

While there may not be much left to say about tributary mode politics - which is what this is about, attempted Nazi gloss notwithstanding - what Rebel Moon does have to say it says directly, with sincerity, honesty, and conviction, it being a film that has somehow escaped the last half century of irony poisoning completely unscathed. And what, exactly, does it say?

That it is better to die on your feet than live on your knees. That freedom can only be realized together. That love and war aren't that far apart. That respecting your landbase and your fellow flora and fauna is cool and good actually. That small bands of militant guerillas can beat a high tech, high energy totalitarian empire - and even perhaps that they are the one of the only things that ever could.

Rarely have I seen such a singular synthetic totality realized this absolutely. Snyder has performed an act of gargantuan cojones here, a kind of almost unspeakably obscene conceptual terrorism (but I'll speak it anyways): he has liberated the concept of star wars from Star Wars without paying Lucas or Disney a dime.

What a game. What a player.

Dear internet: your inability to appreciate this masterpiece is a you problem, a skill issue, and what this says about your maturity, values, intellect and character ain't great. You've been watching pablum for so long you've forgotten that a true film demands its own interpretive apparatus - and ya'll only have the one, don'cha?

Pathetic - but your failure to enjoy greatly enhances my enjoyment. It's a like 9.8 on its own merits, points knocked off for a dull and self-indulgent ending to pt. 2, but 11/10 for the scrub tears.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: So many scathing reviews but I think it's an enjoyable watch. Sure, it's not perfect: a couple of clunky maneuvers in fight scenes here and there; a handful of scenes that could've been acted with more emotion; and certain characters could've benefitted from more development. But for all of the aforementioned flaws, there are double the successes. The story is better fleshed out than a fair amount of other sci-fi action flicks; the fight scenes are overall pretty good; the acting in the majority of the film was good; and the graphics quality is really strong. This movie got me emotionally invested in the story and the characters: I found myself rooting for the protagonists and some of the supporting characters, and hating the antagonists. If the movie elicits an emotional response in me, it's doing something right. This isn't gonna win any awards, but it's not nearly as bad as some reviews would lead you to believe. I, for one, honestly liked it and am looking forward to the next installment (hopefully we get another installment). Give it a shot and decide for yourself.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
A very shallow, very tropey, very cardboard space opera that takes itself with great seriousness and pathos. There are some pretty visuals and prettier actors. If you're tired and feel like switching your brain off for a couple of hours, or if corny, ridiculous space operas are your guilty pleasure, you might enjoy this. I actually did :) Even though I don't think that's what the director thought he was creating.

But (speaking of the director) someone please tell Mr. Snyder to cut down on the slow motion scenes. I imagine he means them as deep or philosophical, but they just look so painfully pretentious.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: It's been almost 2 weeks of repetitive attempts to watch this movie, even though I strongly disliked the first movie I've decided to give it a shot. It says something about a movie when already on 15th minute stops being watchable.. My honest opinion: The scene with the royal family assassination is a copy paste Ceasar movie scene, only very bad one, the 7 samurais in Star Wars movies, the read servants and Bene Gesserit Sisterhood cheap knockoff (Dune), the Vikings rip off in harvesting village- and somehow he managed to "get inspired" by the Witcher the origin story and Star Trek strange new worlds (there's probably much more but it was too painful to watch) There's this idea of The rebel moon being a new universe, but the reality is it is a very bad mashup of all old well known and respected universes (movies) Music is not corresponding, scenes are forced and very badly organised, dialogues seem written by kindergarten kids exercise, slow motion is exaggerated and unnecessary in 99%, the story is unrelatable and inconsistent (ST strange new worlds CAN have this jump from highly developed planet to one from Stone Age BECAUSE THEY ARE JUST DISCOVERING THEM, it doesn't work if they're the part of the same empire !) the acting is very sadly bad, surprisingly so for the quality actors. I still haven't finished the movie, cannot convince myself on torture. There are people dying from hunger and Netflix decided to spend millions on bad references to already existing good movies.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Just to see Sofia Boutella, both films are worth it. Wow. Furthermore, the film is entertaining and has amazing special effects. I don't agree with the IMDb score. The script is simple, but the film aims to entertain and showcase Sofia in all her splendor. It clearly achieves this. Additionally, the action sequences are thrilling, and the cinematography enhances the overall experience. The supporting cast also delivers solid performances, adding depth to the story. Overall, it's a visually stunning and enjoyable watch that should not be missed.

Netflix is doing great work and keep adding great movies.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Please I beg you... no more

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Leaves a Scar in the Cinematic Experience
review_detailed_main:
The Scargiver is a visually stunning sci-fi epic that immerses viewers in a captivating interstellar adventure. The film's second half is an exhilarating rollercoaster ride of action, drama, and breathtaking special effects that make it a must-watch for fans of the genre.

While the movie delivers an enthralling second act, the first hour might test the patience of some viewers, as it seems to drag on with a somewhat slow pace. However, once the story gains momentum, it becomes an unforgettable cinematic experience. The character development and world-building are commendable, but the initial sluggishness detracts from what could have been a consistently engaging narrative.

Nevertheless, Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver ultimately triumphs with its impressive visuals, compelling storyline, and thrilling action sequences. It's a worthy addition to the sci-fi genre, providing enough excitement and intrigue to satisfy even the most discerning fans.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: And I thought the first one smelled bad...
review_detailed_main: Get that line? I cribbed it from The Empire Strikes Back. Why not? Every single idea in this terrible, boring, too much slow motion film is cribbed from another. Star Wars, the Last Samurai, 300.... The list goes on and on and on and on and on and on. Why so much repetition? Well it equals all the Snyder Cultists insisting how great a filmmaker he is. Here's a Clue: He and Shymalan should never be allowed money ever again to make a movie. A galactic empire needs to loot a planet of grain? Really? That's right from the Seven Samurai where the bad guys are coming for the harvest. I can understand this in medieval Japan, but a GALACTIC EMPIRE? The dialogue in this mess is beyond corny. Beyond bad. Beyond beyond. Snyder doesn't have an original idea. I don't know how much Netflix sank into this trash, but this must be where their decision to move away from big budget came from. This is just a laughably bad movie. It almost makes Sucker Punch - I still want my money back for this - look good.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Who would have thought there were so many Snyder haters who are just desperate to mark down his movie!!

Do yourself a favour and watch it for yourself - it may not be perfect, but it's certainly not a turkey!!

Better pacing and doesn't feel as rushed as the first one, great improvement and can't wait to see the extended version of part one.

There's not even that much slow motion In it - if it wasn't there you'd miss some great sequences! Enjoyable Sunday afternoon movie, great action sequences and great cgi - Zack most definitely knows how to get value for money for what money he's given!! 👏👍

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Why the HATE. I made my own mind up.
review_detailed_main:
Like everything I watch films, series and even music, I ignore the reviews, its my taste. When choosing what to watch I decide on the theme, content and who is casted. I watched both Part 1 & 2 back to back in one day. And I was engrossed, totally enjoyed the films.

The first was better than second and there was an element of Magnificent Seven/Fifth Element/Star Wars and video game Wolfenstein. Make your own mind up. The reviews are way too harsh and everyone is trying to be a critic, there opinions and I'll make my own. P.1- 8/10. P.2- 7/10.

I liked the World's created and the visuals were well done. People just seem to rip media apart. The plot was simple and that's enough I just enjoyed the ride and I felt the characters pain, hope, drive for peace from war and find a place called home.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's possible , it's worse then first
review_detailed_main: Trash tier movie with some nice visuals , obvs stolen for every other sci fi movie/franchise . Wants to be space seven samurai . Instead it's the planet junk without Eric idol . Studios please stop giving this person money to waste . Plot awful makes little sense . Dialogue is also b movie level junk . Couple of actors work far above the quality of rest of movie . Cool that the main baddie looks like a commissar leading a unit of imperial guard. Let's make a strong sci fi female , eermmmmm let's just have vasquez clone as lead, but less badass . Movie would probs be about 30 mins less if not for all the annoying slomo .

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Hollow characters , nonsensical fights , pointless storyline , pointless slowmotions , laughable decisions you can not find a single lements that makes you to watch till the end protagonist and antagonist didn't made it to a characters , zack snyder just want it to stretch the movie with unreasonable fights and slow motion and yelling and explosions ! I gave it 2 just because of 2 scenes that even that two scenes was mediocre. You can not find a single element of movie and cinema in this title that you can rely on it and say YEAH let's not be that harsh on it . Unfortunately this was a disaster !

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Two hours of a hot mess!
review_detailed_main: The first one was horrible, I didn't think it could get any worse but this one outshines it. Where do I begin? Jack snyder should just quit story telling at this point. I actually feel genuine pity for the actors, they must have endured alot having to enact such a disaster. Firstly,the movie could have been way shorter than two hours, absolutely nothing happened in the first hour of the movie, you might as well skip a full hour if you decide to sit through this torture because you won't be missing anything at all. He just combined stories of different plots and combined it together to make a movie. The movie was such a drag,nothing exciting,lacks creativity. Just sit this one out.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I saw the movie before I read several of the reviews here. It does not get the love it deserves.

Yes, the acting is sub par and the story line is slim. The action scenes and the special effects are good.

It takes a while in the movie to find out as viewer who the protagonist is of the story.

Her background and past get a much larger role in the time the story progresses. I think that we will see more of it in part 2.

The BBEG is portraited very nicely and the actor has shown a very evil carackter.

As in other movies the suspence is build up slowly and there is a good ending for the cliffhanger building up to part 2.

Sorry if my English was not clear but I hope that it is readable.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Review is only for the first 45 minutes as that's all me n the lad could suffer. The first film was a watchable mess, this one's just embarrassing

The good - it's in 4k ?

The bad - no story, wooden acting(no one seams to care), constant unneeded slow motion shots, non stop dramatic music, NO STORY

Sorry, it's only my (and 11 year old son's) opinion, but everything is bad about this film - even the zero atmosphere effects. It's hard to imagine how it got the go ahead. Hopefully it doesn't do the numbers and studios get cold feet on spending mental amounts of money on s##t like this. Painfully bad stuff.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Everything but the kitchen sink. Literally. And not in a good way...
review_detailed_main:
This is what would happen if one mixes a hefty dose of LSD with equal portions of Star Wars and 7 samurai, seasoned with a kick of 300 and even a sprinkle of Avatar, Dune, and the Robot.

This unfortunate hotchpotch ultimately goes down as some sort of half-baked delirium fantasy that valiantly tries all and brilliantly fails at everything.

The whole story basically revolves around just one man's madness, and that tyrant (Balisarius) doesn't even act (literally or figuratively). Instead, he has some sort of puppet (Atticus) do his bidding.

Nothing makes any sense, whatsoever. The characters are still underdeveloped, there is no tension or any ideal at stake.

Even the number of heroes casualties is disappointing... It is almost like Zach envisions spinoffs, which is not visionary. It is just lame...

At the end, I was waiting for Anakin to show up or at least for the single character that died doing the right thing to rise as a Force ghost...

Did I say "lame"? Perhaps head-scratching is more adequate. That acid must have been good stuff.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: The Snyder Cut make this an epic space adventure!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Warhammer 40K Lite With A Seven Samurai Spin Part Two
review_detailed_main:
Watched Rebel Moon Part Two:The Scargiver With Sofia Boutella(Star Beyond,Atomic Blonde) as Kora, Michael Huisman(Instant Family) as Gunnar, Bae Donna(Jupiter Ascending) as Nemesis, Staz Nair(Rye Lane) as Tarak, Spike Ray Fisher(Zack Snyders Justice League) as Darrian Bloodaxe, Cleopatra Coleman(Dopesick) as Devra Bloodaxe,,Charlotte Maggi as Sam, Fra Fee(Pixie) as Balsirious, Ed Skrein(Deadpool,Alita:Battle Angel) as Atticus Noble and Sir Anthony Hopkins(Silence Of The Lambs) as Jimmy.

I felt this was a bit derative also Sir Anthony Hopkins had the best performance while i understad dividing into two parts it seems it didnt benefit the story at all even The Pitch Black Trilogy even Jupiter Ascending is better than this its it still more of the same though i do want to see Part 3 at least Warhammer Lite with a Samurai Spin Part Two .

Producing From Debroah Snyder(300) , and Direction By Zack Snyder(Army of The Dead) and Amazing Score from Tom Holkenberg(Godzilla Vs Kong) Warhammer 40K Lite With A Seven Samurai Spin Part Two 7/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Worthless watch. Save your time, skip this movie
review_detailed_main: This movie was so boring, uninteresting and waste of time. There are no fight scenes till 1 hr in a 2 hr movie. The dialogues are so boring, there are silly songs happening in the background which are so cringy. The special effects at places look terrible. There are set pieces in the movie where everyone shares their back story, which was so cliched. If Part 1 was terrible, part 2 is terrible 2.0. How much money was spent on making this movie. Zack Snyder is not a good director, he can make good set pieces but cannot write a good story or direct a great movie. STRONGLY ADVICE TO SKIP this series. NETFLIX WASTES so much money on this unnecessary trilogy. Instead they can make a whole series on WARHAMMER.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: AI, can you make an 2 hour A-Team episode in Star Wars universe in the style of "300"?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's a good movie, better than the first one.
review_detailed_main:
As a Synder fan, I wasn't satisfied with Rebel Moon Part 1. However, this sequel has more than made up for its predecessor's shortcomings, and I enjoyed it immensely. Instead of two separate films, Zack should have made a 3+ hours-long movie.

Despite the predictable story, it still manages to captivate me. The characters' backstories are well-developed, giving them a strong motivation to fight for Veldt. However, the robot "James" lacks any meaningful arc explaining his peculiar attire. Nonetheless, his presence as a spectator over the village reminded me of Ephialtes from 300 and as a superhero during the battle.

Zack's slow-motion effects may be slightly overused and the cinematography is decent in comparison to his other works.

In my opinion, if Lucasfilm had allowed Zack to make these films under the Star Wars franchise, they would have been better spin-offs. There would have been no need to waste time creating worlds and cultures for this story to be made as films.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and would recommend it without hesitation. I'm eagerly anticipating seeing it become a franchise.

Ratings for this movie seems unfair.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder added twice the slow motion because everyone complained about it
review_detailed_main: Knowing that he tried to pitch Disney that this would be a great star wars movie simply by copying seven samurai just tells you how creative he really is. Julius Caesar scene? Really? The entire village is about to burn to the ground and Zack Snyder is adding immense amount of slow motion, giving enough time for the bad guys to do invade. The entire village would have been obliterated due to the slowness of cutting crops and running very slowly. On top of that the amount of sun glares, light flares... everything is flaring and hazy. How can you have both of them at the same time? Either the entire universe is polluted and hazy but crispy enough to provide immense amount of glare/flares. It doesn't make sense. When Lora and the general was talking the sun didn't even match their conversation, horrible attention to detail. Useless scenes. Call it what is is... Copy seven samurai and add space and star wars. He added more slow motion in part two than part one... I think he did on purpose due to the amount of people complaining about it. Viewer discretion advice. The amount of slow lotion and flares is appalling.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
A lot of reviewers seem to have expected the second coming of... I don't know? Star Wars? It's not that. The writing isn't any worse than most animes, the special effects are quite good, there are practical effects and sets and the CGI looks good too. The second part here is mostly a lot of sci-fi battling between guerillas and a superior military force. Viscerally, that's enjoyable... there's plenty of lasers and explosions and guns and tanks to go around.

This second part is much more straightforward than the first. The first was bogged down by the worldbuilding Snyder had to do, or felt he had to do, to get the characters involved... and ultimately we didn't necessarily need ALL those characters. This second part is a little preamble to the big battle and then, yeah, big battle.

So... having watched all manner of sci-fi "epics" over time, this certainly is a Zack Snyder sci-fi "epic." I can feel the effort that went into it. I can also see the parallels to Star Wars, because Snyder couldn't DO Star Wars. I'll dare say... this is better than some current Star Wars, like The Acolyte. I don't hate The Acolyte, but for anyone who wanted more "cool factor" in Star Wars... here you go. This has some cool factor. A very comic-booky, pulpy movie from the guy who does a lot of those fairly faithfully to what makes something comic-booky.

Try not to overthink this one. It's just a slightly better Michael Bay film about space totalitarians being showed up by plucky rebel fighters.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I'm still trying to wrap my head around the intense backlash surrounding this film. While the first installment had its fair share of flaws, but I believe this sequel has made significant strides in improvement. While it's not a flawless movie, it has its own unique strengths. The CGI is impressive, the cinematography is stunning, the soundtrack is engaging, the performances are decent and the story is passable. If you enjoyed the world Snyder created in the prequel, you'll likely appreciate this sequel to be a worthy follow-up. It offers a glimmer of hope for future projects that are coming down in the Rebel Moon universe.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Why are these films being made?
review_detailed_main:
Part 1 was an absolute crime against filmmaking. Why is this being allowed to continue? Netflix are just taking peoples cash and burning it right in front of their eyes. Zak Snyder is an absolute dud, who wrecked DC, he tried to wreck Star Wars and was denied the opportunity and this is the excrement that came from that.

If anyone can name me a Snyder film that is good I'd love to hear it. It's a funny coincidence that a "Snyder" in the uk is something that is just absolute trash. This guy would struggle to serve a hamburger to you, let alone shoot an epic space opera over a reported 6 films that absolutely NO ONE wants to see.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's so far from common sense, it's painful.
review_detailed_main:
People say rom com movies are bad... you haven't seen this sequel. As much potential it has, the screenwriting is so dumb and boring. It seems as if it was high school assignment.

Somehow in a village that created an impression a maximum of 150 people lived... for a war of that size at least 2k must have died... In 5 days they achieved so much as if they were gods from Marvel not farmers.

The emperor needs the grain when they have machines to revive dead brains?! Somehow they invented that but couldn't make fertilizeze... And what's with all the slow motion every 10min of fight?

Oh man, it was painful to watch.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: movie is actually better than the IMDb rating. Don't get influenced
review_detailed_main:
Minuses (first hour). Before I cleared my mind off the rating on IMDb:

it's trying to be much more epic than it actually is - until 30:47, it does not give a proper scenario to assume the epicness declared through music and events


filming is not that great, and a high-quality framework does not give high-quality content; plus, it has some random events that do not add up; (plus) the transition from one sequence to another is rushed/ does not leave an impact






Break. Movie after 59:20..







You almost never see a tert in movies have at it, not to mention, destroy not one, but two enemy ships. One character even did challenge Atticus Noble to one-on-one combat; died, but still an achieve.

Edit: Damn...







Overall:





It's a 7, final, for me - that's an upper limit, though.

Edit: the director's cut is extraordinary.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: It took me 3 tries before I managed to finish this movie. It is horribly written, quite boring for at least the first half of the movie and filled with too many slow motion scenes. Some scenes already had slow motion and then he proceeds to add even more slow motion them, completely absurd. Not to mention that some of the action sequences were poorly choreographed. The big reveal at the ending was so poorly executed and underwhelming, I couldn't believe how lame it was. Overall, if you really do chose to watch this movie, just remember to switch off your brain. Otherwise, you will be like me, getting frustrated every 15 mins.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: After a promising Part 1, Scargiver flounders

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Regret watching this film, should have watched somebody play farming simulator on YouTube instead.
review_detailed_main: For starters this film is absolutely atrocious. From the 2 hours of farming with 1 hour of it being in slow motion, to the antagonist's obsession with wheat? I get some people love their morning weetabix, but is this too far? Furthermore the main characters seem to be invincible with not a single bullet touching any of them and the soldiers being brain dead and oblivious to any plans despite their 'thermal aerial tech'. Overall terrible film, those who rated this film about 3 might have watched a different film? I'm not too sure, will have to ask whether they have an obsession with wheat too..

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
When a movie called Icyclone has. 6.1 on IMDb, you just know that these 2 movies are getting bashed by Zack Snyder haters.

Is this Star Wars? Absolutely not.

I went in to these movies not expecting too much but I did enjoy them. The acting was okay. I thought that Sofia Boutella and Djimon Hounsou did a great job with the script they were given. The special effects were astounding and the finale was awesome. Yes, the slow motion could have been toned down a bit, but it wasn't as bad as everyone makes it out to be.

So when I see ratings for terrible, terrible movies like Icyclone, with it's photoshop effects getting higher scores then Rebel Moon Part 1 and 2... something's going on.

It's the haters!!! Lol.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: One of the worst movies you could ever see. Deserves walking out. The movie just can't stop with the slow-mo scenes, which honestly feels like a rerun from Justice League's special edition. And let's talk about the writing-it's like they threw spaghetti at a wall and hoped it would stick, but didn't even look at the result. Sure, the costumes and spaceships look cool, but it's missing that emotional punch that makes you care about what's happening on screen. Dull, repetitive, generic, uneventful. Just another action flick and moneygrab scifi. Not realistic, not captivating, like watching a fireworks show without anything you'd ever care about. Looks nice, but will bore your brains.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I thought it was entertaining! I give it 8 stars.
review_detailed_main: Once again, just like I said in Part One, maybe you guys watched it on a tiny screen. I watched it on a 120-inch screen, with 5.1 speakers, hehehe. I liked it! Sure it borrowed a lot of concepts from other movies mainly Seven Samurai / 47 Ronin. Sure the concept/story isn't unique/original. But I thought it was entertaining. That's the whole point right? I even re-watched Part One just before watching Part Two. I think both movies are at 7.5 to 8 stars. One criticism: Not a fan of the haircut. I'd go for the Underworld hairstyle. Looking forward to Part Three. I am definitely looking forward to a Director's/Snyder's Cut.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A Masterpiece of Agricultural Life in Slow Motion

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: This movie is an odd mix between cringeworthy bad moments and spots of awesomeness. It certainly is not what I would call great but it reaches an overall ok/enjoyable and there are aspects I really liked. The visuals are stunning yet overblown - like in 300 or in an Anime. But once you accept that, it is fun to watch. Too much slow-mo for my taste, but it's Snyder. The style is coherent and well designed - I enjoyed the overall looks. The acting had huge variations. Some great moments, some really bad ones. I liked the interpretation of the 7 Samurai theme but the characters did not get the development they would have needed. And I definitely would have chosen a different character to die in battle. But overall my inner scifi-geek had a good time in front of the screen. Hence a 6/10 instead of a 4/10 (which would be my movie critic vote - but with that metric I would have had to vote the last two Star Wars movies 3/10).

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I have never seen more slow motion scenes in one big budget movie. It's almost like the film only has 0.5x playback speed enabled. That's the only reason it's 2 hours in length.

The story is horrendous. The need for grain has never been more overstated than in this film. And yes there are slow motion scenes of people gathering grain. And boy are these scenes excruciatingly looooong.

The looseness of plot is unsettling. Sloppy writing all over the place. The number of times the main characters could have simply ended the movie by easily finishing the villain was wild. The inability for entire squadrons of modern infantry to get even on shot on a character wielding only axes and a six-pack, is staggering.

The special effects, the ships, the weapons and the effects showing weapon blast effects are incredible. But those are the only aspects worth rating positively.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I laughed so hard watching this movie I couldn't give it less of a score
review_detailed_main:
What is this universe? They got intergalactic ships with slow cranking cannons, guns that shoot lava, tanks with diesel engines, but no farming equipment? Seriously the first half of the movie was people manually harvesting wheat. Did they forget about the friendly robot roaming around contemplating its existence?!

The whole premise "give me your harvest or we will kill you" is lame and they carried it over from the first movie. Yikers. There is zero indication from anywhere in this garbbo universe that anyone or anything needs or wants that wheat!

Ok ok, chill, remember this is an action flick not a two brain cell storyteller. Enjoy the theater system and eat your popcorn right? Nope, the action is brutal to watch, everyone misses their shots! All the action is slow-mo and zoomed in so you don't notice the poor choreography execution and terrible aim. These people are clearly shooting 5-10 feet away from each other with no cover and the only tactic is to show up, everyone line up in a row and start shooting.

Enjoy the laughs, this movie is ridiculous.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not gonna review the movie for what it's not
review_detailed_main:
Let's be straight and honest. It's Snyder's movie with all of its bells and whistles. Will you get great acting? No. Will you get dramatic plot and storytelling? No. Will you get great action and stunning old-school visuals with tons of bullet time? Hell yes. Tons of it.

The plot is not the greatest, far from it. It's not Dune. It doesn't have well thought out lore as Lucasfilm's Star Wars. And to be honest, I find it kind of refreshing. A movie you won't remember for anything but amazing CGI and great fight scenes. I'm not expecting anything else from Zack's movies.

People may compare it to Star Wars, and to be quite honest, I was much less insulted by Rebel Moon 1 and 2 than new trilogy under Disney's all-seeing eye.

RM is its own thing. A great, ridiculously high budget B-tier thing. Its plot is cohesive so far (at least that little bit of plot that's hiding there), even though a little bit too easy to digest for my taste.

In my opinion (for which you can downvote me all the way down), Rebel Moon franchise is now amongst my top 10 action focused scifi franchises. Because I simply like what it is, and it doesn't give me any space to dislike it for what it isn't. That's how simple this movie is.

If I should compare it to something from real life scenario, Rebel Moon is like an A-class hooker. It's beautiful, it's not the smartest and you won't find there the meaning of life or your next wife. You visit it just for visually stunning fun that you might regret visiting 2 days after you're done with it. And I find it beautiful.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Spaceship powered by coal?? Genius!!! LOL

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Pulp sci fi, enjoyable, ignore the haters
review_detailed_main: What is up with hating on this movie and in particular Zack Snyder? It's a sci fi action inspired by dozens of other movies/games and best to describe it is: Seven Samurai mixed with pace opera. It's a ton of fun and the only reason I am giving this a 6/10 (gave the first one a 7) is the cringey dramatic non sense, reminded me of Return of the King with all the crying. It's taking itself too seriousy amidst all the fun action and explosions. Zack Snyder is definitely working on the next one and I will be there to watch it and so will you and others. They'll hate it but it will still be the nr. 1 movie on Netflix just like this one and the first one. So Rebel Moon 3, let's go!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A missed opportunity to clean up the first bad movie
review_detailed_main:
The latest installment in the franchise arrives with a sense of déjà vu, not because it evokes the original's charm, but because it inherits its predecessor's flaws and amplifies them. The sequel, much like the first, is a hastily assembled narrative that struggles to stitch together its plot points into a coherent tapestry.

Where the film does manage to shine, albeit briefly, is in its action sequences. These moments of adrenaline are choreographed with a finesse that almost makes you forget the story's shortcomings. Almost.

It's perplexing that the studio greenlit a sequel given the lukewarm reception of the original. Yet, here we are, and it seems the franchise is set to continue its trajectory with another follow-up. One can't help but wonder if the decision-makers are too deep in the franchise to course-correct.

In conclusion, this sequel is a missed opportunity to redeem the series. It's a film that will likely be watched out of loyalty or curiosity, but it won't be remembered for its artistic merit.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
