review_title: Considerably better than the first part
review_detailed_main:
Second part of "Rebel Moon" has noticeably improved over his disappointing predecessor, and that is mainly because of two reasons; one, the characters are more fleshed out and presented with opportunities where they can shine and stand out, and two, the action set pieces for whatever reason seem more polished than the last occasion.

All those big explosions, gunfights, and hand-to-hand combats looked more pleasing to the eyes. The issues with the CGI and editing still linger, though, they have been managed slightly better this time around. And in case you're wondering about the Slo-mos, yeah, you still have plenty. It is made by Snyder after all; you know he has to put those slow motion into work.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
What an amazingly epic second movie! Maybe the universe has some Warhammer 40K vibes, but I don't feel that's a negative point. I loved the analogue aspects of the technology/weapons/ships ect makes it feel like a more down to earth more real science Fiction adventure, it has great characters going through the age old story of the fighting for their home and their family found or otherwise. After setting things up in the first movie, part 2 is all out battle! Absolutely zero disappointments here. Can't wait for the next one!!

Not sure what's up with all the hate... if you like an adventure, epic fights and battle scenes, then you will enjoy this movie/universe!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: This movie is SO BAD i had to create an IMDB account to write about it
review_detailed_main:
Honestly, I am amazing at the level of *(#$(*$ that this movie represents. It is as if the directors took every single worse movie-making skill and plug it into a single creation. The movie has almost no plot, random characters, long intros about nothing, sad moments that are totally not sad because you as the viewer are so upset that you don't feel sorry for the characters but are rather cheering for them to die.

I can't say the acting is terrible because you can't judge an actor when they appears in a movie this bad. I just feel sorry for the people who participated in making this.

The only thing that was pretty decent were the special effects but I'm still giving this a 1 star (I wish I could give it negative stars but that's not an option) as this is a movie and not a special effects portfolio for a studio.

Please do yourself a favor and stay away from this unless you like pain.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
It is just another failed Star Wars wannabe movie. The different thing is very bad version. As an action movie it is okay, but when we want to enjoy good story then I consider it as B-.

When I read from some articles, the story is ment to be an adaptation of Kurosawa's 7 Samurai and Star Wars. I should say yes, however Snyder failed to develop the story. Snyder imagination to make the audience able to sit for 2 hours is totally wrong. A very boring movie. Big budget one but feels like as if a very cheap movie.

The special effects are average with present technology. Can't really help to reach certain 'wow effect' as I expected before.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I pretty much enjoyed part one of Rebel Moon, part two was good too but a bit too overdramatic and a bit too cliché-like which annoyed me a bit. The first hour was a bit boring not gonna lie, but the second hour was quite entertaining with a lot of action and pew pew. I am a bit surprised that the two movies got so many bad reviews, I know they are no blockbusters but it is still watchable and story has a lot of potential for sequels or presequels. I would definitely watch it they would make more movies of it I somehow like the story despite some people here calling it a bit blunt or shallow or whatever.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Beautifully shot. The actors were great. I feel like where Snyder always seems to fall short is in how he develops his characters. It was the same with Justice League. It just never feels natural. Something about the way they monologued their stories all at once was just weird. I know we're trying to quickly establish a reason to care about these people and their backgrounds but it just didn't work for me. It's not a bad popcorn flick and I would probably watch it again in the future but I'm Just not sold on his execution of action films anymore. It would take a lot for me to spend money at the theaters to see anything Zac Snyder puts out anymore.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Stupid, formulaic, paint by numbers, ugly looking.
review_detailed_main:
So, let's start with the good things.

At least Snyder didn't put us up with another 4 hour "epic" as he did with his version of the justice league.

But it's obvious Part 1 and 2 were supposed to be a single movie. Instead of "epic" he gave us an inflated, color by numbers, slow motion boring fest.

Stealing every idea from every sci-fi movie he could, including obviously The Matrix ideas and palette, the whole Star Wars universe, and The Magnificent Seven and A Bug' s Life, Snyder fired up his video editing suite, lowered brightness until nothing could be seen, added HDR, lens flares and color, and then thought he had made a great movie. Sadly, his kindergarten-grade storytelling abilities betray him everytime he tries to direct.

He could be an amazing videogame cutscene designer, or an interesting director of photography. But writing and directing? They are so above and beyond his capabiities it's not funny.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Haters gonna hate, such is our world now, sadly
review_detailed_main:
May people find some satisfaction in hating with a passion. So many reviews here were obviously written in a state of rage that is completely outlandish. Too few people with an acute psychiatric disorder haven't seen a doctor and don't take the relevant medication. In the past, they were just shouting in their car or home or in a pub. Now it's getting "slightly" overwhelming.

Rebel moon part 2 is quite ok as an action movie. The CGI is excellent. The story is the umpteenth rehash of the Magnificent Seven. The characters are no more developed now than then.

It's not a masterpiece but it is entertaining.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
For reference I gave part 1 6/10.

Slower start to this one but it feels like the story came together very strong between the first two movies. A lot of character development and back story. You get to know the warriors and why they fight for what they fight for. The villain is a force who shows he can square up when need be(given he's not to busy taking out his anger on his own people). The battle scene was awesome, next level awesome. If you like sci fi then I don't see the need to complain about that (extra long) scene. I'd watch the movie just to see the battle. Can't do a review without mentioning how great Hopkins is as the jimmy! Feel like that's just a given at this point in his career. Ending is sufficient, not necessarily a cliff hanger but definitely open ended.

I'd recommend to anyone to give it a watch with an open mind! Hope we get a few more.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Messy Steampunk Story - But better than the 1st part
review_detailed_main:
The story is silly and messy, but it's good/ok entertainment. No masterpiece, for sure. However, let it flow and relax while watching. If you miss a dialog or scene, it's uncritical, and you won't be more lost than watching it end 2 end.

I'm always wondering if everyone involved doesn't see the story gaps or doesn't care. Maybe it's related to our brain's inability to follow/handle complex stories while watching the movie. So, either CGI or story, but not both.

And it became CGI, trying to compensate for the thin story, which it does pretty well. Mix Star Wars, and Mad Max, starship Troopers ... and you see the result in the Rebel Moon movie. What's missing is a bit.of Aliens...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: "It's called the The Scargiver because that's what it does to your soul"

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It was not bad , it was good
review_detailed_main:
The second part is like an expansion pack to add the ending and the battle that was removed from the first part to the original version. Such a feeling is really bad for such a film and it can be worrying that other filmmakers will seek to take such an approach in the future. Anyway, we're talking about two movies that are basically one movie that has been split into two movies.

War enters the city in Rebel Moon Part 2: The Scargiver

Such a choice to split the film into two parts is really a stupid decision, and Snyder has easily and in the best possible way hit his film, and this issue has been very conscious. But the movie could have put this extra time on other parts. For example, a large part of the first half was devoted to the wheat harvest and its importance was mentioned many times by the characters, but at the end of the movie we realized how unnecessary and unimportant this whole time is and Snyder really doesn't care a bit about his script and writing. In fact, instead of spending more than half of its time on boring and completely redundant scenes, the film could have focused more on the story and characters rather than being on the side of completely one-dimensional stories and characters.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Too Much Taken from other films
review_detailed_main: A lot of the scenes reminded me of other movies. Like all the battle scenes reminded me more of 300 than it actually being it's own movie. And a lot taken from Star Wars of course and just a whole lot of nothing to be entertained. A lot of the reviews say to ignore the bad ratings I would say ignore all the higher rates because it was pretty boring even if it was in the middle of a small war for grain or wheat. Also the supposed expert fighters they have help the village end up not really helping at all which caused the village they were protecting to die regardless of the help they were given.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Its a 300 movie again but in the future sprinkled with bad dialogues all over
review_detailed_main:
Brave underdogs who goes to fight a superior power in monochromotic, muted color tones slow motion scenes.

Characters lacks depth, they all have horrible past and its sad but unable to emotionally connect. Everything is in place to establish the connection but something doesn't bring it out may be its the dialogues. At the end they band comes together and the punch line we can come up with is "To find her and to fight" come on!!

My man Zack, I get it monochromotic slow motion scenes are super cool and we do enjoy it but you got to know by now its over used and am sure man of your talents can come up with something else to go with your cinematography.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Well at least i learned a lot about harvesting...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Great action, great battles and cool characters
review_detailed_main: Honestly others should give this movie more credits. Yes there is room for improvement for sure and at times the battles are a bit unrealistic, but we're in a fantasy world anyway. View this as fiction, enjoy the buildup and the stories of bravery. Most battles are quite epic and the special effects are on point. I could definitely recommend Rebel Moon Part Two and hopefully we will get some more with some nessecary improvements here and there. To the storyline, character building and a bit less predictable. I see a lot of potential for more sequels, so who knows this will become a new franchise. Was worth my time!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
So, I see a lot of people dumping on this movie. I will start by saying, it is better than the first, which is maybe why my rating is generous. There are reviewers I listen to, but though they may hate it, I tried to set aside their biases and looked as to whether I enjoyed it. I did. I do like Zack Snyder's filming style. I do personally like his filmography and yes, I do like the special effects.

Now for the negatives, the story is... meh. I thought some of it was exceedingly corny. The music with the lyrics, well... I kinda felt they were very very juvenile. I personally feel like Zack Snyder enlisted his children to write the lyrics. Overall, I'm glad I didn't have to pay for this in the theaters. If you've seen everything on Netflix and this pops up... its an ok way to kill a few hours.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I've never seen such terrible films ... I'll put as much effort into this review as they did into the film ... To many slow motions, to many sweeping camera views of just people starring into nothingness, to many back stories of people we have no interest in.

The ending of this film was nothing short of a mass of all the cheap gimmicks of every 80's/90's and Z list movie combined into a useless story.

The tech is all over the place. The clothes and acting all over the place. The fact a superior elite fighting force being bestest by a couple of dozen farmers ... is hilarious! Clearly they have never seen a platoon of trained soldiers fight.

Also the knock off lightsabers .. well i actually quite liked them.

I noticed an alien (non-human) at the end. Things are just thrown in these movies like a child throwing colouring crayons at a wall..

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
The first of these was horrible and I gave it a 3. This movie, which I was hoping would be better, is not. It deserves worse... but I'm being kind.

Basically is just a crappy remake the Seven Samurai, or Magnificent Seven, if you prefer the American versions. The story is weak. The writing is horrible. I can't actually believe that this was purchased by a studio for anything. Since usually the movie is worse than the book, I can't even begin to think of goes bad the book is.

Overall, the actors are good and I expected better from them. But, there is only so much you can do with a crappy script.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Both movies feel like it was made by AI if it was asked write a Star Wars movie but different. I think they could do a better job of developing characters and their relationships to one another. Things are to happen fast and without explanation in regards to this, it's like all of a sudden these warriors are all best friends for no reason. Not too say this movie is a bad film, I thought the action scenes were fun and the movie has a simple plot to follow. I think this franchise is slowly finding it's rhythm.

Some things that I liked, I thought the Jimmy character was cool,.it would be nice to see more of it. And I think they finally got the relationships right towards the end of the movie. It definitely could use a little tweaking.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Weaker, but still suitably watchable.

'Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver' is a more action-packed entry to the franchise, despite that I didn't hold as much interest in this as I did for the previous installment. I did, mind, like seeing the battles commence, both in terms of action and effects.

Sofia Boutella is enjoyable once more, but Ed Skrein isn't as interesting this time around; I would've preferred a new villain for this one, to be honest. Djimon Hounsou does have more to work with on this occasion though, which is only a positive thing. Bae Doo-na has a few nice moments, even if she is underused for the majority.

These movies work for me, what can I say? Kinda mad, however, that they're seemingly planning to make six of these in total... a bit much, even for someone that likes these opening two. I'll be there tho.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A lot of people have to die for a little grain..
review_detailed_main:
This is part two of Rebel Moon, the epic space saga.

In part two the story begins back at the village where everything begun in part one.🙂 The story goes that the ruler of the empire have to get the grain from one small village of a few hundred people on a desolite planet, bcs aparently grain isnt cultivated anywhere else in the universe. Thus the ruler of the empire is taking his dreadnot starcruiser to this village even though he could easily travel at lightspeed around the entire universe.. Just to clarify, there is nothing special with this grain, its just for food.

If this doesnt make sense for you, well you have only got an apetizer of what is to come bcs this is how the entire movie runs. Another example of this is that the farmers are using simple hand tools to cut the grain while having starships and equal technology at hand for example.

The CGI is fairly decent though.🙂

Well, I wont say much more, I dont want to ruin the experience of this masterpiece of contradictions, badly written scripts, acting, and so much more.

3/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Zack Snyder, known for his visually stunning films, has a mixed record when it comes to delivering cohesive and compelling storytelling. While some of his works showcase impressive visuals, others fall flat due to repetitive elements and weak narratives. For instance, "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice" received criticism for its convoluted plot and lackluster character development. The film's action sequences, while visually striking, often lacked coherence in choreography, leading to disjointed fight scenes that failed to engage viewers effectively.

Another example from Snyder's repertoire is "Sucker Punch," which suffered from a disjointed storyline and overreliance on stylized visuals at the expense of coherent storytelling. The film's attempts at blending fantasy elements with real-world drama resulted in a muddled narrative that left audiences perplexed rather than immersed.

Moving beyond Snyder's films, there are numerous instances in the realm of Netflix originals where budget constraints have led to subpar productions. One such example is the series "Iron Fist," which faced criticism for its lackluster fight choreography and uninspired cinematography. The show's action sequences often felt staged and lacked the dynamic energy expected from a martial arts-based storyline.

Additionally, Netflix's "Death Note" adaptation received backlash for its departure from the original source material, resulting in a weak storyline that failed to capture the essence of the beloved manga and anime series. The film's pacing issues and underdeveloped characters further contributed to its overall negative reception.

In terms of cinematography, Netflix's "The Ridiculous 6" is another example of a poorly executed production. The film's visual style and editing choices were often jarring, detracting from the viewing experience and highlighting the limitations of its budget.

Overall, while Zack Snyder has delivered visually impressive moments in some of his works, the lack of cohesive storytelling and effective choreography has been a recurring issue. Similarly, budget constraints have led to shortcomings in various Netflix originals, highlighting the challenges faced in balancing visual spectacle with narrative depth and technical execution.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Better than the first for sure
review_detailed_main:
I thought the first Rebel Moon was alright, showed promise as a universe. Script needed to be tighter and that's what they did here. The universe always had interesting elements and I want way more, love TV series across multiple aspects of it; politics, war, diplomacy. Hopefully they expand.

Part 2 fleshes out the characters with more breathing time and the action is great imo, what Zack is best at, some moments were heartfelt too.

The universe was more fleshed out with backstories, you could see inspirations from various points in history, Rome and industrial revolution specifically. Plan was good on the ground and each had some moments to shine.

All in all, I do wish the script was like this from Part 1, would have been tighter but for sure want more from this universe.

VFX was great, acting good, sounds design good along with in universe weapons.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Enjoy the nonstop action sequence (minus the slow motion) like in part 1, still generic tho
review_detailed_main:
It seems like I suffer from what I call "Post-Dune Effect", in which every sci-fi/space opera I watch or gonna watch after I watched both part 1 and part 2 of Denis Villeneuve's adaptation of Dune becomes kind of generic, and this movie is no exception, tho I admit I kinda enjoy the action scenes in both part 1 and part two of the Rebel Moon franchise. Like there's no difference between this series and the entire Riddick franchise aesthetically (except maybe for the amount of slow motion lol, and more modern CGI too), whereas Villeneuve's Dune creates its own style with some "Lawrence of Arabia" polishing. There is almost no stake at all, thanks to the plot armor that amplifies the fighting prowess of the good guys (even though most of them are not built for that) while at the same time, dumbs down the supposedly well trained bad guys (tch, classic). Snyder is said to have a plan for at least 6 movies of this series, but the overall first two movies are enough for me to move on and demand Denis Villeneuve to give me Dune Messiah already.

7.5/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This film is the perfect compliment to part 1.

I didnt think the first could be topped but Zach Snyder has outdone himself with this effort!

Incessant slow motion shots, poor;y written dialog so awful you pity the actors who have to recite such tripe,numerous afterthought ADR lines. Its basically a terrible film on every conceivable level.

There is a scene mid way through where all the main heroes relay their individual back stories, and they sit around in a convenient semi circle, 2 of them placed awkwardly on 3 sides of a rectangular table, presumably to make it easy to film them together. Thats the level of film-making on offer here im afraid. I would say this is not worth 2 hours of anyones time to be perfectly honest. 1/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Everything is bad, the acting, the dialogue, the effects, the cinematography. Everything. It looks like a amateur college student project. Even the score is bad. There are several shots in the film that are so bad I think because of the frame rate but honestly not sure. Also just tons of pointless b roll shots and cheesy scenes. The casting is also terrible. The characters are awful. The premise is so stupid. Did I mention the acting is bad? It seems like they never did a second take. Whatever happened they just rolled with it. I honestly feel bad for all the people that were part if it that wanted to make something great and this is what happened.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Since I defended Part One in my review of it, I feel obliged to also write a review of this. I even rewatched A Child of Fire to assure myself I still like it. And I do, which I can also say the same about Part Two.

It's a direct continuation of Part One, picking up from where it ended. As a standalone film of course it won't make anyone go "wow I just watched a really decently fun movie". It's pretty much all action because that's what A Child of Fire led to. Hard to squeeze in some nice scenery shots on a battlefield, that's why it is lacking those compared to the prequel, understandably.

Another thing this lacks are further exploration of the Rebel Moon world and characters development. I thought we'd get those in sequel if not in the first part. Because of it the movie feels blank. A no-brainer, just science fiction fighting.

I'm not even gonna bother watching the making of (Creating a Universe: The Making of Rebel Moon), because they haven't created anything out of ordinary (hopefully YET) to see a documentary about it.

Whole movie (both parts) feels like it's too long and also too short to get a sense of development and depth in many parts of new Zack Snyder's world.

Giving it a 3/5 but only as a continuation of Part One: A Child of Fire. Alone it's surely a lower ranking but still fun.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Snyder is the parasite of Hollywood.

I really don't know who let that man to direct anything.

Honestly I don't know what was the plot of this crap!

2 hours intense torture with too much unnecessary slow-mos featuring CGI....

I bet this movie would be about 40 minutes without those.

Boutelle should stay with dancing...

The acting was horrible in many ways.

Definitely do not recomment to watch this to anybody!

There were times i literally have to find something doing in between some scene like crocheting or playing phone games. Yes I was this bored by this crappy movie!

Every time I thought, I couldn't be less entertained the movie proofs me wrong.

It felt like the worst movie I have even seen in my life...

This crap will NEVER beat Star War, nor Star Trek!

Instead of directing, Snyder should try writing....

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Snyder and his fans need an intervention
review_detailed_main: I do not know how Snyder fans continue to gas up these movies and try and boost something that clearly is subpar to a franchise that isn't even doing all that great currently. That's actually sad. The pacing is worse than the first film, the exposition is insanely forced and spoon fed, and it just feels basic. To kind of balance it out, the movie does have some great action sequences, but dangling some shiny keys in front of a pile of trash doesn't make it more appealing. Junkie is back at it again with trailer music score, sounds just like 3 of his other films. Do not listen to these reviews giving it 10/10, see it for yourself and judge.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Awkward tempo at times; anticipating 3rd part
review_detailed_main:
Part Two of the Rebel Moon series.

I enjoy these Netflix productions.

The cast is amazing and they are well accomplished as is the crew and director Zack Snyder.

Easily outstanding set design and production, location shoots, cinematography, creature FX (yeah, griffins really exist).

It is not boring, just slow in places such that it feels like a strain to follow the tempo and flow.

The battle scenes on the back half begin are epic. The 300 meets Star Wars. The bad guys are truly bad and the good guys battle hard and struggle to triumph over evil.

One special effect that I really enjoyed from Part One, which continued into Part Two, the close up of the blasters as the director uses slowmo type of bullet-time, whereby you can see the lava laser bolt with the red glow of the round leaving the chamber and traveling away from the blaster. There is blowback sufficient to provide excellent suspended disbelief that blasters are actually being fired and exist.

The light swords appear to be lava for red lighted weapons and ice for blue lighted weapons and made of glass. It is like a lightsaber but different, ice/lava sabre, with the great illusion of actually penetrating bodies during combat.

"Green screen" is well executed in this production. There is definitely no "low budget" feeling at all.

I recommend this movie for its combat scenes, pyrotechnics, cinematography, and visual FX!

Pay attention during the slow scenes as you may lose the overall perspective.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: If you so disliked the first movie, why did you rush to watch the second movie as soon as it came out?
review_detailed_main:
The crew that spewed hatred for the first movie, then watched the second movie in one breath as soon as it was released, and then ran all the way here to complain about it. I swear, I really can not understand this behaviour. The lynching frenzy in the first movie still continues.

This movie is not a masterpiece. It's not as bad as people make a fuss about it. It's a movie that has enjoyable aspects, cheesy aspects, cheap aspects and good/bad aspects. You might even call it a popcorn space opera film. I think there is progress after the first movie. The first movie was more messy. The fact that the movie takes place in a single location this time is also a factor in this.

Seriously, the guy who made this movie loves slow motion, I understand a lot of people don't enjoy it that much. Frankly, it appeals to me because, when you are someone who consumes a lot of movies, too much rushing around the screen can tire you out. That's why this movie felt soothing to me.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I don't know why there is so much hate over the movie but something I do know is that I loved it.

Interesting characters and a brilliant cast.

The story itself seems to lack yet the making of the movie compensates it.

The fact that the protagonists are not immune with plot armor also makes it an interesting watch. Usually the villains are not blessed with a powerful comeback and unlike in this movie protagonist emerge victorious with minimum damage.

There is an extensive use of CGI but compared to what most other movies have been up to I think it's fair use from the editing team.

Part one was also worth watching.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver Was An Ok And Entertainingly Enough Action Packed Film
review_detailed_main: I think the most important thing when you want to critic a movie is to be fair, and i'm here just being fair and straight honest that i actually quite enjoy Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver, and i know a lot of people hated it, and that's without saying that the movie was indeed not without it flaws, lots of flaws from the performances, the story, some sequences, and the bad special effects/CGI in most of the part, i must say that the film has just way more than enough to actually entertained me the whole time, compare to my experience with the first movie which i also didn't hate but i was still not a big fan of it, i was really bored in the middle of that film, and in this one i just have a better time and especially for a 2 hours film, the build up scene was more than enough for me to enjoy, and the whole action packed was pretty enjoyable to see for the most part, it was all more than enough, it wasn't amazing but it wasn't terrible, and that's why i appreciate it more and ended up in the positive note, there is still a thing that i don't like, but the whole movie overall i thought that Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver was an ok and entertainingly enough action packed film, and it was better than the first one in my opinion.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: How can these films be made?
review_detailed_main: I am a teacher in Germany. I work entirely on my own, and no one can verify what I teach in class. That doesn't mean I talk nonsense, but otherwise, no one really sees what goes on. Nonetheless, I studied for this, and my teaching has a certain quality. Occasionally, the headmaster visits to assess the quality of the teaching. Then I receive a grade and can work in the future to improve. However, I wonder how someone like Zack Snyder, who repeatedly makes such disastrous films that are publicly available to everyone, still gets multimillion-dollar projects and executes them to a terribly catastrophic quality. And what does Netflix do? They throw more millions at Zack with no expectations. The second thing is that so many people worked hard on this film, only to produce crap in the end because Zack had free rein. This is just mind-boggling to me.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
First of all, I don't love nor hate Snyder. I don't care about him, I'm only judging the movie. And the movie is really, really bad.

The premise is stupid. Snyder wanted to adapt the 7 samurais but... he adapted way too directly. The fact that an advanced sci-fi empire needs grain from a village is profoundly stupid. At least, pretend they need some.rare earths or something...

Action scenes are really really bad too. I was bored to death while watching them. Also annoyed. You know, it's this kind of movie, where people think guns are swords. They charge the enemy in plain sight, literally running towards a row of rifles.

To be honest, I have nothing more to say, because there's nothing more in the movie. It's empty action scenes filled with unnecessary slo-mos. The worldbuilding is broken. Just taking antic names into a scifi universe doesn't make it clever.

Anyway, just don't bother...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: If you liked Part One (set-up), you'll like Part Two (showdown)
review_detailed_main:
Aside from the visuals, I was quite underwhelmed by Part One -- I gave it 5 stars. Part Two is an improvement in that we learn more about our merry band of "Seven Samurai", as they share their formative background stories. The upshot is that these previously one-dimensional characters are now two-dimensional. In addition, I think Part Two is less blatantly derivative. This may sound like faint praise, but I honestly appreciated the improvement, and some credit is due. However, the characters in these films are merely there to provide sufficient story context for a bunch of CGI.

The visuals are good, just like in Part One, but with more explosions. The defensive prep of the village was well done. It's nice to see people use their brains and come up with a plausible strategy (kind of rare in movies). So more credit is due.

I enjoyed this movie; I think it rates 6.5 stars on that basis. However, I'm deducting a half-star for semi-predictability. That makes six (6) stars total.

PS The lack of powered (or automated) farming tools (aside from a stake-bed hover-platform) is puzzling. It's supposed to show some pseudo-Amish quality-of-primitive-life, but anyone who has actually done that kind of work will tell you (better) TOOLS give you quality of life. Granted, they had a mill, but carefully avoided showing the power source (hmm). Anyone who thinks subsistence farming is "fun" is delusional; mechanized agriculture is responsible and necessary for modern (middle-class) life; without it you have a neo-feudal society at best (which GRANTED is what they're depicting, but better tools would be in EVERYONE'S best interest, and are clearly feasible in a society that can make dreadnoughts, sentient/sapient robots, and hover-boards).

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon Part Two: The Scar giver: Will Give You Boredom

Making multiple parts to a movie before the first one even comes out, does not always work out the way directors hope. This is the case for Rebel moon, the series of movies were announced, even before the first one came out. Now, Rebel Moon Part two: The Scar giver is out, it is directed by Zack Snyder, and stars Sofia Boutella from Kingsman: The Secret Service, Ed Skrein from Deadpool, and Michiel Huisman from Game of Thrones.

Kora (Sofia Boutella) goes back to her hometown; there she and the rest of the villagers prepare to fight against the mother world to keep their grain.

Back in the day, Snyder wanted Rebel Moon to be a Star Wars movie for Disney. Luckily, Disney did not go along with the idea, especially since Rebel Moon is a bad movie. It is boring, and there was no reason to make Rebel Moon two or more parts.

Part one of Rebel Moon was not particularly good ither, all Kora did was go to different planets, to get warriors to help fight along side the farmers. I was hoping part two would be a little better, since they would have to have a battle. Yes, towards the end there was fighting, but I do not care about any of the characters. The only two characters that had a little intrigue were the little boy and the robot. The boy, for some reason, has a connection with the girl that has a light saber looking like weapon. In part one Jimmy (Anthony Hopkins), also known as the robot, was on the wrong side of the fight. As the movie went on however, he changed sides, which was one of the only interesting things in a boring movie. In the first half of part two, I wanted to fall asleep. All they did was farm, which seems like a waste of time, especially in a movie.

Snyder has made it clear that he wants to make an entire Rebel Moon universe, with six films. I find this very funny, since these two movies do not have anything in common with other good franchises, such as Star Wars or Lord of the Rings. These movies provide world building and take time to get to know the characters. Whereas Rebel Moon Part two: The Scar Giver will only give you boredom.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
ChatGPT & Midjourney united made top-notch motion picture out of cheap, old and boring stuf previously made by stupid humans.

Piece of StarWars, chunk from WarHammer40k laid to storyline from Seven Samurai (or Magnificent Semen if you prefer cowboys). Alien, Westworld, Game of Thrones, Days of Heaven - i can't even rember all stolen... mmm, mean all references to real movies. And all this richness flavored by cheapest CGI you ever saw and most generic design of everything. I mean it. Every single piece of cloth, weapon, vehicle (oh, hello Ghost in the Shell!), ship, lanscape - it feels like the designers weren't even juniors, but dudes who complete their first 3D course. Looks like only Antony Hopkins "robot" was made by someone who can remotely call himself an artist.

P. S. THIS IS SO BAD, YOU GONNA LIKE IT! I'm, presonaly, was dying laughing almost all this 2 hours of generic bull****.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: What happens when you give a director power to do anything
review_detailed_main: Zack Snyder is an amazing director. This is a man who went from making a Kia commercial to getting a shot at directing the Dawn of the Dead reboot. From that movie to 300 I've followed this directors evolution. The DC films I enjoyed. Suckerpunch wasn't the best but it really was unique. Once he made an open ended deal with Neflix though it was too much. Just like Shyamalan with Sixth Sense he was able to basically do pet projects. M Night came out with a few stinkers until he was humbled a bit by fans. Honestly even Nolan's Tenet was just too much to be enjoyable. Ridley Scott's Napoleon was equally horrible. Now it's gonna happen but I sense it happens more often when a director is completely unrestrained. I feel between Snyder's goofy ass Army of the Dead which was a horrible mess of comedy, no edge like Dawn of the Dead to his recent terribly written and poorly cast Rebel Moon films. So cliche sci-fi world building just so bad. It like a fabulous looking gourmet meal but tastes bad and has no flavor. I mean at least add some edge to the film, some extreme violence or nudity. I mean I would expect this from JJ Abrams (except with lens flare and not slow mo). Very disappointed again with Scargiver. Some directors should explore their roots again and realize they can't always create fabulous source material from pet projects. Like what Peter Jackson did with LotR or Villanueva is doing with Dune please Zack get some awesome screen writers and build off their material. I appreciate your work Zack good luck with your future projects.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Is it possible to blame the visionary Zack Snyder? I can't...
review_detailed_main:
It's so bad that it's delicious at the same time. It's unbearable to watch, but you watch.

"They came from other worlds to fight for us, to die for us. May they find peace. We will honor them as best we can..." Well, how can you not admire the childlike spontaneity of Zack Snyder, how can you hate him for his hilarious fantasy? I can't. And you?

How many times, per view, I covered my eyes with my palm ... how many times, I exhaled tiresomely, looking at the clock ... Yes, a lot!

This idealized test can test the strength of any cynic. This is a stylized poem that only a real dreamer can write. Well, how can you blame it? And for what? For a grain of rye, or for a mug of ale? For the desire to be free, or for that notorious love? Love is fleeting, the rules are changeable, and people will always remain people, with their weaknesses and passions, but what will remain? Memories, or maybe a legacy? Whatever you call emotions, feelings, we always turn to the past, it is there that the origins of our motives, which inspire the ideas of incorrigible dreamers, restless storytellers, cheerful cranks. It is these strange dreamers, discoverers, innovators, inventors who make our lives more interesting, more diverse, richer.

The author is not afraid to create, make mistakes, fall and get up again. Is it right to condemn yourself for a harmless creative impulse and be afraid of censure? Maybe it's better to pretend to be someone you are not: put on a fake mask and be like everyone else... to agree with the one-voiced majority and march in step with someone else's will... Probably not! That's what the author thinks: he talks about freedom, home, family, love. He says it's worth fighting for! He speaks as he can, as he sees, as he feels.

Is it possible to condemn for this? No, I CAN'T!

"Next season, and in 100 years and continuing to live..."

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Very disappointing, like part one of The Creator. Nice cast and premise but weak plot and undeveloped characters. This show steals from Star Wars as The Creator steals from Ghost in the Shell, and both fail to get even close. Like the directors don't understand what made those movies great in their time.

Having an asian looking actress to be the "ninja like" character, the black actor to be the "african warrior like" character and so on, are just the cherries on the top of a terrible script and forced back stories.

Still the cast does a good job. But those lame dialogs and slow motion fights with cheap epic music is just cringe. The fake beards look terrible too.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
UPDATE August 2024: Director Cuts, if you read below, I loved the original 2 PG-13 movies, I just watched the 2 Director Cuts, and I feel there were a couple things that made it a little better, however overall I think it just dragged it out too much and took away from the regular versions. What was better, the sex scenes with Sophia, and not for dirty reasons, however it showed different sides to her as the first scene was more just sex, however the second time was love. The increased violence, so it was slightly over done, was ok for much of the battles, but was required to repeat showing it again and again, it felt like over kill, and some does improve it, this just felt more horror shock gore at times. That didn't improve on the story, the opposite it dumbed it down in my opinion.

80% of extra story, was not giving much that improved the story, only some of short backstories of some characters was good additions. Then the over use of slow motion that just added more time was also over done, I mean showing blood splatter in slow motion numberous times is a waste, but slow motion on collecting wheat is truly a waste!

I prefer the original 2 with possibly a couple of these little editions only, so maybe 10-15 minutes added to each to cover the good editions of these 2 would of been enough.

I absolutely loved both part 1 & 2, they were brilliant! I am very confused on the bad ratings, I am wondering if these are obsessed Star Wars fans that can't accept or appreciate some similar but different type of story that they have to cut this one down to saying it is awful?! Really?! These movies were so good, story original, action excellent and heartfelt. Was better than majority of the Disney made Star Wars, but maybe that's what all the hate is, not being able to appreciate it for what it is. I love Star Wars, but was able to enjoy these in a different way! Watch it and don't listen to all the hate!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Somewhat formulaic and relies too much on vfx and audio to carry it.
review_detailed_main:
I enjoyed the spectacle of both movies, but felt the storyline relied too much on common tropes, relying too much on VFX and sound to carry it.

Think the magnificent seven in space and you're halfway there.

If you don't have a fairly big TV and at least a basic surround sound system, it'd feel flat. I have a fairly decent set up with a moderately high end TV and 5.1 surround, which I only use early evening as the sound carries and I don't think want to annoy the neighbours. I started watching too late one evening with just the TV speakers and it didn't hold my attention, so I waited until I could watch with the full home cinema, and then i was rapt.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder, What Were You Thinking Here?
review_detailed_main:
I find it sad to state that the reason the films aren't getting great reception is because the studio wanted their version released and your own has been vaulted. It may have worked for "Justice League" but I don't find that any version can save these. The screenwriting was tough and lacked a lot of depth, and I found it so easy to not care for a single character. Zack Snyder attempts to bring heavy emotion into the story and characters but it never lands. The editing was painful especially with the use of slow-motion and how overused it is, I got to the point where I was ready to turn the film off multiple times.

Overall, there is very little to say of this film that I enjoyed if anything at all. A lacklustre, poorly inspired, wannabe Star Wars that I never had the time to care for, was just a disappointment.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Oh boy...it felt like a 2 hour long meme.

Rare is the clumsiness of this movie, the basic concept of story telling seems to be foreign to mr Snyder. Saying "this is what my personality is" does not count as character development. Exposition through a daisy chain of flashbacks does not mean you're following the golden rule of "show, don't tell".

If farming in slow motion and vomit inducing "cinematography" is your thing, you're in for a blast.

To give credit where credits is due...some of the actors tried very hard to have fun with the material, but this is beyond salvation. For a quirky alternative to star wars watch Krull instead.

If this is a dream project for Snyder, call Freddy Krueger.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I do not get the hate for these films

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Less emotional engagement than a 1 night stand
review_detailed_main:
We begin with a half hour of harvesting wheat that make Derek Zoolander's coal mine work scene look naturalistic. And finish with a battle in never ending slow mo where the smart thing to do is run at thousands of gun carrying bad guys with an axe.

The story is profoundly bad (a battle over bags of flour). The character development written by a 4 year old and it covers every used up trope from heartwarming smiling blonde haired kid to maniacal bad guy with super strength. And then you add the by-the-numbers plot and background reveals to really loosen the bowels.

It makes the Star Wars prequel trilogy seem like compulsive viewing. I was left sitting there at the end just thinking WTF. A waste of time, money and resources. Embarrassing.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
The whole film doesn't make sense. In our universe there is 3 trillion planets we can see. In rebel moon I'm sure there is similar. In rebel moon they have advanced ai robots who can do far more than any men, without food drink or breaks. For some reason, they decide to have a tear up as the evil empire wants their grain which about 10-20 people do painstakingly by hand. Why wouldn't robots do this on an abandoned empty planet? Nothing makes sense!

What a load of tosh!

I didn't feel any connection with any of the cliched, 2-dimensional characters so didn't care when any of them died.

However, it gets a few stars for great visuals and CGI, the satisfying splashy-lava effect of the blasters, and the light-trail effects of the light sabres. The coolest moment was the James the mech with his cloak in his One Punch Man moment.

Half the movie was the farmers harvesting wheat and after one day of combat training got a better kill-death ratio than any of the veterans.

The other half of the movie was a guy turning the little wheel to aim the Dreadnaught cannon.

Remind me never to watch any more Synder movies on Netflix. Plasma guns were cool though.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Lots of plot exposition and backfilling

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Literally the dumbest people reviewing this movie here
review_detailed_main:
Please just watch these 2 movies and dont listen to ANY of the negative reviews here. I have seen probably a thousand movies in my lifetime, and i know what is good and what is bad. This movie especially (and the 1st one too) were fantastic! Ive never written a review before but these reviews got me so irritated that i just had to say something

If you enjoy action and/or sci fi movies, just watch it and you will not be disappointed. Acting was great, Effects were awesome and the plot had you genuinely rooting for the farmers. Anyone giving this movie less than a 7 should have their account deactivated because they are an idiot.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not too bad, but such wasted potential
review_detailed_main:
I've read a few reviews and find a lot of them too harsh, or too negative. Sure, there's a lot of things that are tacky, and not that well thought through...

I think this is the first time that a SciFi movie have spent 20 minutes on harvesting... Some of the choices for providing backstory is just cringe, like "hey, let's go round the table and tell our life stories".

A lot of the added scenes to make it look "cool" are even more cringe, lite someone running head first into a shower of bullets (lasers really) and then tosses an enemy over his shoulder... Said tossing over the shoulder leaves all hundreds of charging enemies so stunned that they forget to fire any more...

The number of slow-mo scenes makes this movie about 40 minutes longer that it would have been without them.

Conveniently for our hero's fighting with swords, when the enemies show up, they too have forgotten all rifles and firearms and come bearing swords too...

There's a scene for several minutes about riding an elevator while looking fierce by wrapping a sword handle that must go to the history for being the most ridiculous time filler ever.

I also question a lot of the logic, I mean if you are dressed as an enemy soldier to blend in but then you decide to ditch all of that advantage to be able to instead walk the hallways in a white top, really sticking out like a sore thumb to the enemies... It probably looks better to reveal some skin and shiny muscles, but come on!

So, yes, a lot of bad choices form the director and waaaay too much effort to try and spice the scenes up, and unnecessarily I might add.

The actors are doing a good job, but the script is too weak, too little plot and "finess" to be able to carry two plus hours.

It's like they had only like one hour twenty minutes of good movie, but Netflix had ordered at least 2 hours so they had to add a lot of extra (=cringe) scenes and a ton of slow-mo to boot to stretch it out.

Over all it's a good and viewable story, and I am actually looking forward to the third movie (because there will be one, trust me!) but I really, really, hope that they come up with some better storytelling and some more character development as I now have a hard tie rooting for the good guys...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It is even worse than the first part
review_detailed_main:
In this film there are no any idea, absolutely. In the case of first part the creators tried to invent something, although with little success. But in that movie there was a man-spider, griff, etc. This film doesn't even try. It is a a bunch of scenes we have watched a thousand time, but these scenes appear more like parodies to me. There is no story, no characters, not atmosphere, no world, not style, not interesting planets, only starships are interesting a little bit.

When lightsaber appeared on the screen, I hardly believed what I was sawing. This idea is so iconic and belongs specially to Star Wars that stealing this weapon is so impudence I could'n imagine before.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: At the end actions are quite impressive
review_detailed_main:
Not the best actions I have seen in movies but to be honest I felt to give 7 stars becaise action directors have done a good job. Far better actions than part 1. Story line is actualy let's say no story line at all apart from defending the moon. Only one thing regarding the story line, the main characters are talking about their past and why they are against the main kingdom. So you can know the history of them which makes a sense of why they are fighting against the kingdom. It has some more behind the stories than protecting the moon village.

Anyways as an overall I would give 7 out of 10 because part 1 has been leveraged by this and mostly this obe has better actions. Just to spend your lesuire time with an action movie this is quite a good one and also if your are into future galactic civilization things like "Foundation" by Isaac Asimov, then this movie is not that bad but start from part one.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A movie only for the short-minded
review_detailed_main:
A movie that shows you how we have taken for granted the story tellers for the likes of George Lucas, Peter Jackson, James Cameron and so and so... just as we thought these guys were getting mediocre, now we know that all those movies they did is hard to accomplish.

This move is so poor on character establishment, lazy screen writing, failed to make an emotional attachment because Jack Snyder do not know what it takes to establish them. Over glorified characters in the end meant nothing. There's no story creativity in this movie at all.

With all the money spent is this all he can do? They could have made a far better story than this. Such a waste. O.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Another bomb by snyder. He continues to be a disappointing director who only focus on visuals, superficial stuff and making things look "cool" instead of being a genuine storyteller with compelling characters and script. The acting and dialogues are horrible. Scenes feels like it was plagiarised from something else. Netflix is just burning their money if their funding for more BS like this. As for Snyder, he needs to do some self analysis, self criticism and remove himself from the cult of 'yes men'. It's quite sad seeing once who was an underrated director now only tries to stay relevant by talking about dc characters and other stuff from a decade ago.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: The Imperium is scared of Wheat?
review_detailed_main:
With all it's technology, we are supposed to believe that the Imperium is scared of wheat flour being destroyed. The wheat flour that I buy for, what, $8 for a 50lb bag at Costco?

I like the stylized fight scenes but really? These guys need to come up with better plot points.

With all it's technology, we are supposed to believe that the Imperium is scared of wheat flour being destroyed. The wheat flour that I buy for, what, $8 for a 50lb bag at Costco?

I like the stylized fight scenes but really? These guys need to come up with better plot points.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I didn't understand the negative reception for part one. I definitely won't understand if it's the same for the sequel. The Scargiver takes all of the world building from the first, adds significantly more to the story and characters, and tops it off with an epic battle sequence.

Everything great about the original is continued here. The beautiful visuals, amazing music and goosebump-inducing slow-motion shots. It's more Snyder being Snyder, and I'm nowhere close to being sick of it. For me, it's delicious.

The part that stands out the most is how ridiculously invested I was in the wellbeing of the characters and the outcome of the story. I was on the edge of my seat, legitimately nervous and worried. And to make it even more impactful, this movie is emotionally powerful. It gave me the feels more than once.

In conclusion, The Scargiver is highly entertaining, awesome, intense and fun.

Director's Cut: With the director's cut of part one, I didn't feel the extra 90 minutes. I enjoyed it all. But with this one I could feel the time much more, even though it's only 50 minutes longer. This could be because part one had action scattered throughout. With part two, the majority of the action is in the third act.

I still think I'd go with the director's cut of part two for the unrestricted viewing. Slo-mo blood spatters are pretty, lol.

(2 viewings, 4/19/2024, 8/3/2024)

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: First The 7 Samuari, then the Magnificent 7, then Battle beyond the Stars, Rebel Moon, one and two are really just the same. But that doesn't make them bad films, quite the contrary, the story is familiar, and it lives up to it's predecessors. All the action you want, a great hissable baddie, heroes, heroines, even a robot with a conscience. Worth watching both parts, although hardly original, still, if action and battles are your thing then this is for you. Think Battle Beyond The Stars with a massive budget. Recommend you see part one before part two, even though they are stand alone movies, and if you can, give Battle beyond the Sars a look as well. The 6 score is overall for both films.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Using a device called fast forward rather in an excessive way you may get some entertainment before falling asleep. I'm not a great fan of Rebel Moon Part One, but it was acceptable. Part Two, however, is mostly just bad and boring. If Zack Snyder's intention was to produce a strong sedative, he accomplished the mission with excellence. I consistently had the impression that someone had a script with lots of checkpoints, and that's it. On top, just imagine for a moment that some skilled warriors and some peasants want to fight the forces of the USA or NATO... Anyway, the production is solid. If you don't mind a mind-numbing story and only watch the action sequences (especially the prolonged battle in the last act), you may find a little entertainment while saving some of your lifetime. In my opinion, Part Two is a new all-time low in the oeuvre of Mr. Snyder. Is this still the same director who made movies like the remake of Dawn of the Dead, 300, Watchmen, and Sucker Punch? If yes, what happened to his skills and taste? One last note: the most fun I had was discovering which scene or idea was borrowed from which other movie...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
A movie with very little,if any,redeeming qualities. The first one was bad,this is potentially worse. I find it incredible that studios continue to hand over huge sums of cash to Zach Snyder projects,he hasnt had a decent movie in years with 'Dawn of the dead' & '300' been probably his only good movies followed by a raft of movies flip flopping between poor & downright awful.

All in all i wouldnt waste your time on this,or the original for that matter.a pair of movies that is all style over substance & where a big portion of the movie is in slow motion.its been done before & done a million times better as well.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Does this not remind you of...
review_detailed_main: Battle Beyond the Stars? That one had more charm. This one shows just another small female warrior wiping out a bunch of men who are twice her size and number. Enough already. Whatever happened to the capable male warrior? Thankfully, Braveheart won big at the Oscars as it brought back the real man, as we have been subjected to the many clones of Ellen Ripley. Still, the story is simple in the David versus Goliath style. But enough of trained uniform soliders falling prey to a bunch of simpletons. Yes, there was the Viet Nam War, but by know you should know what to do and what to avoid. Clear? Peace always.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: My hopes were so high for this..... :(

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Happy to have waited to watch it
review_detailed_main:
I'm happy to have waited for a while to watch both movies, directors cut. After the fiasco of the Justice League, it made sense to watch it as the director saw it. Well, to sum it up, if was to define both movies, its a Frankenstein monster. It has taken parts from many movies, such as the magnificent seven, Star Wars etc, but the glue that suppose to flawlessly connect between these parts just isn't there.

The good.

I generally like Snyder's movies and his slow-motion action effects. Loved the fights in these two movies. The gore and special effects add much to the experience.

The mediocre.

Sofia Boutella actually got the looks to be considered bad ass girl warrior. But in my opinion, it's just not enough to be considered the main lead. She just doesn't have that screen presence to be considered the lead. Quite often she disappeared from attention while the camera wasn't focused specifically on her. She can be a great fit to act as second to lead, but no lead herself.

Sex scenes are absolutely unnecessary. It's a space movie. Showing sex scenes within some Mormon/Hippie community just doesn't fit.

The bad.

As mentioned before, it's a Frankenstein. The story in general make little to none sense at all. They mixed up some delusional Mormon\Hip[pie community, space wars (on the ground), profound robot/humanity realizations, pure evil that have sex with tentacles and more, into something that really can't connect. That is the main problem with both of these movies.

So to sum it up, I'd give these two movies a 5/10, just for the fights and the effects. Also, would really like to see more of Sofia Boutella, just not in the lead.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This movie is beautiful, from the cgi to the set design everything is great to look at. Intriguing worldbuilding helped keep my attention, it would have been nice to see more of the universe that serves as this movie's backdrop. It also has a great cast that did their best with what they were given. And there ends the positive things I have to say about Rebel Moon.

The dialogue was predictable, shallow, and just oh so weak. Speeches meant to be inspiring left me feeling slightly embarrassed, it really is as if they were written by a teenager, and not one of the talented ones. The plot was flimsy at best, the motivations of most characters took an extreme suspension of disbelief.

And the terribly unimaginative clichés! The Korean sword master from a fishing village? How could they proudly display such little creativity?

Overall, I'm glad I watched this movie but I would never recommend it. It's good to watch on a lazy day, the action and visuals are pleasing, but please don't watch this movie expecting to feel something deeper than entertainment.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Well, that was a waste of one hour stretched out to two...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: WATCH THE DIRECTOR'S CUT. IT IS SIMPLY BRILLIANT

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Netflix paid director first then there was no effort to get up from a bed. If you give this salad 5 or above you must've said Dune was boring and slow movie :):):)
review_detailed_main:
It could've been possible ONLY ON NETFLIX! If people paid a fee to see this salad in theaters there would be a revolution. Those that loved this movie, which is 1% said Dune 2021 & 2024 was boring, slow and terrible. 0.99% of those were children and people with bad vision and hearing problems.

Everyone else over 15 years old would leave and ask for a refund.

It looks as if we see a case of pay me first then I make movie later. Because there is no way Netflix gave $160 M for this B rated movie with A list actors.

Scriptwise it's like torture, did a 10 year old wrote the script for this movie? Everything in the movie is just like a salad of hot mess. It looks as if director cherry picked from dozen of sci-fi movies and planted it all here withiut any direction, timeline etc. He just shoveled cut offs from stuff he'd seen and decided hey it will be ok here. Watching this mess for 2 hours was a torture on my eyes, ears and my brain had to emergency shutdown for the rest of the evening.

Story +0.1 Script minus -10 Computer Animation +8 SlowMo minus -1000 like what???

I want to stress about my rating, we love movies, we watch tons, we are movie buffs. I do not leave low reviews, like nothing ever lower than 5. Mostly I give 8,9 or 10. But those are movies not a salad with slowmo everything and zero story with horrific script. No its really that bad.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I could probably write a thesis on hiw bad this movie is but I don't feel like spending the time.

When it comes to the tech and spaceships, we got better visuals in 1977 from Star Wars. That alone, with all the new film technology is a travesty.

The actual movie. I'm sorry.... but a few acres of wheat grown on a "moon" is needed to feed an entire spaceship with thousands of personal? They have plasma weapons, spaceships that can enter and exit orbit but they need hand cranks for their cannons? Lets talk about the warship.... it needs to be fueled by humans shoveling a substance into a furnace like a Steam Engine? All the tech and the farmers have to farm like it's the 1700's. They can heal a near dead and broken person in a "crystalist" including having a back of the head splayed open but they can't save anyone who has been shot or stabbed?

These two films are so horrible that I am shocked the plot/script managed to get approved by anyone.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Here's the secret to enjoying this movie
review_detailed_main:
Yes, the plot is very basic, you've seen it before a bunch of times. The acting is pretty bad and some of the costume choices are questionable. But the visuals and the action scenes are very good. Watch on a good TV with a good Sound system. Keep your remote handy and fast forward through all the Various montages (you'll recognize them when you see them). That way you don't have to tolerate the ridiculous dialogue and can enjoy action and visuals that Marvel used to do.

I'm not sure what Zack Snyder was trying to do with this movie. We've got western, sci-fi, steam punk etc. It's all a bit strange. He should definitely stick to his day job as a Director and give up on screenwriting. However, I found the fight scenes well choreographed and the CGI and visuals actually added to the movie. I will say that Ed Skrein stands out in this movie as the evil Admiral. He steals every scene that he's in. He knows he's in a cheesy sci-fi movie and plays it perfectly.

Sure, I would've liked a better story, better acting, etc, but it's a decent Saturday night popcorn movie. Just don't feel that you have to waste time on scenes that slow down the pacing (and there are more than a few). I think that's what most people are complaining about. Just skip them. I promise you will not lose the plot by doing this. It does culminate into a pretty decent finale.

Anyway, that's my take. It's a two hour movie that I watched in less than an hour and a half. I would apply this same strategy to part I, though I spent less time fast forwarding through that movie. Obviously, it's been set up for a Part III. I'll have my remote handy. 😉

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Hey I have an idea! Let's make a child princess killer our main hero simply because she was 'sorry' she murdered an innocent child. Honestly, thay was HIS best idea for a 'hero'? N he was shocked Star Wars turned down his atrocious and ridiculous storyline? Lol I don't even know how anyone could endure this garbage with its non stop slow mo, even the damn grain work was slow mo'd lol someone needs to stop this dude writing movies, great scenery great imagery etc but he CAN NOT make a decent story to save his life hence his best work was partnered with excellent writers and he did the rest.......

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It would have been a better star wars story
review_detailed_main:
This should have been made into a disney star wars movie instead of those disastrous stories where they killed all the old heroes to switch them up with terribly written characters. In this movie even the robot had a more interesting background story than any of the new star wars trilogy characters had.

This should have been made into a disney star wars movie instead of those disastrous stories where they killed all the old heroes to switch them up with terribly written characters. In this movie even the robot had a more interesting background story than any of the new star wars trilogy characters had.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder should stay away from writing
review_detailed_main:
Zack Snyder should stay away from writing and storytelling.

Yet another display of bad acting cringing dialogues.

Too many blur effects and fisheye throughout in the movie and too many slow-motions effects. I had hoped the second part would have been better, but the story seemed to be more meaningless.

Zack Snyder should not write stories and should limit himself to filmmaking or in envisioning other writers stories. Rebel Moon stands in great contrast to Dune, which is more artistically simplistic and aesthetic.

I felt it to be another waste of time. I did not enjoy part II of Rebel Moon.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not that bad at all part 1 and 2 togheter
review_detailed_main:
Was it a great movie? NO not really.

Was it really bad? No not really.

It has it flaws and could be a bit shorter if you put 1 and 2 together.

I'd love Holkenborgs score and with some food and beer it was enjoyable.

I love most of Zack's movies and this is not his best but absolutly no 2 or 2 score movie.

Maybe a lot of people hoped for a new star wars universe but No that's not the case, although those new movies weren't that great either.

I would like to see a third installment and drop the slomo, learn from some faults and than we have a fun new scifi movie. I did like justice league as well and got better over them.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A Complete Misfire For Zack Snyder
review_detailed_main:
If Rebel Moon Part One felt like Zack Snyder trying to make a self-parody, Part Two just feels like a total squandering of the talents I know he possesses with all his worst trademarks as a director on full display. The film doesn't do anything to build upon the few things that intrigued me from the first part and it just makes this whole "experience" feel like a complete waste of time in retrospect.

Part One felt like a complete exposition dump to set up for this film yet the first hour is still devoted to filling in the blanks of this totally uninteresting world and characters. The dialogue is at best forgettable and at worst completely self-serious without a hint of self-awareness that made a lot of the character interactions cringeworthy more than anything. That first half was excruciatingly boring without any kind of tension building, the actual plot essentially revolves around farming grain and it's about as interesting as it sounds. When the war both these films have been building towards finally comes to ahead it feels like a relief in all the wrong ways because I was just happy to see something meaningful finally happen.

When I say the second half was an improvement that's not really saying much but at least I was moderately entertained. The last hour is essentially a non-stop battle and while it can devolve into visual noise after a while at least it feels like Snyder in his element. The pacing finally picks up and there's actually a few interesting visuals on display with some genuinely entertaining sequences. But after a combined 3-hour build up I think it all came a bit too late for me. Writing really isn't Snyder's strong suit and in future I'd prefer to see him either stick purely to directing or adapting material because that seems to be where all of his best work comes from.

When all is said and done, Rebel Moon represents a colossal misfire for Zack Snyder as a director. I didn't think Part One was a good movie but I had a modicum of hope that The Scargiver would give us some good pay off that would make these movies feel worthwhile. The whole thing just ends up being a massive slog and it's not nearly entertaining enough to make up for how hugely derivative it is. Rather than feeling like a complete story, this movie ends with set up for yet another sequel that I don't know if I have the energy to endure, Snyder fan or not.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
No pun intended - I have to admit, I might have missed where we get the explanation for the teeth thing ... but it was quite peculiar to say the least. Not that I minded it happening ... but it is quite weird. Might only be something you see in the extended or rather directors cut I assume ... and that is the versions I watched ... and I only watched those ... just to be clear ... can't compare the two versions, there are other places where you can find out about that, if you are curious.

The first one, where everyone was assembled made a bit more sense ... even if we get the backstories for everyone now ... not sure if really needed ... but an excuse to show us more great visuals I reckon. Also another love scene for Sofia - not complaining, just stating ... with nudity in the cut I saw - whether that matters or not.

Visually it is amazing - and there is quite the brutal stuff happening. So from that stand point .. almost full points ... as far as I understand there were more planned ... not sure we ever get to see them though ... Netflix may have money, but not that much to just give away ... would have been nice to see where this all leads .. but we are not ready yet I guess ... whatever the case, Star Wars for ... big boys and girls (and all those in between) is here ... lfg as another movie suggested ... action wise more than well done ... but is it enough for you? Or maybe too much (action wise)?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I suppose it is an achievement of sorts when Rebel Moon 2 somehow manages to be worse that the first part.

The movie starts off with what can only be described as clichéd filler scenes of preparation and training for what is close to a half an hour, along with what I consider a genuine attempt to somehow convince you that the nonsensical premise of the whole thing actually has some logic to it. You begin to think maybe there is hope. And then right at the 40th minute mark (i.e. Almost the middle of the SECOND movie) a character stands up and asks that he wants to know the people he's about to fight side by side with. This in turn prompts a montage that is narrated by each character reading his or hers wiki page. That is of course in case the poor viewer has already forgotten the first movie and the fact that the same characters have already fought side by side with one another and have had the same introductions except the first time we didn't get a montage. I guess Zach Snyder knew that for part 2 WE ARE GONNA NEED A MONTAGE! Montage....

After this action begins to ensue with all the tropes you can think off - from dumb evil guys being dumb and evil to the power of friendship that beats everything.

Oh, and slo mo, because where would we be without it.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This was like watching a movie of a toddler telling a 3 min story for 2 hours. The slow motion is like the child saying "um" every 6 seconds. I can only assume the budget was blown solely on SFX and slow motion. Story sucks, direction sucks, and at that point you can't really blame the actors. Or can you? Someone should have been able to tell it was bad while making it.

How does something like this make it to editing without a single person mentioning how dumb it is? Then, how does the editor not catch it and say, I know we're almost done but we need to start over?

Gun smoke from laser guns. Sparkle dust from laser swords. Smoke from futuristic flying vehicles. Bad fake hair all the way around. It makes the new bad Star Wars movies seem really good.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver (2024) is really the best movie and the second part of this movie. I think they are going to release third part of this movie at the earlier of 2025 January. I will eagerly wait for the third part. This movie is really one of the best movie of 2024 as i have seen so far. I will definitely recommend it to watch this movie.
