And yeah, do not forget to watch the first part of this movie before you are going to watching this part two. This movie is not 100% adult content free but, still it is best from many ways. So yeah, you will enjoy this!

25 December 2024 Watched H Dubbed On Netflix.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: 🌙 if you even think for a second about the actual premise, it's an absolute Embarrassment of a film, it's utter Buffoonery 🤦🏻
review_detailed_main:
Just got out of a Screening of Rebel Moon Part 2 : The Scargiver.

This Could Go Down as one of the Most Intellectually Insulting Films ever made.

🌙 - These 2 Films Premise is that a Intergalactic Empire of Huge Scale, need this Wheat 🌾 from a Small Village on a Planet called Veldt. Q. Is the Wheat Superpowered and gives you temporary Superpowers every time it's eaten, so that you can continue and make it even easier to conquer other planets? A. No it doesn't do that, it's just Regular Wheat. Q. What? That's it? Wait, Hold on a Minute....

🌓 - Q. Can't this Intergalactic Empire Make other types of food? Can't they find other food sources somewhere else in the Galaxy? A. No, they can't, but there's something about that wheat though, I'm telling you.

🤦🏻 - The Village has around 200 people. Q. Well that's good, should be an easy defeat if things go sour right? A. Well no, the Villagers have Better Battle Tactics, such as digging ditches underground, and making underground tunnels, so they can surprise attack the Empire. Q. What? I thought this Intergalactic Empire has Superior Weapons, Equipment, Armour, Land & Air Vehicles and Tactically Trained Soldiers? A. Yeah, but the Villagers have Pitchforks, a couple of Rocket Launchers, Some Musket Guns, Axes and Swords. Q. What? Are you joking? A. No.

Do you get the Picture?

More Buffoonery -

🙇 - The Final Battle was Ridiculous with the Numbers and lack of numbers on the other side, and it also turned into Star Wars Point Blank Misses by Storm Troopers Stuff.

🤦🏻 - The Bridge Battle with Tarak, General Titus & The Villagers was an absolute Embarrassment of a Watch. Watch the Celebration Aftermath 🎉of that battle, with the villagers holding damn Melee Weapons in their hands after beating Assault Rifled armed Soldiers. 🤦🏻

🤦🏻 - Tarak is running around with 2 damn axes, whilst Red Laser Gunfire Beams are flying all around him and not a single bullet hits him? It reminded of how stupid the Storm troopers were in the Star Wars Films.

😂 - It got to a point where it became an absolute Laugh of a Watch. Atticus Noble decides to destroy the grain 🌾 because Kora is there at the village? But what about all that fuss noble kicked up at the village in part 1?

Things I actually liked about the film -

🌌 - The Visual Effects During the Battles were Great, I really liked the shots and the choices of the framing and it looked Stunning at times, with Smoke, Dust, Lighting & Slow Motion. The Hallway Gunfire scene with kora was good and the Jump by Kora in Slow Motion with the Handgun was Great to see.

👍 - The Backstorys of some of the characters, I would like to see more of that because it's actually better than this current time line.

👘 - Again on the Backstorys, the Costume Designs were Eye Gazing, absolutely beautiful costumes, coupled with the gorgeous cinematography & Visual Effects.

👱- So Princess issa was the one to dismantle all War Operations of the Motherworld, but Balisarius was not happy with this New Direction at All. And made Drastic Plans with Many other Nobles within the Empire. This Plot Point is so good. Is Princess issa the Key to a New Motherworld? "I Forgive You" - Did issa say that to Kora, knowing of Koras Forced Betrayal, yet also knowing the true extent of her Powers, Knowing the Pull Through and that all is not Over?

🎁 - I liked the Gifts scene when the young villager girl gives Kora & her companions gifts during the party 🎉

Overall, other than some of the Visual Effects and Close Shots(which I liked) in certain Scenes, the actual premise is so laughable that it turns into sheer Buffoonery. Get some drinks and some of your friends around. And there's that side of the entertainment factor.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Now streaming on Netflix is Zack Snyder's (Sucker Punch/Dawn of the Dead) follow-up to his mega-opus from last year which wraps up his Seven Samurai homage (poorly constructed theft?) as the heroes make a stand against the evil Galactic Empire, sorry Imperium, on a moon whose people are trained to fight the good fight w/the ultimate clutch between the good Sofia Boutella & evil Ed Skrein taking place on an imperial cruiser. Snyder at the outset never did himself any favors by espousing how 'original' his take on Kurasawa canon was when others like John Sturges & recently Antoine Fuqua managed to take his samurai epic & transplant it to the old West but even if you're argument leans on his melding samurai adventures w/a sci-fi aesthetic, sorry Roger Corman got there first w/1980's Battle Beyond the Stars.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
The visual and world seem like a huge missed opportunity. Unfortunately, the movie barely holds by a thread. The scenes follow each other without much logical sense. Feels like the writing was rushed and lacks continuity. If it were a college project, it'd be fantastic. But for the production, this just falls short. If anything, it feels like a video game. Cutscene after cutscene.

And to all the comments that claim that this was Schneider's compromise with the studio: Netflix's requirements for the film were set. Failing to meet those requirements and claiming the film is bad because of those requirements is a cop out.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Zach Snyder returns in his droning sci-fi opus to once again make us all glad he was never allowed near a Star Wars movie

The first hour of this will test the patience of even the most dedicated Snyder fan boy with its endless, senseless exposition with large segments dedicated to the slow motion harvesting of corn

When the "epic" final battle finally arrives with its bland not magnificent seven characters in place it's all flash, bang, fizzle where we're supposed to cheer when Antony Hopkins bot arrives to shoot some stuff.

It also contains such ridiculous moments as the big bads intergalactic spaceship being powered by coal(?!) and an engine that has a face or something

The most horrifying moment comes right at the end when the audience is teased with the prospect of more adventures in the Zach Snyder Clicheaverse to come

Even it's intended audience of 14 year old boys won't be swayed by this pretentious, overlong bag of cliched garbage.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Best sci-fi action movie for 2024 so far
review_detailed_main:
Rebel moon part 2 takes it time to build characters further, kudos to the general to actual go into the action. It makes the rouge team trustworthy and makes you love the underdogs they are.

Smart relation building so you actually care if some dies trying!

Final action scene are next level with crisp clear sword fights, in slow motion so you can enjoy the details. Then each kill group are given in waves to enjoy, which gives you time understand the timeline. Finally a big finale that will make your sub woofer jump across the floor.

I rarly write reviews, but this movie actually needs some positive love. To the film, sfx, 3dfx and actors, great job! Looking forward to part three!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's basically Heaven's Gate in outer space
review_detailed_main:
I was properly entertained, I must admit that. But there are so many boring scenes of the little space Irishmen dancing and singing and congratulating each other. This put me to mind of the other magnificent flop movie Heaven's Gate, which had musical and dance sequences way out of proportion to the main body of the film at hand. So many heroes and we must also sit and listen to their backstories which go on endlessly. I'm glad they didn't have a DOZEN heroes, or the movie might have been 4 hours long.

The final battle was capable, though. There hasn't been quite so much slow motion since 1999 (Matrix). The battle CGI was of higher quality than some of the other places where, like the resuscitation of Noble (which looked like a Residents video, incidentally), it seemed added as an afterthought. They don't scratch film any more, you know.

The plot is quite turgid and people formerly though killed keep reappearing healthy, including a princess (we learn at the end). Clearly a device to make a 3rd episode possible.

It's clearly worth a watch just for all the ultimate noise and commotion. My one disappointment is that Anthony Hopkin's robot doesn't get to do a whole lot in the 4 hour runtime of the franchise. I was hoping he'd turn out to have unexpected powers or hidden secrets, but he's just another cast member of a too large cast.

I will watch the next one, if it shows up. Once.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Feels like a Uwe Boll film
review_detailed_main: Wow! Was quite looking forward to this movie. But OMG! So slow and boring. Feels like a low budget, direct to dvd, Uwe Boll film. Really struggling to get through it after enjoying Part 1. Terrible writing, terrible directing, terrible score, terrible acting, terrible effects and so incredibly cliched. There's a semi decent story in there some where, I'm sure, but it's lost and buried deep under too much exposition and fluff. Even Anthony Hopkins' voice over at the start was horrific. The guy hasn't got the right voice for it anymore. Sounded like he was reading. Over 2 hours of your life you won't get back. Wouldn't recommend.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: All show and no coherent story or world

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Looks great but that's about it
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon part II... I watched it so you don't have to.

You're welcome!

A few bits I took away from it in no particular order.

Game of Thrones original Daario Naharris' hair cut is so bad it's distracting.

Space wheat is really hard to grow, apparently.

Zach Snyder loves Slo-Mo. Seriously during the second scene of slow motion scythe harvesting, I went onto IMDb where the first review I read was on about how there are so many slo-mo scenes in the film!

I realised after the first hour that I didn't really know who half of the characters were or what the plot was about.

Worse still, I realised that not knowing didn't bother me a single bit.

I reckon AI wrote a chunk of this, if not all and if so SkyNet is a long time off.

I will end on this note. If RM II was made as some kind of sci-fi parody, I think it'd be one of the funniest films ever.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
The visual effects were really good, the actors were decent, the potential for this movie was off the roof. And they wasted it all. The battles were stupid. The people were stupid. The strategies were stupid. The motivations were stupid. The technology was stupid. The economics were stupid. The politics were stupid. Everything in this story was stupid. I understand they wanted to remake Seven Samurai, but they basically took the samurai, removed their fighting skills, gave them a compulsion for overtalking and gave them stupid laser guns. And the ending was spectacularly stupid, as it was revealed that they risked everything to defend a village, when there were higher stakes involved.

Even if you have no idea how to write, how difficult was it to set up a realistic battle with a military instructor. Just give the guy some money and he will tell you what they would do if they had a bunch of soldiers backed by a few tanks and several flying gunships or if they were besieged by the same and all they had were guerilla fighters. I can suspend my disbelief in the story if you show you actually gave a damn about the rest. Or you can set up really dumb scenes if you have a good story. But if you have none of those, why even try?!

What is even worse, many of the events in the second part invalidated much of the first. The more I wrote in this review, the more stars I removed. I wanted to say that the naysayers were a bit harsh and it was a watchable movie, but then my brain switched back on. This wasn't even entertaining. It was boring, pretentions and overwhelmingly stupid. Agh!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: For a popcorn movie it is excellent
review_detailed_main:
I don't get all the whining about this movie. Considering it was originally written to be a Star Wars movie.

The plot is actually too good for Star Wars, as are the dialogues and the action.

If you're looking for an intelligent, plot driven, epic scifi movie, watch Dune.

If you just want to have fun and watch an above average popcorn movie, watch rebel moon for what it is.

Is everything in this picture consistent? Off course not, the primitive harvesting of the grain. The fact that a couple of villagers would harvest enough grain in this way to be of importance to an empire. That is quite ridiculous and could easily have been avoided.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Worst movie I have seen in a long while. A interestelar destroyer fueled by coal? Really? That basically summarizes the technical aspectos of the movie. The script is just a rip off of 7 samurais (or the magnificent seven if You like the wéstern versión), the acting is abysmal, specially the Main carácter, her spectrum of fake emotions is infuriating.

75% of the movie is in slowmotion. There is a naked conan the barbarian running around the Battlefield but somehow nobody shots him.

There are so many good scripts waiting for funding and they spent 90 millons on this crap, don't waste your time.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A little better on the action, but still terrible on the character side. [+38%]
review_detailed_main:
Lately, Zack Snyder films come across as dubious, "what-if" case studies rather than entertaining popcorn blockbusters. The Rebel Moon sequel that no one except Snyder asked for, is currently streaming on Netflix. It quite seems like the next batch of bland, forgettable films that'll enter the same league as the dreadful Transformers sequels. Part Two begins with Sir Anthony Hopkins' voiceover summing up the events of the first flick in a few lines. Snyder then takes a long time detailing Admiral Noble's resurrection (yawn!) and the village of farmers going about their business of cinematically harvesting grain. Snyder (who also puts on the DOP's hat) shoots them like music videos, lens-flaring the hell out of everything. Unlike the first, the action here unfolds mostly during the day, so the dark industrial grey aesthetic is almost replaced with what looks like a dusty, twilight-hour palette.

It takes exceptionally bad writing for the screenplay to focus less on what was supposed to be a "battle for grain" and turn into a Star Wars knockoff. That was already an issue with the first film, and nothing really changes here. The warriors supporting Kora in her quest to defeat Noble each get five odd minutes of a music-video-backstory, and I couldn't wait for the (long-ish) first act to just get over and move on to the action. The story arcs are terrible, the character development is bleh, and none of the performances are rousing. The film stays emotionally flat from start to finish - the stakes feel next to none, the deaths of key characters leave no impact.

Again, with writing this derivative and barebones, there's nothing Junkie XL could've done to make the proceedings any better. While nothing to write home about, the set pieces in the sequel feel less choppy (a typical Netflix trait) and even the excessive slo-mo didn't bother me all that much. In 2024, the same year where Dune: Part Two exists, it'd take a beyond-superlative effort to mesmerize audiences with a colonial space-warfare story. I acknowledge that Snyder is purely a "visual" director, and his writing efforts have been atrocious for the most part, but can the man learn a thing or two from his earlier big-budget mistakes, maybe?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Pointless drivel in slow motion - lots of slow motion !

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Take away the SFX..and there's nothing left.
review_detailed_main:
Seriously, was is Snyder thinking? 'Hey I have this new fast anamorphic lens and big sensor! Let's make some random b-roll, with the shortest depth of field and put flares everywhere. Ow yeah, let's have the lens orientation just a bit off for some shots. It ads to the already extreme distortion!'

Script is so bad, far from realistic (for as far we can expect for a si-fi). Characters are simple, the cliché in several scenes is just extreme to the point that it's even irritating me.

So I decided to continue watching for the SFX because those were nice ..but I did grab my laptop after 30min watch time to go edit my own video project while running this movie on the background.

I'd say, don't waist 2 hours ...watch something else.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
It was almost as dreadful as its title, a shameless rip off of "Star wars", which sank to even stealing lightsabers from that classic film.

Horribly pretentious, and laughably somber at times, its only redeeming value were a few decent battle scenes, but even those were ruined by the director's tendency to suddenly slow down the action to extreme slow motion, and to linger on melodramatic shots of supposed mourning and sacrifice, which nobody really gives a damn about in a film like this.

The director seemed intent on making a classic, but instead he simply revealed himself as a pretender with no original thoughts, who only understands the surface of great films and attempts to mimic them, but is incapable of pulling in the audience to actually care about the characters.

A study in how to waste $166 million on worthless trash.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Enjoyable Sci-Fi Flick with decent battles
review_detailed_main:
I just watched the movie and i felt quite entertained the whole time. In my opinion this installment doesn't get boring and is enjoyable to watch. I had a harder time with part one.

It's not an all time favourite movie but the bad reviews doesn't fit for me. I had fun watching it. The action was mostly on point but sometimes quite overloaded with effects.

The bad part of it is the background of the characters story. It felt overrushed and not quite understandable. The reason why the main character acted like it did was nowhere in the near of clear because it just was explained in maybe two lines of text. On the other hand, the backstory of the general gave me chills.

Overall an enjoyable Zack Snyder Movie. It will not be so easily forgotten. Definitly an improvement of part 1.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Someone tell Zack to stop using slow-motion!
review_detailed_main:
Star Wars meets Steampunk: visually Rebel Moon Part Two is great, but nothing we haven't seen before. Actors are ok, but unfortunately the story is a predictable by-the-numbers Seven Samurai/The Magnificent Seven/Rogue One: A Star Wars Story/etc etc good guys vs bad guys flick.

And the movie could have been cut down to watchable 90+ minutes if Zack Snyder wouldn't insist on using slow-motion all the time (even using slo-mo during slow moments like the harvesting scenes - oh come on!). Fortunately you can watch the movie on double speed.

The ending leaves the door open for a Part Three - let's hope they don't make it.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Don't waste your time. The second episode is full of clichés, we have in this film, the water girl with her angelic hair, the prince who needs a kingdom, a depressive swordswoman, a gladiator general, a friendly robot, the evil one that doesn't die. There are so many ideas that have already been seen in other films, that if Rambo appeared I wouldn't be surprised. Kora is a boring, depressive character, played by an actress who should go back to theater school. Always with his head down and looking up, breathing heavily even when it's good morning. He is very boring. Do not waste your time. The director made a mistake in this second film.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: On a rainy day, I would rather watch grass grow
review_detailed_main: I truly enjoyed the 1st Rebel moon and thought it had potential to be excellent with the next chapter. I can't even make it through 30 min. It's poorly put together and all over the place. What happened? If you enjoyed the 1st and anticipate the same gripping story line and action with a mix of politics, don't bother- you'll be disappointed just like the rest of the reviews. I'll say this, if you adore bad movies like BATMAN starring twilight...you'll just be captivated by this atrocity. Thankfully it started raining so I can focus on actual entertainments of watching bottles fill up with rain water. Can we make cinema entertaining again? This ridiculous format towards movies isn't working these days and one would think it's such common knowledge, changes would occur.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Movie is so bad they should teach it in universities
review_detailed_main: So badly written, so badly executed, so badly directed, so full of B category lame clichés that it is very hard to process. Hours and hours of analization would be necessary to figure out how could so many people, producers managers and CEOs let this garbage to go through and spent so much money on and advertised as something revolutionary, when it is nothing more, than a Readers Digest quality nonsense. Upon all that, even the CGI is terrible, the camera is out of focus more, than in an amateur video made on a birthday party. The story has nothing to get attached to. The characters were put together from stories we've seen million times already. Actors are very poorly directed, therefore their acting is unratable. Everything is so bad, that you would think they will at least nail something based on luck, but no, even the music is lame and mostly based on Gladiator. Absolute garbage.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
These trash reviews don't make any sense. The hate is incoherent tbh and there seems to be a lot of fabricated hate toward Zack Snyder. Both Rebel Moon movies are really great.

This is a new universe, it's all an original new plot where we have to organically learn from.

I enjoyed the story, the team-building, the hardcore war action scenes and the emotional impact from their stories which also has some mystery because of course, it's a new universe, we have much to see and learn about🔥 📛

I've never seen any other director being hold accountable or put under the same standards and lenses, as Zack Snyder. As soon as Zack delivers, the internet is inundated with hate opinions and critics. Nobody is expecting a perfect film because there is no such things, all movies lack in one area or another, but people lose their minds when it's Zack Snyder related. Calm down.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: First things first. I have enjoyed some of Snyder's work. Watchmen to an extent and 300 to an extent. That's pretty much it. The rest of his work sucker punch, man of steel, BvS, justice league, army of the dead, and now a maybe saga of Rebel Moon. They all have the same problem. His writing sucks. The equivalent of a 13 year old smashing action figures together eating crayons. Lame, loud, and no substance. I'm done. At this point I'm pretty sure so called fans are just trolling this man and Netflix hard. A big joke. Terrible dialog, way too many back stories thrown in, not to mention over abundance of slow mo. It's a ridiculous film that trys so hard to be new but it's impossible when everything in this movie is a rip off of at least several other properties and fails to even copy and paste. Like a child cheating a test and still fails. Stop watching this Garbage. And you won't be served Garbage. P.s I canceled my Netflix.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
First of all : I did like the first part being fully aware of its flaws.

Part 2 is made of everything that was bad in the former iteration : soulless dialogues, poor character development (Why do the evil ones have to be purely evil?) and an orgy of slow motion action scenes that are way so long that you could take a leak and come back in the same scene realizing you didn't miss anything.

Everything is in this movie is predictable. I have rarely watched a movie stacked with so many action scenes while being totally bored.

If you are not a Zack Snyder fan and need more reasons to hate his work, I highly recommend that you watch Rebel Moon - Part 2.

I gave the first movie a 6.5 because I was entertained.

This one is a 4.5 at best.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon takes place on the edge of the galaxy where rebel/resistance forces fight against a tyrannical government with weapons including laser blasters and glowing swords. The protagonist turns out to be the daughter of ruthless ruler. Sound familiar?

Character and plot development were severely lacking, especially considering that Snyder had four hours across both movies to do so. The viewer is left will little-to-no emotional attachment for any character and, although the costume and special effects are impressive, they ultimately are not good enough to make up for lackluster acting and cheesy lines.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: No wonder Star Wars turned him down
review_detailed_main:
Not denying this film looks polished as does the majority of Snyder movies but just as common it lacks substance.

The nods to another franchise in space with a ruling empire just makes the flaws here even more noticeable as it lacks a decent story. Even comparing to the sequel trilogy!

The acting is sub-par at best as the main character's here are at their best in other roles as sideline characters.

I would say don't bother with a part 3 but as it's Netflix and this will get a lot of views a 3rd part will follow while superior Netflix content will hit the chopping block to pay for it!

Snyder needs to go back to adapting quality stories and making them watchable.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I enjoyed the scenes where Kora tells her story about the assassination of the princess and how conflicted she was for her loyalty to her Balisarius and the Royal Family. The background music in that scene with violins and viola performers on that scene was magnificent. This is where she gets to understand why Balisarius spared her life when she was taken from her world when she was 9yrs old. My other favorite part is the scene is where Titus discussed the preparation of their defense and strategy. The other scenes I enjoyed was when Titus and the other warriors told their stories and their reasons why they are determined to fight for revenge for what they all lost. I believe Ed Skrein role as Admiral Atticus Noble as the villain, he performed it superbly with passion. He deserves an award for his well played role. And to add, it's so amazing how the director choose the casts who are qualified as actors, and well experienced in theater acting. And majority were born in the 80's just like me. 😜

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Rebel Moon fails to leave a lasting impression.
review_detailed_main: "Rebel Moon" presents a visually captivating world, but falls short in several critical aspects. Sofia Boutella's portrayal lacks credibility in the lead role due to her physicality, she has no muscle in her very thin frame, and would not be able to take on two bigger men in the real world, this visual issue undermines the character's believability. The film suffers from a lack of depth in character development, leaving viewers disconnected from the story. While some scenes excel in visual appeal, others fall short, contributing to an overall mediocre experience. Despite its potential, "Rebel Moon" fails to leave a lasting impression, ultimately rendering it an underwhelming cinematic venture.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Could you fall lower? Yes, you could fall lower

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I feel a little whiny but I really did try. I really like space epics but this isn't one I'm afraid. Sure cgi is good, it doesn't feel cheap, but the plot line is, the dialogue is so damned corny and actually makes me embarrassed at times.

Like a lot have said, it is consistently predictable- and sooo much is stolen from far better stories than this one, I'm sorry. A little Star wars here and a little Trekkie refs here- and the inconsistency with which they have tried the whole steampunk vibe- no sorry. Modern weapons and sentient robots- yet they use a hand crank for cannon targeting?? Nope. Sorry- found myself doing some shopping the last half instead just to get through it.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: 5 Minutes of Footage Stretched to 2+ Hours of Slowmo?
review_detailed_main:
Maybe a bit of an exaggeration, but it really did feel like Netflix paid for a feature length production and they shot an episode length story and had to figure out how to stretch it, so they just made 40% of the scenes slow motion and then went to the cutting floor for every single frame of battleground setup, grain harvesting, and contrived "moments" they could for the other 60%. I really wanted to enjoy this, but if the third movie is as bad as this one, I'll probably skip the last 3.

The special effects were great, and the slow motion was cool in the context of fight scenes, but slow motion grain winnowing? Why?!?!?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Thought it was going to be so much better than the first but again FAILED!!!
review_detailed_main: Thought it was going to be so much better than the first but again FAILED!!! Besides having some good action scenes this Movie was just as bad as the 1st Installment. First ENOUGH with the CONSTANT slow motion scenes. I think half of the entire movie is in slow motion or at least felt that way. The writing was once again terrible, and with so many good actors/actresses it still can't make up from the story telling of this Movie. I don't understand how you can have such an amazing cast & still come out with such a horrible film. I was very excited for both the first film & this film, but both have been a HUGE disappointment!!!! If a 3rd one gets made I'm not going to continue to waste my time watching it, and I DEFINITELY won't be watching the MUCH LONGER directors cuts to waste even more of my time!!!!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: AMAZING!!! It was better than the last 3 Star Wars
review_detailed_main: I thought it was amazing a fresh new take of space sci-fi or space opera. It has an amazing plot/storyline, and the cast is literally the best chemistry I've seen in a long time. Idk how you can not like this amazing piece of art because I want more, this is what Zach Snyder does when you let him be him!!!. The man is an artist and it shows in his work, (Rebel Moon) probably won't get the love it deserves because of other people being jealous. It's nothing like star wars but still brings the same type of excitement & intrigue for the characters & and leaves you wanting more, it's a must see WATCH IT.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder has Become the New George Lucas
review_detailed_main:
I'm sorry, but no one should write, produce, direct, and be the Director of Photography on their own movie.

It seems to me that the same thing happened with Rebel Moon (both parts one and two) as happened with the Star Wars prequels. No one told Zack "NO, THAT'S A STUIPD IDEA" once during the entirety of pre-production, production, and post-production. The first movie was at least a 7 Samurai rip off. The second one didn't even have that going for it.

I literally found myself watching YouTube videos while it was playing in another tab, it was that boring.

The dialog was terrible. The pacing was terrible. There was character development, but that character development was so formulaic that it was almost comical. Yet, I think that what bothered me the most was the juxtaposition of sentient androids with WWII style naval guns on a SPACESHIP!

I mean, what sort of civilization can build sentient androids and build faster than light spaceships and still can't build a decent targeting computer!? Who?!

And the grain as a plot device!? Sure, sure, grain worked as a McGuffin in 7 Samurai, but that's because the film took place in an agrarian society! If a civilization can build robots and spaceships and has a power source capable of traversing lightyears of distance in mere days, then one would think that they'd be able to automate something as mundane as food production.

I can't tell you how many articles I've read about lab grown 3D printed meat in the past few years. Not to mention the fact that you can buy Impossible Burger at the supermarket for the same price as real meat (of course, real meat would probably be twice the price without the corn subsidies...).

My willful suspension of disbelief has hereby been revoked. It looked pretty though... I mean, maybe Zack should just stick to cinematography?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Why is Anthony Hopkins in this Movie?
review_detailed_main:
"It's one thing to be comically inept, its another thing to be boring and tedious and its another thing to be completely derivative, cliched and unoriginal but it takes a special kind of cinematic anti-genius to bring all these things together into one movie. Luckily for us, Zach Synder has just the right combination of flawed vision and completely unjustified self-belief to pull it off."

Because good Lord, this movie actually left me impressed with how bad it is.

It's baffling to me how so many cinematic absent minded people give this movie anything more than a 5 out of 10. I mean really? You honestly think this sci-fi wet fart of a movie is better than the greats out there like Star Wars etc? He's literally stealing all those works and putting it in his movie!

The climax of this "film" is the same climax of Return of the Jedi!

And don't get me started with how absurd the sci-fi elements are with this film:

A highly advanced race who has mastered interstellar travel and found ways to raise the dead but somehow still needs WHEAT for sustenance and their ships run on COAL?

Yea, that makes sense...

The antagonist looks like evil Lloyd Christmas from Dumb and Dumber. I've watched both movies (I'm embarrassed to even admit that) and I still could care less about all the characters due to LACK OF CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT.

30 MINUTES OF POEPLE DOING NOTHING BUT HARVESTING WHEAT...IN...SLOW...MOTION...

Please DO NOT make a third one Zach. You've done enough damage to your career already.

I'm done,

Zach, please retire...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder has lost his mind.
review_detailed_main:
This movie is ridiculous garbage. The script is stolen trash, the dialogue trash, the motivation stolen trash, the characters are stereotypical cliched copies of its betters.

What possessed Snyder to produce this? Was he blackmailed by an 8 year old child into making his first draft screenplay that was written when he was 6 years old. There is No Way an adult wrote this. They have no concept of proportionality or motivation. This is not even an effective children's film because even educated children have a greater comprehensive understanding of good and bad, right and wrong, tit for tat, and just about every well known Grimm's fairy tale or Greek myths and Aesop's fables. This movie was simply unneeded. Its ONE good characteristic is the visuals. It had Snyders trademark slo mo stylization. However, it was overused and diluted its impact. Why would seeing slo motion reaping of wheat EVER be a thing? Was he paying tribute to Ridley Scott? In Gladiator, when Maximus was dying and dreamed he was walking thru the fields of wheat to get to his family. That wheat slo mo was effective. This film however....

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack likes slow mo action scenes

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: All action romp, special effect bonanza
review_detailed_main:
Loved it, don't care what anyone else thinks!

Its a perfect follow on from part one and in my opinion makes part one better. This was great in every way, yes it's still cheesy, clichéd and has hints of things you have seen before but it's delivered in such a brilliant way that who bloody cares!

The bad guy delivers, the lead delivers, the supporting cast, the plan, the technology, the scenes & settings are all absolutely spot on. Yes, yes, the back story is flimsy at best but it is what it is, accept it, move on and you will enjoy what is an amazing follow up to the mediocre part one.

Action, action and more action, yes please, thank you very much.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
A second part even more tasteless than the first which brings nothing new with its false remake of The 7 Samurai accompanied with a lack of originality even more apparent than part 1.

Snyder prefers to focus on picking grains of wheat in slow motion than refining his story and worldbuilding. Where the first one made us discover crumbs which could have given rise to a fairly interesting universe, this second part is flat, without any flavor and quickly becomes forgettable after watching it.

There remain a few nice shots (especially the part with the origins of the different characters) and a fairly decent AD at times which leans towards Warhammer but all of this underused along a basic and lazy scenario.

By boasting its space opera, Snyder's Rebel Moon looks a lot like its Frankenstein creature. Bloated, useless and poseur even though it doesn't have the makings.

2/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Boring, weak plot but great visuals
review_detailed_main: Worse than part 1. Visually it is very good, but too many slow motions shots. The storyline is slow and dare I say boring. In many ways it views more like a draft, long harvest, drawn out group therapy (let's all try and get the audience to know us) and the obvious get ready for a big battle and who you will root for! Sadly I struggled to connect with any character. Even the base of the story I struggle with, why would a galactic empire use so much resources and give so much attention to a wheat harvest (maybe if the whole planet produced wheat! But a small village... come on). If you need something to have on in the background while you scroll TikTok, this is the film for you. Also useful if you can't sleep and need something to dull your mind.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Had very high expectations, lot of money spent but no script, not engaging at all.

It was slow start, I thought it will pick up pace, Kept waiting, picked pace only at the end. They did not have to make Part 2 for the small amount of content. Either should have added more substance or should have combined part 2 and 3. I waited for this movie and it was so disappointing. If not part of unnecessary content, this should have been a short movie. If not far so many slow motion sequences, it should have been a short movie. This should have been a 30 to 45 minutes movie.

I hope Netflix does not keep throwing money and has some quality control.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I really wanted to like it
review_detailed_main:
This movie is a rare beast. Actors are good, CGI are good to look at, photography is superb, storyline is nothing you haven't seen before.

It lacks a little something. It seemed like Zack just wanted to create a slideshow without any cohesion. At no given moment are the hero's in any sort of real danger. Bullets are raining from every corner of the screen and never connect with them. Houses explode everywhere and yet everyone is fine.

Exploding tanks will decimate enemy soldiers but would only refresh the hero's with a breeze from the blast.

Please Zack, don't grace us with a 'Snyder's cut' for this movie.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Both the first and this one were enjoyable adventures. I don't understand why this has as many negative reviews as it does. Maybe it's political? I don't know. I can just tell you, this was entertaining from beginning to end. Not like an award winning masterpiece, but just a good watch for the weekend. I would recommend.

There are some similarities to movies like the Star Wars franchise, but it's not like an exact rip off, and there is no Jar Jar equivalent to complain about. Even good shows like Book of Boba Fett.had things like the "Sesame Street biker gang" that make you facepalm, but I can't really point to anything hammy like that in Rebel Moon. It's a generally solid production.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I was looking forward to part two of this story, mostly because I was hoping that it would somehow save the first one. Oh boy was I wrong. The movie is extremely slow, every ten minutes I find myself sitting with my phone scrolling on social media because nothing happens. It's not until the one hour mark that things start to move forward.

Also, I really hope you like slow motion effects. The movie is just past the two hour mark in length. Without slow motion scenes it would probably barely touch 90 minutes. Yes, it's almost as if the director just discovered slow motion and has to use it everywhere.

I'm not going to go into spoilers or anything, there are plenty of plot holes and tons of question marks. Basically, if you didn't like part 1 you won't like part 2. If you did like part 1 you'll most likely be disappointed of part 2. Slow, dull and uninspiring.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I will cancel my Netflix account.

Look, Netflix makes a lot of great stuff. I really enjoyed Ripley as the most recent example. However we, the consumers, need to vote with our wallets and the fact that Netflix spent 200,000,000 USD on these two movies (not sure it's the exact number since I'm quoting second hand knowledge here, but it's a lot) is absurd. My mind boggles with what Netflix could have done with that money instead.

Now, this movie is absolutely absurd in all ways. I've seen some people quote "amazing sci-fi action sequences" as a reason to give higher ratings but they cannot have been seeing the same movie I saw. The obsessive use of slow motion, lense glare and utter stupidity in every situation makes every action sequences a parody of itself.

I loved 300, I think Watchmen is still underrated. This is a travesty of a movie, and a provocative waste of money.. Do not support this, please.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Makes 'damsel' seem like an orson Welles masterpiece
review_detailed_main:
Wow! Netflix just have money to burn financing drivel like this.

The script must have been written by A. I from 1997.

Slow motion cringe .

Characters that have zero charisma or personality; terrible exposition and just boring scene after boring scene.

Not sure how it ended because I couldn't bear to watch it to the end.

Zak Snyder needs to stop surrounding himself with 'yes-men' . How can anyone who saw this release it ??

Terrible dialogue- delivered badly and not even a case of 'style over substance ' visually. It's bland unoriginal directing by someone who thinks using slow motion changes a badly shot and acted scene into art.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
We've had some jarring cliffhangers over the years (Star Wars, Matrix series, that Hunger Game Catching Fire stunner), but two in a row? In bad movies, in a mess of a series of films? No thanks.

If you were hoping part 2 was going to redeem part 1...uh, no.

Zach Snyder's films look cool. No denying that. There's a following. That's indisputable.

But all of his films (with him writing in particular) have story, plot and dialogue issues. This film is no different.

There is so much exposition (indiscriminately dropped in) that the main story comes to a screeching halt every time. And that exposition? Stupid. Rehashed dull crap.

If you have never seen the several versions of Seven Samurai, watch any of them for a better play on the central plot in this film. George Lucas and others have already plundered great Japanese film epics and retreaded spaghetti westerns to develop science fiction films hundreds of times. The modern audience is wise to this, and there is so much content out there that they can smell lame junk from the back row.

There are too many coincidences, too many holes in the plot, too much lame dialogue (that some of the actors had HUGE difficulty delivering) and too many forced attempts at shock and awe.

It's a shame really. The small story idea around a rogue android gone wild is given scant service and little screen time. That story, expanded upon, could have been amazing. As it stands he shows up to save part of the day, and it's telegraphed from miles away. And the voice work for the Android is not right for his part. Feels like a strange homage to C-3PO.

If you finished Part I wondering why all these heroes were willing to risk their lives to rescue a backwater agricultural village on an unremarkable planet... and why an all powerful evil empire would waste resources on it... well, you're going to be seriously disappointed with the answer. Because it's a gigantic nothing burger.

Usually folks stick around in an action movie to watch the bad guy get clobbered. Well, not here. The front and center space nazi (brought back from the dead twice?) gets an important part of his body cut off by the heroine. But because this is the PG-13 cut, all of that takes place off screen. So no visual confirmation that the bad guy died. Lame.

And the big bad? The guy who has been giving all the orders, and brought nazi-Ned back from the dead? He never shows up. Ridiculous.

One of the biggest gripes I have with Snyder's films is that there is no comic relief. They all want to be taken so seriously that there is no joy when a hero succeeds, or a villain is defeated. It becomes more about reflecting on the loss and damage to arrive at the end result. Such a bummer.

And the ending? Nope. Another cliff hanger. Will there be a part 3? Please no.

So cue it up, watch it, shake your head, and then go watch The Seven Samurai.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
As someone who's long admired Zack Snyder's work, diving into "Rebel Moon" was an experience I was eagerly anticipating. Yet, from the opening scenes to the closing credits, I found myself grappling with a profound sense of disappointment. The expectation of embarking on another epic journey, similar to Snyder's past triumphs, quickly faded, replaced by a realization that this was not the masterpiece I had hoped for.

The casting, usually a strength in Snyder's projects, felt off this time around. Despite the presence of some notable names, the performances were lackluster, failing to captivate or convey the emotional depth typically associated with his films. It was as though the actors were not fully invested in their roles, or perhaps the direction failed to extract the best from this ensemble.

The narrative itself was another point of contention. Where Snyder's storytelling has often been praised for its complexity and depth, "Rebel Moon" presented a plot that felt superficial and unengaging. The storyline seemed to meander without a clear direction, leaving me yearning for the layered narratives I've come to expect from his work.

Comparing this to watching a short film on Dust - an outlet I admire for its innovative and thought-provoking content - might seem like an odd juxtaposition. However, the expectation for a Netflix and Zack Snyder collaboration is naturally set at a much higher bar. Dust shorts, while entertaining and insightful, operate within the realm of independent filmmaking, often with limited resources. In contrast, a project like "Rebel Moon," backed by Netflix's considerable resources and Snyder's visionary direction, should transcend these limitations.

Yet, the experience felt akin to watching one of those shorts, where the constraints are palpable, and the scope is inherently limited. This isn't to discredit Dust's contributions to the sci-fi genre but rather to highlight the disparity in expectations. From a powerhouse duo like Netflix and Zack Snyder, one anticipates a cinematic experience that pushes boundaries and sets new standards, not one that merely echoes the feel of an indie short film.

In sum, while "Rebel Moon" might have had the potential to be another jewel in Zack Snyder's crown, it ultimately fell short of the mark. It's a stark reminder that even the most successful filmmakers can sometimes miss the target, leaving fans like myself in a state of reflection on what could have been.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A sci-fi epic that hits hard.
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon 2: The Scargiver is an electrifying sequel that delivers on all fronts! From its gripping storyline to its breathtaking visuals, this sci-fi adventure keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.

The characters are well-developed and relatable, and the action sequences are nothing short of spectacular. Director Zack Snyder has once again crafted a masterpiece that will leave audiences wanting more. I especially liked the tanks and the final battle.

It reminds you in part of a Star Wars tale. The fight scenes were very good. I can understand if it does not appeal to everyone.

You either get it or you don't. Zack's style is slow motion heavy sequences filled with heavy actions scenes. If you are expecting an award winning script you won't find that here. It's more about world building and creating something fresh and new. A must-watch for any fan of the genre!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This film, like the one before it, takes slo-mo to ridiculous excess. It is not needed and becomes a total chore to sit through. It seems to have become Zack Snyders one-trick-pony and is really overused.

If that isn't enough the first half of the movie moves at such a glacial pace nothing of any interest happens. The actors are all mediocre to bad and I didn't develop any affinity to any of them or care about any of the characters at all.

Many of the plot elements make no sense at all, people have primative farming tools and advanced weapons, it's just badly thought out nonsense. Apparently this franchise was handed around and even supposed to be a Star Wars spin-off, its clear to see why nobody wanted it and I'm surprised Netflix hasn't cancelled it already.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder tries for a Disney contract it seems
review_detailed_main:
Unfortunately this shallow plot is even too simple for children, so I guess his go to get a Disney contract will not work out.

Just having a robot that is invincible, many children that look scared when around them killing is happening - but stay unharmed and a lot of drama in slow motion with artificial emotions from a huge background orchstra ... Looking back, even as a 10 year old I sure wasnt that hmm simple to find such "thing" he calls a movie interesting.

Sadly I wasted my time with this hmmm thing....

Or did he just take all the money and have AI create this 2 hour CGI animation - and now he's laughing at the money giver ?

That would be my only hopefull conclusion...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Part 1 was bad, this was an epic train wreck.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Anything from Zack Snyder is a flop
review_detailed_main:
Half the movie is slow motion and the plot is just barely done. Characters are not fleshed out and seem more like they belong in a brothel from GOT. We don't ever feel like any of the character is worth liking or binding with emotionally. Everything is so robotic.

Typical Zack Snyder movie - plot, characters and storyline fell short. And the CGI is below average. Feels like a Star Wars rip off.

So many scenes were irrelevant to the plot. Why do we need 10 mins of farming slowmotion? Please can we all petition for Zack Snyder to never make a movie again?!!! We've had enough flops with his DC movies why now Netflix?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Never thought I'd see it in a movie, but, now I have...
review_detailed_main:
While the visuals can be quite nice in places, it lacks enough plot to make it worthwhile as an overall film. It feels like so much time was wasted on unnecessary elements, most of which should have been established in the previous entry.

It also suffers from the worst of Snyder's tendencies, which we all know by now, and probably should've been edited differently as the pacing wasn't great.

I personally felt that the first movie should've dealt with much of the characters bonding and backstory, mainly because out of two films we barely know anything about the motives of either faction and the movie hints at a lot more under the surface, it just doesn't ever get around to telling or showing any of it.

I never thought I'd see it in a movie (partly because it's not something I ever thought would be in a movie), but, slow-motion corn harvesting is that thing! Life is now complete.

Overall, while it had some pretty shots and VFX, it was a lacklustre experience with too many narrative and pacing problems to move it much past the 5* mark. These last two movies are why Zack Snyder is a director that needs someone to reign him in from time to time.

Snyder once said he doesn't use slow-mo that much, but this movie alone has enough slow-mo that you could play four of five action movies by other directors, and they would still have less than this one does.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I thought both movies were great. I'm easily entertained but I thought both movies had great acting and great special effects and great dialogue and great storylines. There's not much that holds my attention nowadays but these movies absolutely did.

To get to the 600 word count:

I thought both movies were great. I'm easily entertained but I thought both movies had great acting and great special effects and great dialogue and great storylines. There's not much that holds my attention nowadays but these movies absolutely did.

Do a Diddy Diddy dum diddy do do . Do a Diddy Diddy dum diddy do do.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
It's a movie without any identity of its own as it plucks scenes from a half dozen other movies from Avatar to Serenity to Gladiator, and of course Star Wars. The costumes look like something from a high school production.

The dialogue is equally bad, the kind where you feel embarrassed when someone walks in to the room and hears what you're watching. Plot? It's equally bad. At one point they are digging trenches to "surprise" the enemy?? How do trenches do that against an enemy from the sky?

Then there's the endless slow motion scenes. It's an effective technique but the movie can't go five minutes without using it.

And if that's not reason enough, how about a coal powered spaceship? No joke. Lol.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: If you think the first one was bad...
review_detailed_main:
Part 2 of this movie tries to find the few good qualities of the first and makes sure to remove them for the second installment.

There's really not much to see here. About 90% of the movie is one big slow-motion battle scene. More time is spent in slow motion than normal speed.

Snyder is great with cinematograph and should stick to making trailers or work for national geographic. He has no skill for storytelling, and once again it shows in his movies.

I'm a sucker for almost any sci-fi, but even I could barely stand to watch this.

Almost no story, lazy character building, and way too long of a movie.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This was more of a rant than anything, it's not like Snyder is going to read this and take it to heart. As a director, at what point do you actually sit back and reevaluate your filmmaking? I ask this, because Zack Snyder doesn't seem to care, or even try to learn and improve from missteps - such as an over reliance on slow-motion. I say this as a viewer that always hopes for a director to turn out a good product. But aside from a few okay extended cuts, his films have been largely misses.

If you are reading this, you might've already made up your mind as to whether or not you'll view this sequel. I'm just here to vent like almost everyone on the internet. The Scargiver is somehow worse than its predecessor, and also less exciting. There is a core concept that seems to be interesting despite multiple elements being lifted from properties such as Star Wars. Which makes it even worse knowing that it's squandered. Such as character development, and overall plot structure.

Now, I know Zack Snyder trolls will say, "Just wait for his extended cut. That's when it gets good". Problem is, there's nothing about this "franchise" that would justify, or improve the movie to warrant an extended cut. Zack Snyder shouldn't make his name being a director that makes good extended cut - he hasn't earned it. It's just a marketing gimmick for himself and his followers. Even then, some of his extended cuts are simply 'fine'. If you can't make some sort of coherent product on the first initial cut, then you probably aren't cut out to be a director.

I say this as someone who wants to see him succeed. By all accounts Zack Snyder seems like a nice man with a signature visual flare. What he needs is a good set of writers, and people to reel him in when he gets off the rails. I hope he moves on to different projects and gets his footing, but by all accounts, The Scargiver is part two in a franchise that's already exhausting.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I haven't reviewed in a while and although this film is already ranking so low I still needed to get my thoughts out. I've liked other Snyder productions but Rebel Moon Part I was bad and part II was even worse. The first installment left such little impressions that I completely forgot there'd be a second part.

Well, I thought, why not see it through to the end? (And I sure hope this is the end of rebel moon) There is no engaging story, there are so many plot holes/nonsensical scenes and/or dialogues.

Most of all, I never cared. I was never made to care for the protagonists, the village, the "heroes" and I was never made to feel fear, anger or dislike for the antagonists.

A few good special effects (outnumbered by many poor ones) and the slow motion scenes were painful. The score was boring and predictable.

I feel bad for a couple of actors who I assume tried their best. With such a poor script and such poor direction I'm not sure how they could've done anything different.

I surely hope this is the last of rebel moon. Netflix should spend its money on more quality productions.

This was not an epic story, just an epic fail.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Mystery Science Theater 3000 Will Have a Heyday With This!
review_detailed_main: Remember those guys? Mystery Science Theater 3000's characters, famous for their late night ruthless satire with razor sharp sarcastic dub overs of some of the cheesiest sci-fi ever made. Well, they will have a heyday with the Rebel Moon movies. Part 1 was bad, but Part 2 seals the series' fate. Man, it's sooooo bad. It shows us just how far Netflix has fallen in the quality of its originals. A new low indeed. Horrible story, worsened by ridiculously bad acting, and topped off by pitiful directing. It's as if nobody who worked on it actually watched it before releasing it. And what the heck is the deal with the forced, over-used bokeh effect in most of the scenes? Trying to hide something with everything out of focus? There's not enough bokeh in the world to fix this embarrassment to the sci-fi genre. Mystery Science Theater guys, have fun with this one!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
And that is where his director skills were accomplished.

This movie is why I don't have a Netflix subscription. Unwatchable, a vegan lasagna with vegetable cheese!

Time to boycott Zack. Worst ever (big budget) movie ever made has got to be Justice League...but this Rebel Moon also unwatchable.

Junk dialogue, poor plot, with lots of slow-mo, Zack's post production spice of choice.

Why Zack Snyder, why do you believe you are a relevant director? Get your head checked, you are waste of space in the industry, and Netflix - why do you fund junk moviemaking.

I read Rebel Moon has been watched by more people than Barbie...well I could 'giggle' at Barbie but I stopped your slow mo, no action masterpiece 10 minutes in!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
While I might be among the minority who found Part 1 somewhat enjoyable, I can't extend the same courtesy to Part 2. As a long-time Snyder fan, I've admired his talent as a director with his distinct visual style, but unfortunately, Rebel Moon Part 2 falls victim to its dreadful script.

This movie is a disaster.

There are few good qualities in this chaotic mess of a film. The cast delivers reasonable performances given the material they're handed, and some action sequences showcase Snyder's prowess in that arena. Similar to Michael Bay, he knows how to handle action. However, any praise ends there.

Part 2 is a tedious, uninspired, and ultimately futile mess. The first half retells what we've already endured in Part 1, with numerous scenes and flashbacks serving no purpose other than to elongate the runtime. The antagonist, whom I couldn't even summon the effort to look up, is forgettable at best, similar of Captain Phasma from the Star Wars sequel trilogy - appearing, delivering a few lines, then promptly getting beaten and bashed.

There's little else to say about this film. It's a lackluster science fiction flick devoid of imagination, burdened by lackluster world-building, forgettable characters, and a narrative so unengaging you'd find more entertainment watching paint dry. It's annoying because Snyder has proven himself capable of greatness in the past. If further installments are going to be made, then they need to improve the script, because I would say I've seen better writing in Twilight.

Rating: 3/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It would make a good comedy
review_detailed_main:
Just finished watching this movie. Imperial ships versus a single village looked cool. An axe man versus soldiers with heavy armor looks impressive too. Motivational lines never leave you wanting more. Historical flashbacks win over school lessons in history. You can even learn how to sing different kinds of songs by watching this movie.

It would make a good comedy if they added more jokes to it. Sometimes it is really funny. If you watch carefully you can see a few hilarious jokes, but overal the humor parts are constantly interrupted by the unnecessary long talks. Still better than "Fallout".

2 stars for trying and no more.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Ok so apart from the long drawn out storyline where they get to know each others nonsense some of the action was pretty good but then they started using some crazy side lighting effect that covers the whole screen in a bright light like something you get from a camera lens only not if you was looking at it normally with your own 2 eyes and this was then repeated for ever blast shot in the entire movie omg what the craziness was the special effects director thinking ?

Just seriously get a grip of the effects team you work with as they destroyed what might have been a good movie.

Also do not take so long to make a sequel.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Great movie, epic, beautiful, row and highly entertained
review_detailed_main: Zack Snyder's latest film is an absolute triumph! With a blend of stunning visuals, epic storytelling, and breathtaking action sequences, it delivers an unforgettable cinematic experience. From start to finish, the movie immerses you in its beautifully crafted world, leaving you on the edge of your seat throughout. The sheer scale and ambition of the project are awe-inspiring, and Snyder's vision shines through in every frame. It's a rollercoaster ride of emotions, keeping you engaged and entertained from beginning to end. And with the promise of Heavy Metal versions to come, the excitement only grows. To those who doubt Snyder's genius, this film is a definitive answer - a masterpiece that demands to be seen. So, to the haters, as the saying goes, 'su*** it, Gunntars!' Get ready for a cinematic journey like no other, because Zack Snyder has once again raised the bar.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Like a Ferrari without an engine
review_detailed_main:
Looks beautiful, but once you get in it & try to start it, something is absolutely wrong. You open the hood & get back out to check - NOTHING IN THERE. So you walk away, saying 'oh well' .. THE END.

An incredible movie except for the characters, the plot, the script, the pacing, character development. The kind of movie that you MUST fast forward to get through, in the hopes that what happens next might be slightly more interesting than slo-mo shots of the village people HARVESTING FRICKING WHEAT.

There is absolutely no way this is the finished, final film - that the producers and studios watched, after which they said YEP, all done! NO WAY.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I dont know how Snyder keep getting work
review_detailed_main:
I thought the first one was bad.........

If part one was the bar it still was set below it - but damn this "movie" is horrible. I mean absolutley horrible. Now imagine if you actually went to the theater and had to pay for the ticket.

People thinks its horrible and no money was exchanged (its included in the Netflix membership)

Snyder was never the greatest story teller - great visually. But he could def get by. Its just got worse and worse with every movie.

A friend needs to talk to him and tell him to stop making movies or at a min stop directing these turds.

I feel so bad for him.

"Release the non-snyder cut"

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: So I actually liked the first movie haha.
review_detailed_main:
I feel like I'm in the minority here, but I actually watched Part 1 several times. I thought it was pretty good despite all the characters coming together feeling rushed and not fully developed. It was probably a 7/10 for me. Flawed but fun.

I fully expected Part 2 to pick up on character development and was genuinely excited for it. But this was truly a trainwreck. I felt frustrated the entire time having to watch it and I couldn't wait for it to end. Me being emotionally invested in the characters never happened, so when people started dying, I could honestly care less.

Zack Snyder doesn't have the best track record and I truly think this cemented such a low opinion of him now that I will never be able to shake.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's just bad, not even funny bad.
review_detailed_main:
The first movie was meh, but this one is just painful to watch. If Snyder had made this movie in the 80s, it could have become been a classic. Filming this in nowaday, it's just embarrassing.

This movie is so dumb that I lost a few brain cells watching it.

I think this man is completely out of touch with modern filmmaking and reality in general.

Natural character development - nah. Here is a table, 5 minutes and we will pour all our backstory on you.

Some sort of logical military combat - pew pew. Oh, sorry. We forgot to clean up the glass on the enemy's helmet, they are completely blind. We also gave them a lot of sedatives so we wouldn't have to film them in slow motion.

However, the grain harvest scene was top notch. Zack should make documentaries about farming. That is his strength.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
You remember that kid in High School? The one that loved Star Wars and wanted to be a film maker? He might have told you about this amazing concept he had centred on Wheat? Then you totally forgot about it and he went to College to study Geopolitical Accounts of the 15th Century, with a minor in French Revolutionary Architecture? Yeah, that one.

Some one gave him millions upon millions to make this absolute masterclass in plagerism (homage) and poor plot construction (use sooo muuuch slooow moooo). It's arty right? Right?!?!

There is no point trying to plot this thing out, or find any semblance of even bare bones reasoning for it's barely there plot. So I'll surmise the whole thing with 'ugg men bad, woman good'

Yours sincerely A woman demanding a time machine back to 90s cinema.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This film is in by no way perfect, however an overall rating of 5.2 is a disgraceful misjudgement! For a straight to streaming sci-fi, this is an epic. An all out action thriller with great performances, superb special effects, and all our resistance war.

Yes there is some slow-Mo (less than the first) - This seems most reviewers problem - I'm fine with it and in some cases, added beautifully to the action.

Not enough in the film to love the characters etc (bar the robot) but a fun ride all the same. Would have loved this to have been a series beginning with each warriors story as an individual episode.

Enjoy it on your own terms and ignore the Star Wars fan boys.

8/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Let's start with my first criticism: Pointless. This was famously Zak Snyder's attempt at making a Star Wars movie but Disney was smart enough to turn him down, so he very thinly disguised the Star Wars elements and made it anyway. So it's just bad Star Wars. But beyond that his whole new idea to freshen up the Star Wars universe? A bad Seven Samurai remake. So something that's already been done mixed a something else that's already been done. Pointless.

Now saying it was Underdeveloped is a soft criticism. Snyder has his own extended cuts of these films that may correct some of the TERRIBLE pacing, but I can't see that being enough. This felt like someone shot an entire 8 Episode series and condensed it into 2 movies. And frankly, Snyder is just not a good writer. In fact, he's quite bad. I think he is a great director, he can make things look good, but this was just embarrassing at times. The battle scenes felt like a bunch of 8 year old's playing war in their back yard. So much of this movie was stuff presented as being very important with nothing to make the audience feel that way. There are cinematic cues that imply a feeling, but no information. Like all of the stuff with the robot being presented all dramatically. Who was he again? Someone who was mentioned for 3 seconds in the first movie? You can cue the music and people can gasp, but I'm still confused.

Maybe I'll give em another try when Snyder releases his versions, but as it stands these two movies are just bad.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Regardless of disliking the first film, I wanted to give the sequel a shot, thinking maybe the conclusion of the story would somehow improve these films. I was wrong, very wrong. It is exactly more of the same. Here Kora along her companions barricade themselves in 'Veldt', Kora's home, and prepare for the attack of the Realms forces. With cringe worthy dialogue, an unbelievably annoying villain and yet again a predictable chain of events, this film flopped miserably.

I am guessing both films were filmed simultaneously for there were no improvements whatsoever from the backlash of the first film. Most performances were weak and over dramatic, a lot of which in my opinion is due to the writing. I had numerous points in the film where I laughed uncontrollably while supposedly serious scenes were taking place.

Kora's narrative for this entire film was to earn herself redemption for her previous actions and by doing so maybe start a new, peaceful life. That's why in her moment of truth she completely abandons her moral plans and has a change of heart. Her character was written to be a selfless hero, but to me came out as a pretentious bore.

More of the same. Visually boring, bad writing and bad performances. Again, the ending is meant to set up more sequels that I believe won't happen. Not recommended.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I had hope that part two would be better than one but gosh this is like we'll have a little excitement in the first 30 minutes then proceed to have dreadful farm nonsense for way too long and not enough action till the last hour. Zack Snyder used to have some awesome movies like Dawn of the Dead remake, Sucker Punch, and Watchmen is masterful not sure about the last 4 movies even Justice League got hate until the long cut was released HBO along with Batman Vs. Superman is cheesy; just seems his movies got worse after each one and I'm pleased with the loads of hate Rebel Moon got!

The action is far and between or similar to that saying the best of it is basically stolen Star Wars with a different style to it maybe that's something the creators would be proud of it cause is kinda satisfying doesn't help much though. Movies like this and Unfrosted make me glad I don't use Netflix as much as other services. Rebel Moon should've been a mini series maybe that'd be different, I'm very disappointed.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's not a movie, it's just time killer
review_detailed_main: I think you're confusing two things together here, if you want to rate a "fun", happy and playful time, it might pass, but if you want to rate this "work" as a movie, it's just terribly bad. Not only does the script not make sense, it contradicts itself in some sequences. There's no character development to speak of, not only do they behave oddly and against their characters, it's written objectively, they just serve as tools for the next big scene. And that I think is the biggest problem with this film, you have no one to identify with, it's impossible, Mr. Director has made a moving poster for how he would imagine a sci-fi soap opera. The dramaturgy is absolutely non-existent, there was no one there to not only watch over the characters, the dialogue, but also the setting and the complexity of the scenes. The music is dysfunctional, absolutely monumental in the banal scenes, and conversely, in the powerful scenes, either weak or completely unemotional. It's sad to see the director of such a seminal pop culture film as Watchmen get to direct Rebel Moon. I hope no one gives him money for a third sequel... I don't think I can bear to see another slow-motion scene of an early-dead princess walking through a wheat field, and Mr. Snyder will be in the category of directors: hands off.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: This Is a Victorian Wedding Cake
review_detailed_main:
So I survived it. This isn't one of the worst movies, and the visuals recommend it, but that's about it. The story simply didn't make any sense: You have a ruthless military man after just enough flour to keep his troops fed for a few days until he finds out that the moon is hiding someone he's been looking for. She grabs some soldiers to help defend the moon, and then it's their forces in opposition.

There's a lot of filler in the movie. Everyone has to harvest the wheat BY HAND because the good guys need to be as anti-tech as possible (despite their weapons, their cybernetics, their spaceships, and some meds) and that slow-motion montage is followed by weapons training that takes up less time (because they're hunters, I guess, even though some of these people have no idea how to hold a rifle).

There's even a section where everyone tells their background while sitting around that could have been handled by a few lines of dialog. Even the bad guy does stuff just so you'll know he's a bad guy; he's leader just because he's scary not because he's good at it.

The acting is all over the place: It's usually pretty good but that's mostly because of the actors, not the direction; they take what they have and go for it. The heroine and villain, however, must have gained twenty pounds each from the amount of scenery they ate; she's sad and moody and he's just vile, but between them, they just don't take their roles above two dimensions.

You just don't believe the soldiers were chosen for their training because they're just video game targets. The defenders are even worse because you see a lot of solo action rather than anyone really supporting one another; if they had, then the fight would have been a lot shorter.

The visuals are awesome, however. Everything looks great, there are some iconic moments, and it's gorgeous. I love their glowy swords more than those in Star Wars, the costumes were beautiful, and the griffins against spaceships were great. I just wish the tech felt more futuristic; I love steampunk, but powering ships through coal just felt weird.

In essence, this is what happens if you mashed the stories of Star Wars and Seven Samurai together and threw in elements of Jupiter Ascending. Incredible visuals, but it's missing so much else.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Watched it in the special Toronto screening thanks to Netflix.
