There's a lot I can talk about how much I love Pt 2. One can see "300 war sequence era Zack Snyder" return in the Normandy invasion inspired battle, recharged. Minute references to snyderverse done in new ways. BvS UE and this, Zack. Snyder's "absolute CINEMA" sequel.

If this was mind-blowing I can't even imagine what the directors cut of Pt 2 is gonna be. Especially can't wait for more of Jimmy.

The duel in the climax is the best sci Fi lightsaber battle since Revenge of the sith.

People have to understand Snyder's long form storytelling and how he split a four act structured movie into two parts instead of a traditional 3 act movie, which is in itself innovative. Many issues people had in Pt 1 are addressed.

In conclusion, if you love action and missed 300 era Snyder watch this movie.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Is it this bad on purpose?
review_detailed_main:
Does Snyder make these atrocities on purpose so he can then release a 5hr Snyder cut that makes maybe 5% more sense in b/w and adds at least 45min of slowmo montages?

This movie is bad. Not fun bad. Just pure unadulterated bad.

It's like they fed multiple AI writers and then had a 3rd AI writer randomly place the scenes.

It's terrible. It makes no sense. There is nothing compelling that happens. The first half hour is multiple slowmo wheat harvest montages.

How does this guy keep getting to make movies? If this is the script they sent out and actors read it and said oh wow I need to be in this movie. They should hire someone to slap them every time they feel the same about another movie.

It's so bad. So so so so bad.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Significantly Worse than Part One, If You Can Imagine It
review_detailed_main:
This movie is pretty much an unwatchable bore-fest.

Slower than dripping molasses. With every "action" scene filmed in even more boring slow motion.

Oh, yeah the actors are good and the movie has a "look" to it, but it's also derivative and steals from every sci fi film ever made. Especially Star Wars, which this movie was supposed to be a part of. Or at least Snyder, who seems to ruin everything he touches thought it would.

It was rejected. Then it was supposed to be a theatrical movie. Nope. Then Netflix got it. There's reason for this -- it sucks.

Boring scenes that have nothing to do with forwarding the plot go on and on just to pad the movie's length. We have to sit through maybe a half hour of people getting carpets as gifts, with each having a story, then ridiculous meaningless dancing and then an idiotic song and as if that's not enough there's an additional segment tacked on where each person has to verbalize some jerky back story that again does nothing for the movie or story-line except to put you to sleep.

It's horrible and Zack Snyder needs to be drummed out of Hollywood. He has no talent.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Wow what a bunch of bs

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: This is not a film for the gluten intolerant
review_detailed_main:
The Space USS Dwight D Eisenhower aircraft carrier and its full battle group was on its way (full steam) to a Space Mennonite community to demand what 50 people have harvested by hand.

The onboard Cinnabon must be doing a roaring trade and crew moral heavily dependant on it, that can be the only explanation.

Sound ridiculous? That's because it is ....

For this to be made, it must give hope to any asylum dweller able to hold a crayon that someday they can walk a red carpet.

It seems Netflix looked at what was deemed a good thing 10 years ago and said "ahhh Mr S, how blank do you want that chequebook?". Looking forward to MH370's black box, Brazil World Cups and Ebola vaccine being announced as being green lit as directors of their next three projects.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
If you're going to tell this story once again, have better execution. This was a very forgettable effort.

I like a lot of the actors in this, but so much of the dialogue is stilted and cliched. Zack Snyder uses slow motion in action sequences like Homer Simpson uses star wipe. Two different characters do the "superhero landing", one of which is an android. I don't know how this is supposed to work, but the big spaceship appears to be coal powered somehow?

On the plus side, Sky Yang wears very tight fitting shirts for most of it, and (all too briefly) none at all. I guess the giant birds were kinda cool too.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Ok, first I'll review the movie. It's a Snyder film, you should know what to expect. It's gonna look great, be action packed, contain slow-mo, and veer towards style over substance. It delivers on all counts. These are the components he uses every time, it ain't gonna change. If you expect anything else you should know better, that's YOUR fail, not Snyder's (unless he came over to your gaff and made you watch the film at gun point). It's a solid, entertaining two hours and a decent way to relax your way through an evening. 7.5 outta 10 rounded up to 8 for IMDB

Now let's discuss the one star reviewers and 'worst film of all time, burn him at the stake, cut off his manhood, ban him from ever using a camera again' clowns who need to get a grip. I'm no Snyder fanboy. I will say that visually I do think he's a cut above the pack, but also think in other aspects he's definitely lacking. What I am a fan of though, is entertainment. Not every piece of film or TV has to make complete logical sense, or be grounded in absolute realism. Breaking down and critiquing the logic in an ACTION sci-fi film makes no sense. We are not talking about hard sci-fi here. This is no 'Arrival' or 'Interstellar' and neither does it claim to be. Stop being a killjoy and remember what it was like to have fun watching a film again. If you can't do that, then at least remember that if you see Snyder's name attached to something that you should know what to expect and if you don't want that, to give it a miss.

Lastly, let's stop pretending like Star Wars has more than two great movies (one of these is a prequel, which I'll leave unnamed just to annoy the worst breed of fanboy), and two great seasons of TV. Everything else is literally the same quality as the two parts of Rebel Moon, or considerably worse. I would watch this over ANY of the sequel trilogy any day.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A bit like a Lava cake with toohpaste filling
review_detailed_main:
Note: This review is intended to cover both parts 1 and 2 of Rebel Moon.

Geez, this looked like it would be so good. So good you want to set a special night aside to watch it, switch off your phone, cuddle with your significant other, and enjoy a special treat. But it's such a huge disappointment. I went in absolutely wanting and expecting to love this. The special affects and design are gorgeous, Snyder's distinct action style is fun, if not particularly surprising anymore. But the writing...whew. What a heck of a bottleneck.

Every character is unequivocally flat in the least fun way. The script could have used a massive punch-up, because the dialogue is almost entirely utilitarian. If you like one-liners or just any expression of individualistic personality from a large ensemble cast, look much farther than here. The story feels incredibly reductive. Every character looks good on a marketing poster, but what you see is entirely what you get. The movie offers absolutely nothing from its characters beyond that first impression, and it's not the actors' fault--they're just not given anything to do that provides an opportunity to show any emotional range, hero and villain alike.

The story is equally one-dimensional and predictable. If you're a fan of fantasy/sci fi, there's nothing here you won't feel like you've seen a hundred times before, and what's more, it doesn't even feel like they tried. And I'm not criticizing what I see as a failed attempt at trying something new, or flipping a tired trope--I could respect a good effort. There's no impression at all that the creative team even wanted to break ground with this film. It's like they sat down to plan and said to each other, "Let's go back to basics, guys--let's write like our audience hasn't seen a science fiction film since 1960."

Again, I want to stress that I went into this film biased in its favor. I wanted to find something, anything, to love about it, but just couldn't.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Editor: how many slow-mos?

Zack Snyder: Yes!!!!

This movie would be normal length (or shorter) without all the slow-motion scenes and that probably would've been better for the pace.. who the f thinks showing someone refilling his water-bottle in slow-mo is a good idea?

It makes you think: what will the Zack Snyder cut be like? 4 hours slow-motion only?

Also the overly melodramatic protagonists just get me not caring for them as it's all too ... well, melodramatic and over-the-top.

All this movie does is too in-your-face and wannabe. And the story is just a bit too dumb, just a star war over a farm, ridiculous.

I sometimes think that some filmmakers just use such lame plots to have a reason to throw in fights, explosions and visual fx. It's not like before anymore where fx were used for world-building and immersion of a great story.

Like someone wrote in a review for the first part, this movie seems like a Star Wars fan fiction of a high school nerd. This time there even was kind of a lightsaber fight, though in bad .. and they had the colors wrong, good is blue and red is evil, not the other way around. XD

If they really do more of this, I will pass. I watched the first and wasn't impressed. Now I watched this hoping it'll get better, but it didn't.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Snyder will hopefully be directing straight to video soon...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I found the first part watchable although hardly too good. But this was definitely worse and barely watchable. It is a mish mash of ideas from previous films with hideous writing that is extremely canned/trite and just nonsense frequently. Every character is one dimensional with no flavor. And the setup/scenario is absurd. Very advanced military characters fighting farmers which are a mix of Vikings and simpletons with some using ancient hand held weapons. Finally about 70% of the movie is simply fighting and an overdose of SFX. Netflix failed when they decided to fund, and probably with some big bucks, such a lackluster mess.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Waste of Financial Resources to make this.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: You people are crazy for not liking this movie!
review_detailed_main: I wasn't sure how I felt about part 1. It wasn't that good. But it was also only half the movie so you don't really get the whole picture til you see part 2. But holy cow is at good. I was on the edge of my seat the entire time I watched. All the combat sequences were done really good. Yes, there's not really much blood or anything. But the fact that a small village of farmers take on an entire empire, every single character is really well cast. And you can definitely see the Star wars influences mixed in with some seven samurai. I can't wait to see the directors cuts of these movies. We should support movies like this because they are rare.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
If you're here to find out if you should waste your time watching the second installment in Zack Snyders "epic space saga" I am here to tell you please don't waste your time because it only gets worse and here's why

Rebel Moon 2 " The Scargiver " crashes and burns faster than a spaceship hitting a forcefield. With a plot as thin as space dust, viewers are left adrift in a sea of confusion and disappointment. The narrative jumps from one disjointed scene to another, leaving audiences wondering if they accidentally boarded the wrong spaceship.

Cinematography? More like slow-motion overload. Every action sequence drags on longer than a black hole devouring a star, making even the most epic space battles feel like watching paint dry in zero gravity.

Forced character romances feel as genuine as a malfunctioning droid, and the acting is so wooden you'd think the cast was made of recycled spacecraft parts. When characters meet their demise, it's hard to summon even a pixel of emotion - a testament to how little the audience cares about their fate.

Rebel Moon 2 shamelessly pilfers elements from iconic sci-fi and fantasy franchises like Star Wars and Lord of the Rings, but instead of paying homage, it feels like a cheap knockoff sold at a spaceport gift shop. It's a failed attempt to blend epic storytelling with interstellar adventure, leaving viewers wishing they could warp-speed out of the theater before the credits roll.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Terrible script and characters in Magnificent 7/7 Samurai rip off
review_detailed_main:
Well it looks good. And that's the positives over with.

Everything else is rubbish. The plot is a rip off. The characters are paper thin and badly acted.

Zach Snyder may make beautiful looking movies but he cannot write worth a tap.

The slow mo editing is grating and predictable after a while. Style is one thing but Snyder Is a one trick pony of a director.

There are far too many characters in the film for us to care about and none of them have any traits that make them interesting.

If this was supposed to be Star Wars movie that got rejected, I'm glad it did. Although with what has happened to Star Wars recently, well, don't get me started.

Is it too much to ask for a passable, well written movie?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: If part one can do it then why not part two do worse

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Star Wars Episode 2 meets Battlefield Earth.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Part 1 was a beautiful eye candy mess of a predictable sci-fi movie. Unfortunately, Part 2 doesn't build any supporting character depth and only showcases a lack of connection between anyone worth caring about, even when they die. Oh, there's plenty of time to mourn them in their slow motion Bugs Bunny death scene, it's just that no one really cares while they check their phone apps in meh as the hero breathes their last gasps. Even when the stereotypical love story arises during the conflict, it feels detached and unbelievable.

Overall, the story falls flat and the slow motion is very overused like a podcast stuck at half speed. At some point you're just hoping it finishes quickly like that little league game you attended where your kiddo's team got smoked, your bleachers were silent, and you happily started thinking about the traffic on your drive home if you left soon.

Do I recommend it? Not really. Would I watch another episode of what looks like a trilogy? Probably, but not with haste. #Completist.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I stopped watching about 10 minutes into the movie because it starts out with Kora plowing a field with a horse drawn plow but then when she goes into her house the door is an automatically closing door? With also what looks like LED lighting. I know its a sci fi fantasy film and that sometimes you have to dispel belief a little but I just thought that didn't make any sense. I then read some of the reviews mostly 1or 2 stars and decided not to waste any more time. I was actually hoping it was going to be better. Maybe if I have some more time to waste I'll give it another chance. Isee some of the reviews say part 2 is better. I certainly hope so.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: There will be less mouths to feed.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It is true, this is a cheap Star Wars knockoff.
review_detailed_main: Horrible plot. Terrible acting. Weak characters. Storyline is a ripoff of Star Wars. Even has lightsaber type swords and a rebel force. Don't waste your time. I love movies and like many others hate. This one is the exception. HORRIBLE!! The last lines of the movie are silly and it leaves itself open to a part 3. I hope that doesn't happen. How much more of this can people tolerate. I also don't know why reviews are required to be so long. The movie sucks the end. I have 125 more characters so I'll tell you about my cat! My cat hated this movie. I saw a mouse in the corner watching this and the mouse walked up to my cat and put itself in my cat's mouth. Don't bother with this junk.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Looks good but the acting is horrible.
review_detailed_main:
Its a classic Nextflix movie.

All the bad guys are white men with robots putting out hugh black fumes clouds into the atmosphere.

All the heroes are mix race, asian, african and well, pretty much evry other race then white.

Evry dialogue is horrible, the voices just doesent match the scence.

They try putting out emotional speaches with amazing music but no, just no. I was using headphones and i litterly took them off during several scenes. It just so painfully tragic that i just couldent even lisen.

Only netflix whould found a movie like this, i like Znyder but i dont understand how they pickt this actors..

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Theres something that you get when you watch a Zack Snyder movie, and that is a quintessentially knowing you are watching a movie that HE made, in all aspects.

The visuals are stunning and visceral. The story purposefully simple. The music endearing and moving. The characters, especially Ed Skrien, not purposefully funny but somehow able to be "real" in both their terrifying portrayals and grounded takes.

Is this going to appeal to everyone?

No, it shouldn't either, Zack makes movies he loves, for his fans.

2 hours flow by easily simple because it settles in at its own pacing, the visuals are realistic and easy on the eyes, every frame of every scene is beautiful whether you like it or not, and I wish it was longer, but I enjoyed it thoroughly.

Zack also includes an understanding of various things, thought provokingly that you dont normally consider or see in other war/sci-fi movies, such as the farming on the outskirts of a outgoing war, is actually essentially for troops, the sabers cutting through air and the hilt burning your hands, are just a few of these.

See this movie with open eyes, not wanting it to be like everything else.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Zack Snyder continues on his quest to be George Lucas, but his Rebel Moon, an attempt of creating a Star Wars story, falls completely flat. If you thought Part One was awful, Part Two makes it look good. Remember, with Zack Snyder movies, Fast Forward is your best friend. No idea why anyone would think a longer version, called a Director's Cut, somehow makes a bad movie better. It does not! It only makes a bad movie longer. Rebel Moon is a collective mess. It copies parts of Star Wars, Gladiator, uses names from the Roman Empire, has bad guys with uniforms and marching boots modeled after Nazis, and adds a C3PO-type robot named Jimmy who ends up being a hero. The dialog at best is juvenile and only magnifies the poor acting from the second-rate actors selected to make this embarrassment of a film. Add in odd-looking aliens using British phrases like "Oi," Irish folk music and dance which obviously originated from the Irish immigrants, and more blood and gore than in you would see in a slaughterhouse, and you have a ridiculously bad movie. The movie ending indicates there could be a potential Part 3, but why? One and Two were bad enough. Why waste more money and effort to create another awful movie.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Emperor : fly one of our biggest ships to pick up some wheat

Lacky: ugh.. you know we could just grow some out back... or maybe have robots do it

Emperor: silence !

Auditor: "who the hell spent 8 billion crono dollars on moving 5000 men to pick up a bunch of wheat??"

CFO: Ok. We really have to cut back on the white bread and carbs. You know we could just buy a few green houses?

Emperor: really?

CFO: yes. You know we hve the ability to travel in space and have lazer guns. Even a 12 year old can grow beans in a gardennor even an egg carton.

Movie sucked.

I created this account just to vent how horrid it was.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: This has to be an AI experiment
review_detailed_main:
The only explanation I have for this incoherent mess of a scenario is that it was written by an LLM. I cannot make sense of it in any other way.

It is very similar to the first part, but somehow worse. The cinematography is great. The production in general is really good. But why couldn't they pay someone to write an actual scenario for this? Is this an experiment to check if AI can replace writers? Is just Snyder taking the piss? I cannot tell, but it is actually interesting. I would like to know.

Also what is this thing with the slow motion farming? Did they just give full artistic control to the AI?

Anyway, I watched the second part after watching the first for the same reasons I watched the room twice. It's just too bad to skip.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Riding through Rohan, somehow feeling like farming in the shire ... then like being in the tavern ... and the singing of the fellowship - sorry general ... scenery and music ... it all reminds me.

A crashed ship that is able to fly ... no effort needed ...

Scenes that look super familiar ... Dialog holes, and story jumps ... horses with masks (not even their bodies were tuned with cgi) I am quite annoyed. Suddenly every one knows all villagers ... costumes are super uninspired, boring and normal ... (yes there are a few minor exceptions)

And I didn't knew how long 5 days through background telling can take.

Keep your suits, they seem future proof, at least by looking at this movie.

But there is more ... btw: Netflix allows skipping forward, use it, skip to the sci-fi scenes.

The spaceships and space sceneries are amazing. And at least there's a hovering cart at the farmers village - first tech there. The weapons look funny.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Highly recommended. Incredibly well made.

The pace that grew in intensity as the movie progressed, the deeply sincere acting, the legendary music, the battles - the atmosphere and action were superb!

The harvest scene is so emotional and beautifully filmed, like a short movie within the main movie.

I wouldn't say it is an original plot, but then again, it is a story told in many ways that is still great to live through and the authentic costumes and the steampunk-esque spaceships were a joy to behold in this good old traditional sci-fi war movie.

Great sequel to the first one, and it seems more is to come. Hooray.

Jack Snyder does it again!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This movie (series) tics a lot of boxes for me before watching, a well produced sci fi epic with an original story.

The problem is that script writer, Executive producer, Director and D.o.p. Zack Snyder put all his efforts on the polish and none on the thing itself. He forgot the fundamentals of storytelling.

I feel nothing for the main characters. This is just a series of events with a bunch of VFX to go on top.

Talk about a waste of time and money, who was this movie for Zack? Yourself? Are you happy with the result?

Hopefully this is the last movie he directs and writes, he's a skilled producer and a ok cinematographer, but the directing and writing is garbage.

Too bad, this showed promise, now I'm just upset.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
With 166mio the most expensive Star Wars knock-off movie of Netflix in 2023 is back, this time with even more bad acting, slow-motion scenes, and amateur CGI.

Not even Zack Snyder fans care to like this franchise since it is more of the same unoriginal, chaotic, and cartoonish space opera nonsense.

Having to watch this is a tiresome and painful cinematic experience. Even the die-hard sci-fi fans call it "an uninspired trainwreck" - just like part I, the plot of which I already forgot.

The film's success on Netflix (almost a billion viewership minutes) suggests that the streaming audiences ignore the horrible reviews (20% Rotten Tomatoes) because they are stuck to whatever the streaming service is offering them. And Netflix in return hopes to gain new subscribers to break even and offset this kind of huge investment!

It is absolutely safe to not waste any time on this, skip it and instead watch or re-watch *Dune Part II* which is on the contrary a true cinematic masterpiece!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Apt Title as Watching this Left me with Mental Scars.
review_detailed_main: ... And so it begins, with a Monologue of bad schoolboy writing and silly names delivered by one of the finest actors of the 20th Century ( I hope he got his money up front ) Ah and so to the humble village and the gathering of Heroes. It turns out that the grain this tiny humble village produces is life or death for the Massive Empire... aww hell lets face it. This entire crapshow is awful on all fronts and no Directors cut is going to save this one. The best thing for all concerned is to let this one slowly fade into memory and hope we look back in a few years.( about 20 or so should do it ) all have a good laugh at how you don't make a scifi Epic.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Another Zack Snyder disaster of a film
review_detailed_main:
** spoiler alert ** It's crap. Don't waste your time with it.

They need to stop giving Zack Snyder money to make films. This is an absolute mess, even by his recent track record of making some terrible films. The first was bad enough but this one. Christ almighty. You can maybe give it 2-3 stars for the CGI if you manage to get through the whole film. Anyone giving it anymore needs to have a serious word with themselves. Acting is abysmal. Script is even worse than the first film. It's all over the place. One of the worst films to be released over the past few years. Nothing good to say about it. The whole direction of it, the slo-mo's, everything, just plain awful.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
First of all I liked the first one. Yes, not that good but still ok until the last act. It was at first a good set up. Not the story but the step of the movie. Until the end, again.

Cliché characters all around but bearable I think. I mean a movie to recrute the heroes must lead to something really good after, right?

Well absolutely not. Because before going to this part two we need to go back to the part one. The end of part one lead us to a resolution that is taken away immediately, not even waiting for part two.

You can skip the last act of the part one, adjusting a few things (or not) and then start this part two. Nothing of value is lost (lol).

This part two is all visual (even then...) and no substance.

Slow mo? Y o u g o t i t. Useless filling shot? Right. Not using the heroes that we spend one movie to recrute? Of course. Meaningful characters growth or something? Nope. A very unmotivated death, dumb even? Yes (the last one I don't care tbh). Ex machina? Nor really but close.

It's close to a parody tbh, you don't need to change much to get it. Sad because I can see the potential of Rebel Moon.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Rebel moon 2: The Scargiver is an action/sci-fi bloody well done. This movie is a lesson on how to do an entertaining action/sci-fi feature.

Haters may hate but this movie certainly deserves to be a trilogy.

It's amazing how everyone involved has put in their ultimate best and it shows, especially the lead actress Sophia Boutella. I've seen her in a couple of action roles in the past but nothing as intense or as incredible as this. She's solidify her place as an action star to be reckoned with.

Now for the movie itself, although the story is a bit thin, but everything else from the acting to breathtaking visuals and the heart pumping action at the climax (which by the way is one whole hour) is a pleasure to behold.

I sincerely implore Mr. Zack Snyder and Netflix to ignore the haters and please give us the third part of this sci-fi action fest.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Yea, it's crap

Kora and surviving warriors prepare to defend Veldt, their new home, alongside its people against the Realm. The warriors face their pasts, revealing their motivations before the Realm's forces arrive to crush the growing rebellion.

That's the plot synopsis from IMBD, mine is, Kora and the gang must fight the bad guy because he's after them again, protect the people and put war behind them.

The movie is 100% better than the first, yet it's still just not good. The slow mo, sweet Jesus, ZS came out and said it is his style he loves it, fair enough, it's not for me, I personally believe some shots it can make it awesome but every action scene every few shots just slows the movie way too much, it loses the flow and becomes boring.

Acting is fine, no improvement, some REALLY cool shots in this, the sky, the aesthetic itself is cool. The music can be good too.

Yea hard pass, this is not a franchise I recommend, lifeless, filled with characters I really don't care for, 3/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Just watch Battle Beyond The Stars instead.It's better in every way.
review_detailed_main: It's as if one could see Zack Snyder when He was young,watching the classic Six Million Dollar Man & Bionic Woman that one realizes how the slow motion scenes was an inspiration to Zack. Again like Rebel Moon part one prepare for slo-mo scenes in part two as well. Just do yourself a great favor. If you sit through Rebel Moons parts one & two,go back in time & watch Battle Beyond The Stars. It does what it takes two Rebel Moon films to do,& far better with characterizations,effects,& story that also was inspired by The Seven Samurai. And it only takes one film. Battle Beyond The Stars superior!!!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Kara is the only name I know...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I like Snyder sometimes...I thought 300 and Watchmen were excellent.

His output since has been very mixed. Not just in the overall finished films but scenes within films.

And the two Rebel Moon films are exactly this.

Some scenes are superb, exciting, spectacular and great to watch. Others are screamingly awful, badly shot, rotten dialogue and characters doing plain stupid things. And Snyders usual slo-motion shots are so overused that it just becomes annoying.

There are so many inconsistencies in Rebel Moon that it so often just becomes completely jarring.

For example have Space ships with powerful weapons, but those weapons are seemingly targeted (very slowly of course) by turning a pulley wheel and looking through a visor....no laser guidance or even fast motor-drives on these space ships. Oh no.

The characters are attempted to be given backgrounds and depth but they all still appear as cardboard cutouts and real stars are the special effects which as superb & spectacular of course.

It really is just The Magnificent 7 with space ships and lasers but is less involving, more shallow and just left me empty after watching it.

Shame.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I don't understand the people who are complaining about both Part I and Part II. It's as though you have nothing better to do than to knock movies down simply because you do not have the capability to grasp it. From the very beginning this story has given us a whole new and expanding world different from other sci-fi worlds, and giving us a whole variety of characters to learn about, love and root for. Personally, the first part left me wanting more. The second part was action packed from the get-go. I was standing up from the anxiety of what these characters were going through, rooting for and crying for them to the end. I cannot wait to see what the third installment will bring, how the remaining heroes will fair, and how our hero will bring peace to this entire galaxy.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver, is a near-incoherent, groan-inducingly predictable, and overly pretentious mess of an uncompromisingly bad movie.

To what little credit I can offer it, the CGI is convincing enough that it doesn't become distractingly noticeable, some of the actors look like they're trying with the little direction they're given, and the action can sometimes 'feel like' it looks cool.

With that now out of the way, the characters are all generic planks of wood who are described through dialogue alone as charismatic or brooding or kind, yet the movie can't really convince you in any other way. There's a blatant overuse of slow-motion that just comes off as either excessive, pretentious, or both. The character development is barely present, with the few characters who aren't as static given rushed arcs that won't help you remember their names. The antagonist from the first movie being resurrected is laughable, as it feels like it would have costed less time and resources in hiring someone more capable. The writing is downright awful, with characters repeating others' sentences or unsubtly expositing who they are without covering up the fact that it's an exposition dump. The action leaves a lot to be desired, with the choreography being less than impressive. The score is unmemorable and overbearing, acting as if this film is a sci-fi epic when in actuality it's less-than-impressive. Character decisions range from confusing to contradictory and adds to the overall idiocy of the script. The importance of the grain is supposedly the main objective of the antagonists, yet its importance is never really explained aside from being described as "important", which lessens the stakes or the genuine threat the Imperium is supposed to impose.

In summary, a movie that furthers my disinterest in the eventual director's cuts of the duology, due to the simple fact that regardless of the amount of possible satisfactory context they can offer, the score will still be overreaching, the story will remain equally as formulaic and the characters will remain just as bland.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Another Snyder film super glossy utterly awful
review_detailed_main:
Words cannot express how dire this film is, within the first few minutes there's a terrible monologue recite character names that sound like most of the vowels were removed from a scrabble bag in order to sound sci fi but wait an overly dramatic 'or so they believe' enigmatic clap trap.

It's 70's B movie plot and dialogue but without ANY of the B movie schmaltz that made them classics.

It takes itself seriously when it shouldn't as it's terrible. It should have a RAZZIE category all of its own, The Snyder Razzie - films so terrible that only 'piping up that it's not the film you wanted to make and if you throw more money at me I will make the cut I wanted to make in the first place.... I have the footage, honest' Snyder effectively throws talent at a wall and sees what sticks and then shouts wait... I can make it better whilst not being able to make it good in the first place.

Awful, awful film.

I thought one was bad but part two laughed and said 'watch this then' because it had no beer to be asked to be held.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zach Snyder What Have you Done
review_detailed_main:
During your interview with Joe Rogan you implied that the part 2 is the real thing and that part 1 for setting the scene? Come back Zach you owe me an apology!

This part remains the circumsized version of what you should have really made, and its all for money!

During your interview you explained that because of the PG Age requirements you did something else beside of what you should have done! This is a message for you that you either chase making real movies or chase the money!

You will alway have hard core fans that understands what it takes to make proper movies like 300, so never change and never submit to matrix, you do you and dont do such movies again!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Grain harvest and back story: the movie!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Visually it looks great but that's where the greatness ends. Most of the casting choices were really bad. Whoever made the choice for the actor playing Belisarius should probably find another line of work. The first movie was sort of forgettable but mildly entertaining. This movie could have been 30 minutes shorter without all the needless slow motion. Anthony Hopkins must need money because there was no benefit to him taking part in this. The lead character is so unbelievable as a hero that it is distracting and she is not that good of an actress. Zack Snyder should just quietly retire and stop making movies. Enough garbage already.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Absolutely enjoyed every bit of it. Can't wait for the extend cuts of Rebel Moon.

You could tell they had to edit out a bunch of stuff for the 2 hours run time and this hurts some of the characters a bit as we aren't able to form an emotional connection and attachment towards them. Other than that, a 2 hours war movie and more action packed than the first installment. Lots of slo-mo but hey, actively choosing to sit down and watch a Zack Snyder movie then complain about slo-mo is like going to the beach and getting upset that there is sand. It's his thing, he does it, get over it.

Can't wait to see what else can be built from this Rebel Moon universe.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I watched both movies back to back. The first part wasn't particularly original, but it provided a certain level of enjoyment that was often debatable.

Rebel Moon part two is something that's hard to define while staying in the realm of non-vulgar expression. If we exclude the visual aspect, already proven in the first part, everything else is subject to criticism.

The hero characters are painfully basic in a failed attempt to highlight their diversity. Dialogues and remarks are obviously crafted to be dangerous and witty; but they're as hollow as dried gourds. Scenes of large-scale armed conflicts are miserably trivialized and reduced to victorious shouts reminiscent of tribal chants. The deaths of a couple of heroes are made-up to meet moral standards, and precisely because of that, instead of leading to apotheosis, they push the heroes into absurdity.

Rebel Moon part I - 4 stars.

Rebel Moon part II - 3 stars.

Rebel Moon part III - I hope they never make it!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It's no Lord of the Rings, Dune, Star Wars, and Game of Thrones
review_detailed_main:
The biggest compliment I can give Rebel Moon: Part Two is that I didn't fall asleep this time.

I have never seen a movie so desperately wanting to be not only a franchise but a Wiki fandom hotspot with its world, characters, science fiction names, etc. We have seen failed attempts at a cinematic universe before, but this is something else.

The problem is that the characters and the world of Rebel Moon are not interesting. It's not original either, as you can pick up on many familiar things you have seen in other movies. It's no Lord of the Rings, Dune, Star Wars, and Game of Thrones.

There is a scene where all our heroes sit around and share their backstories. After someone finishes their back story, they might as well say "OK, your turn."

And when characters do bite the dust, I didn't care. You couldn't pay me to care about these guys.

There is an R-rated cut for Part One and Two that Snyder is trying to drum up hype for, but I highly doubt there's a good movie somewhere on the cutting room floor. And why is there a director's cut when this is a streaming release and not a theatrical release? Why didn't they release the R-rated cuts to begin with? Because nobody is campaigning like they did for Justice League. So, people have to watch (in total) a six-hour-long movie. Why!? So stupid, lol. And bold of them to think that I am watching both films again.

Zack Snyder is just like George Lucas, not a talentless hack, but he needs to stop surrounding himself with 'yes men'.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Nothing new and exciting about it
review_detailed_main:
Another take on the Magnificent seven saga and remakes .

You can't replace the magic and the emotions that Yul Brinner and Steve Mc Queen gave to us , just moving the same theme in the future.

A movie with this potential need to be original, creative and unique. Otherwise you waste money , the talent of good actors , and the time used to produce it.

All guns basically shoot endless bullets and don't need to be reloaded ? Com'on .... Be real or at least pretend it .

Finally I think the acting is great, the CGI is great, but the story is beyond terrible!

You can't mix Star Wars, Magnificent Seven and Star Trek if you don't have a fresh take simply just don't !!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: All I can think of while watching this sequel is - Which is worse? The haircuts, the acting, or the script? It took me 5 attempts to watch this movie in full, and yet this is the only thought that runs through my mind about it. Djimon by far has the best hair of the bunch and that is the only compliment I can come up with. It's amazing to think of the money Netflix has shelled out to produce this self proclaimed "Epic". They're pot committed now, so I guess the 3rd installment is inevitable, and like any good train wreck, I'll have to force myself to watch it until the very end. I am a glutton for punishment.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not as bad as some of the reviews make it out to be
review_detailed_main:
Rebel Moon - Part Two was definitely not as bad as some people make it out to be. To be frank, the first part of the movie was extremely boring. Lots of story and character building, which might intrigue some but the acting wasn't all that great. The character building was decent, but just not that entertaining.

Where the movie shines is definitely the second half where the action begins. The war battles was A++ and that's where all the fun begins. There are similarities compared to the rest of the sci-fi war movies, but meh what can you do? At the end of the day, this is not Star Wars, but I wouldn't go to say this is the worst action sci-fi movie ever. Wouldn't recommend it in a theater setting, but at home? Sure.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: It's a film that far fell short of my expectations. How much worse can a movie be made. It's worse than the first movie. I thought they were going to wrap it up. The script and acting are very bad. It was the most amateur movie I've ever seen in my life. In particular, the role of the swordsman woman is greatly exaggerated. The lead is constantly crying. Charlie Hunnam was the only actor to spice up this film. I was sad that he wasn't in the second movie. In summary, I can say the following. For both films. How did you manage to make such a bad movie with such a budget? Did a 12-year-old write this movie? It's a pity.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Magnificent Seven in Space - sort of
review_detailed_main:
I watched the first one and felt it was okay if a little lacking for storyline and character depth. So came in without too much optimism for this but at least hopeful.

Sadly, the whole movie feels incredibly flat. The storyline is essentially just a rework of The Magnificent Seven. But almost all the characters are either vapid, unlikeable or just horribly fleshed out. The big bad of the first movie returns and is equally big and bad and so comically stereotypical it feels like a monkey has written the script.

There isn't a huge amount redeeming for the movie, in theory the cast is pretty heavy hitting, but hugely let down by writing, plotline and plotholes. The visuals, as you'd expect with Zach Snyder are great but visuals don't make a movie good if you're lacking substance.

Overall, it's not utterly awful. It's ultimately fairly easy to watch but equally incredibly easy to forget.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Why did Anthony Hopkins sign up to this?
review_detailed_main:
When you watch a Zack Snyder movie, you know what to expect.

Slow motion shots, over stylised violence, slow motion shots, gritty location, slow motion shots, explosions and slow motion shots.

The first one wasn't very good and this one isn't very good.

Despite some attempts at tragic backstories I just don't care about any of the characters who are all pretty cliche. Ed Skrein is super annoying.

You have all kinds of idiocy going on here: a guy fighting in a laser cannon battle with an axe, pound store furiosa, one dude lobbing a bunch of grenades in the open door of a moving shuttle, teaching a bunch of farmers and villagers to fight in 2 days, digging impossibly complex tunnels rigged with explosives in the same timeframe, one scene where everyone is dressed like 13th century nobility and another where they're dressed like 1920s Chicago, name your cliche relationships some kind of subplot about a coup and being framed for it, an all-hope-is-lost-oh-wait-friends-arriving-at-the-last-moment ex machina bit, lots of yelling in victory despite literally half the village being dead and yet another sequel set up.

It's about flour remember.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
It is incredibly badly written, and to think the writers guild strike.... I mean... It is also badly directed. Zack Snyder shoud have stopped with Sucker Punch, the only really good and original film he's made.

What makes no sense? This evil nazi empire coming to steal the grain from a vilage across the galaxy. Even if they're really coming for Kora, why 15 minutes of scenes and speaches for tje vilagers gathering the wheat??? Everyone knows the wheat is not the goal, the empire and the vilagers. And that amoint of wheat cannot be held as any type of leverage for an entire empire. They'd have to spend mch more worth of fuel than the wheats' worth.

So no, it is not a good movie, very likely worse than part 1, I am writing this watching minute 38.....and OMG the clichéd dialogue, I threw up a little bit in my mouth every 5 minutes or so and there's 80 minites left.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I liked this cut of Part 2 more than Part 1. The novelization of Part 1 was great and it is based on the director´s cut. I hope that the final films won´t lose too much of the crazy after being pushed through the MPAA to secure an R. The most impressive aspect of this film is the Junkie XL 10/10 score. The least impressive aspect is the weird timeline of events and clearly missing information. The living god engines called Kali are only introduced in the full version of Part 1 for example but also play a role here. A scene only in Part 1´s director´s cut is for example presented to have happened during the 5 days of prep the village has in Part 2 making at all seem less credible. Because it actually isn´t! A main character will also die differently in the director's cut, something Snyder revealed in a post-screening Q&A so we are once again being dealt a VERY compromised vision on release. AotD too had timeline issues but that film rocked while Rebel Moon simply plays. Well, the second half more or less rocks. Admiral Noble was my favorite character in Part 1 but is outshone in Part 2 by General Titus. The dialogue flips between very strong and exposition.txt to name something split down the middle. Kurt Johnstad & Shay Hatten are no Chris Terrio or even David Goyer but their dialogue worked well through V. Castro´s filter in the novel. Some of the cheese is of course intentional. Both Snyder and Lucas (the PT specifically) pay homage to source material and styles that were already ancient before the scripting began.

And the action and cinematography? Mostly first class and the Vfx are equally strong! The current version´s one proper action scene is 50 minutes long. 300 on spray paint and chrome! Known action scenes in flashbacks are cut to almost nothing outside of Kora´s tale. To think that the real film will have an even longer climax, other action bits with varied settings and more complex balls-to-the-wall choreography that will push the gore as hard as the MPAA will allow, with Euro comic sex scenes on top. That´s why Snyder will never be out of work. No one squeezes blood from a stone like him.

I wonder how much these films truly cost. If Snyder indeed managed to make 2 three hour films with alternative material (!) for 2 two hour cuts on top for only 80-something million apiece then he needs to win a Producer´s Guild award. 2 Rebel 2 Moon: Bigger Longer Uncut drops both parts at once in late summer to fall 2024. If it´s as good as the book then we have an all-time cult classic on our hands and this second half is already good enough. Bring on the sequels and spin-offs but I will add that the Black Axe prequel comics didn´t grab me. Part 2 gets a B- for now. Part 1 gets a C but not for long, its novel is a B+.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Watching part 1 and ten minutes in I'm getting Magnificent Seven in Space vibes. This continued throughout the movie and thats what it is with a wishy washy kind of back story about an Empire and a Royal Family overthrown told with flashbacks.

Down to earth farmers get bullied by evil space empire then warned "we will return". Defenceless farmers find an "anti-hero" hiding amongst them (not a patch on Yul Bryner) and off she goes to gather some warriors to aid their plight.

Part 2 sees these warriors return (6 yes thats right I said 6 warriors) plus our Anti-Hero (that makes 7 !)who with a twist is the adopted daughter of the evil empire baddie. I wont spoil the ending but I reckon you can guess what happens.

There is a lot of characterisation padding, it could have been cut down to 1 movie leave your brain in the fridge and watch it then its an okay two parter. Watching the making of afterwards makes me think they were a bit deluded and must never have heard of the Magnificent Seven.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Small amount of grain across the galaxy...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
It's like it wants to be firefly, mad max and Star Wars. Turns out rubbish. Also tries to be an emotional deep saga, still crap. If you're a fan of slow mo there is plenty of that. I reckon they got about a week to learn their lines acting is shocking.

So much of it doesn't make se sense.not sure if the aim was to do some gender fluid rubbish but managed that. Who knew axes beats pulser/laser weapons and starship need to charge their canons. Some absolute genius script writing and all for a bit of grain. Powerful female lead my arse she can't act for sh'c but please do keep pushing that pish...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Better than the first movie but not by much
review_detailed_main: I tried to like it but how to describe this mess of a movie. I just hate the big bloated whale submarine looking ship with the WW2 cannons, dials and knobs. It just doesn't fit in this futuristic sci-fi movie. The acting is mediocre, the scenes still felt rushed and the plot feels undeveloped. Too many flashbacks are needed to explain everything and now it's unclear where the next movie will go based on how this ended. There are still too many Star Wars rip-offs including flaming laser like blades that are colored blue, use of the term Imperium/empire for the bad guys and the rebel fleet. Sci-fi movies made like this just don't do well with audiences, add the Scargiver to that list. On the positive side, it was a bit better than the first movie but not by much.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Always go in with an open opinion on zach I love the way he directs yeah there's slow mo, but the guy brought this into cinema and nobody complained about 300, rebel moon 1 and part 2 have had great world building so far, unlike most movies making a franchise. I look forward to the next installment. If you love movies with a rag tag crew and a Sci fi setting look no more you won't regret it, all these low reviews are just part of the I hate zach bad wagon it's pretty sad of them. Set designs are amazing the visuals are breathtaking and the cast play there characters to the fullest, I hope you all enjoy :).

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Well, not as boring as the first half of the first movie. It is kinda the same story as the 1980 movie."Battle Beyond the Stars" (t0080421) slightly changed to be able to extend the story beyond one movie. Feels like a Scharzenegger action movie without Schwarzenegger, the iconic hero is missing in this movie.

Another random girl struggles with her past and decides to fight evil. It is not cool, not iconic not worth the money. Story and actors are set for a B movie but some one gave them a lot of money and now we got this movie. I like the special effects, looks and feels like kinda steampunk, kinda Serenity (2005).

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Recently, my wife and I have begun shopping at a different grocery store. While it has typically been a pleasant experience, I decided to try their store-brand version of Little Debbie's Cosmic Brownies. To my dismay, I was dissatisfied with the generic alternative and found myself wishing I had spent my time getting Cosmic Brownies instead. Unfortunately, I find myself facing an ironically similar disappointment today.

Rebel Moon- Part Two: The Scargiver is director Zack Snyder's second installment in his Netflix Original space opera. Despite Part One: A Child of Fire premiering in December 2023 to unfavorable reviews, Snyder and Netflix were already well underway on Part Two. While originally intending to create a trilogy of films, Snyder found it difficult to fit his vision in a typical 2 ½-3hr runtime (an issue he had previously suffered from while directing DC Comic's Justice League) and decided to split each film into two parts. Now, at the start of a 6-part saga, the Rebel Moon universe attempts to cement itself as a sci-fi epic for the ages.

Picking up shortly after the ending of Part One, we see our ragtag team of heroes regroup on Kora's (Sofia Boutella) adopted home world, the moon of Veldt. The group warns the locals of an impending attack from the Imperium, an unfortunate aftermath of their previous encounter. With only 5 days to prepare for the invasion, the team must work alongside the villagers to protect their town or die trying.

Rebel Moon- Part Two is unforgivably boring. Suffering from the sins of its predecessor, Part Two cannot handle its 2-hour runtime. While Part One was entirely set-up, the sequel stretches a finale into a full 2-hour film. Unbearably tedious, scenes drag on to questionable lengths, feeling as if there was little trimming done in an attempt to fluff the films runtime as much as possible. When that failed, an egregious amount of slow-motion was unnecessarily shoehorned into every scene. Matching Part One, there are about 45 minutes worth of slow-motion, which, if they had been cut, could have easily made this film more enjoyable. Rebel Moon- Part One & Two are not strong enough to stand on their own and would have greatly benefitted from being edited down into one complete film.

Basing his vision off the Star Wars universe, Zack Snyder had stripped the world of any iconic and recognizable traits but failed to replace those with any of his own original or interesting ideas. Though you can clearly see where the inspiration came from, the lack of creativity holds the series back from forming a connection with its audience. Rebel Moon introduces characters, planets, and concepts that are truly difficult to remember or distinguish, as the entire film feels as if it is just placeholder for actual fully fleshed out ideas. Boiling Star Wars down to its most generic aspects, Rebel Moon is left feeling like a movie you would see playing within another movie.

While the actors do their best to salvage the situation, they are held back by elementary-level dialogue and a paper-thin script. Suffering from telling, not showing, the film continually insists upon stating exactly how the audience should perceive each character, although we have never seen any of them portrayed to have those qualities. After two films and 4 1/2 hours, none of the characters stand out, with nearly all of them being completely forgettable if they aren't present on screen.

Contrary to this example, Zack Snyder truly is a talented director, but he desperately needs the guidance of a gifted writer. While he has had many successes in the past (300, Watchmen, Man of Steel) he had always worked closely with the respective writers to achieve that success. On his own, Snyder hasn't quite mastered the balance and the result is films like Rebel Moon. I do sincerely hope he continues making movies, but I hope he sees these flaws and learns from them before attempting something similar to this project.

The world of Rebel Moon was hindered before it began. Clinging to the idea of creating a Star Wars film, Zack Snyder held himself back from standing out and truly creating something original. Akin to a store-brand alternative to your favorite snack, Rebel Moon- Part Two: The Scargiver delivers a bland and unappealing attempt at copying an icon.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Following directly from Part One, the baddies rescue nasty Admiral Noble's body and put him back together again and he awakes obsessed only with getting Kora. Meanwhile, Kora, Gunnar etc are preparing for another big fight creating cunning traps, putting bombs everywhere etc around their small village.

Whilst like its predecessor there is a great deal wrong with this, firstly the 'good' stuff. The action sequences, whilst we've seen them many many times before in better films are well staged and bordering on exciting, supported by seemingly hours of slow motion and a highly portentous score. On the downside, Snyder seems so eager to create his own galaxy far far away with associated history and lore he fails to create characters that will fill it - all they do is fight, roar as they charge into battle, make speeches and burst into tears, all without a scintilla of humour.

Bottom line, I just don't think I truly understood all this. The cause of the vast empire of soldiers attacking this little village still seems geared around getting grain - really? And the politics is rattled out quickly in a short section at the start - again I wasn't clear on this - perhaps I'm just not bright enough. Anyway it does seem as if Snyder is ready to make 2 more of these plus extended R rated versions of the first 2 parts are on their way - I'm so excited!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Fantastic movie. If you are a Zach Snyder fan you'll live it! I did. I thought the imagery was beautiful. I really enjoyed the practical effects used instead of all the CGI you see in the movies today. Some of the tropes were predictable but still enjoyable. I like Zachs world building in this movie. I can really see the influence from StarWars that this movie was originally intended to be. I can not wait for the unrated versions of both the first and second parts. I've been a fan for years and will be for years to come. The only thing that I would say that was over done was the slow motion. When there was slow motion within the slow motion I actually laughed... I was like ok now that's to much Zach. Still I love it and would recommend it.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
When did Zach Snyder go from being a A list director to making crap? RM is science fiction vomit of Star Wars, Mad Max, Lord of the rings, but done incredibly bad. Thank goodness this was streamed and I didn't pay to see this garbage in the theaters.

I will say that James the robot was the best thing about this movie, and stole ever scene he was in, maybe it was Hopkins delivery of his lines, or that James was the only actually believable character in this travesty of a movie. I can actually see James the robot becoming a cosplay character. He was genuinely the best thing about this movie. All I can say is thank you for fast forward.

I will give ZS the benefit of the doubt, his version of Justice League albeit 4 hours was the movie we as the consumer should have gotten the first time. RM2 had so much backstory montages, it's like this was all cut from the first movie. Which in hindsight is probably what happened. Maybe there will a Rebel Moon: Zach Snyder edition that is the original cut of the movie that makes more sense than this patchwork of science fiction trash we got so far.

Would I watch it again, no. Would I recommend it to a friend, no. Am I glad I watched it, no. But...I would recommend this movie for a long flight or car ride.

I may come off too harsh, but I know Synder can make great films, Army of the Dead was superb, I just wonder how handicapped he is being by the producers, these two movies could have been one, and it would have a much better flow and feel. I am honestly disappointed in the quality of pictures being made now a days. With the few exceptions such as CODA, and The Batman, we haven't had very good movies in the last 3 years.

As viewers we come to movies for an escape, long format is okay, Endgame, Dune, maybe it's time the 2 hour movie format goes away and directors make the movies they want to make.

Thank you for your time in reading this.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: They have tried to force several stories into a couple of movies that just doesn't work, all told in flashbacks that bring nothing to the story, we didn't need to know about ever characters back story, it just gets boring, its lazy from Snyder and I usually like his stuff, but this should have been Netflix series if they wanted to develop all the characters in such ways, the action scenes are good and the visuals are stunning at times as you would expect from a big budget Netflix movie, I just don't know how they keep getting it so wrong, surely someone at Netflix must watch these and opine that they are just not good enough, if you sent to the movie to see this you would be gutted.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Thoughts on the director's cut: Yes, it's better!
review_detailed_main:
Zack Snyder and Netflix weren't kidding. There really is a world of difference between the Rebel Moon director's cuts and the "neutered" variants released back in December and April, respectively. We aren't just getting more blood, sex, and cybernetic boobies; entire characters and vital bits of context had been removed and are now restored, such as the titanic humanoid in Part Two that looks like something we might've seen if Jodorowsky's adaptation of Dune actually got made. (Release the Giger cut!!)

I kept seeing accusations that Snyder and Netflix were trying to manufacture a second #ReleaseTheSnyderCut campaign and so "market" the movies that way -- which would have been weird because the release of the "proper" cuts was never in doubt (nor does Snyder's explanation, that Netflix stipulated that he could only release the R-rated cuts if he released PG-13 versions first, make a ton of sense for a company that usually doesn't hold artists back in this way). Is that what was attempted? Did Netflix genuinely not have faith in the lengthier, hyperviolent cuts? Did Snyder just want to give his fans more movies to watch (as seemed to be his tune when Part One dropped, as in the JoBlo interview where he speaks as if Netflix was always going to let him fire away multiple cuts; not that he HAD to make a PG-13 one first)? I'll leave that for the Twitter fanboys to fight over.

It's inevitable to concede that these "director's cuts" are an improvement upon the original releases (some haters argue that the new versions are worse because they exhibit more of Snyder's edgelord annoyances, but I would have to disagree).

The action scenes go harder (on account of several -- violent -- key shots being restored) and the slo-mo shots tend to have a bit more going on (read: blood and guts), especially in this second part. However, little can be done to salvage such an un-engaging story with such underdeveloped characters -- try as Snyder might to characterize them in ways that, this time, go beyond info dumps where they explain their characterization to us.

The world we see, on top of its visual dinginess, is still senselessly anachronistic and random, but as I said in my review of Part One, I almost find it kind of charming. It really is like watching a bunch of unrelated sci-fi and military toys strewn across the floor, then picked up by Sid from Toy Story to do with as he pleases.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This is pretty much my view of both Rebel Moon's- the 1st was trash but ok-ish, mainly for some decent visuals. The second compounded all the dross of the 1st and more which is quite a feat I reckon.

I read in a recent interviwe the director Zack Snyder said Star Wars is so ingrained in our culture comparison is inevitable. This was pitched as a Star Wars story and passed on, thank god. Some aspects are more than lifted, simply tweaked, making this a generic space western, comitting the crime of spending millions on an often poorly acted, non-sensical, very poorly scripted and plotted pair of movies. Worst of all some of it is just plain dull- the 1st 15/20 minutes of part 2 is pathetic.

Snyders's not made a decent movie since his debut Dawn of the Dead, which was a remake, when is this guy gonna give up?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Worst movie I have ever watched in my life
review_detailed_main:
I'm a casual movie watcher with pretty low expectations. The first rebel moon was entertaining enough to me to make me excited, yes, excited for the 2nd movie. Even with all its supposed flaws, I was intrigued. So now I have to say, this is the worst fricken movie I have ever watched in my entire life. Given the world building the first movie sets up, I expected big plot points to be introduced in this one, maybe Kora meets her dad, maybe we get more development on the revolution, literally anything. The entire movie, TWO HOURS OF LIFE I WILL NEVER GET BACK is the group fighting against the general that should've died last movie. Frankly, his death back then was more satisfying instead of in this movie when he dies I just feel "thank god it's over". You can tell this movie was trying to pad out the run time too, the first half or so is just the village preparing for the battle and the preparation montage is in slow-mo every single chance it gets. No characters get any development in this movie, characters die and there is no pay off. There are no plot twists that incite any emotion except maybe in the first 5-10 minutes. I was planning on watching the third, but after this movie left me feeling genuinely upset about what I just spent my time on I don't think my curiosity can even motivate me to watch a 3rd. It's not even worth hate watching, this movie is plain boring with bad creative choices.

TLDR: IF YOU ACTUALLY WANT TO ENJOY THE REBEL MOON SERIES, READ A SUMMARY OF THIS MOVIE AND SKIP STRAIGHT TO PART 3 (which I assume will be less horrendous when it comes out. I have hope) I'm begging you, I'm being serious. I've never wrote a movie review in my entire life and this will be my first and possibly last on IMDB. I have never had a singular movie be the reason to make me drop a series indefinitely. This is the first.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Excellent saga (don't listen to the bad reviews)
review_detailed_main: Kind of like "batttle beyond the stars" with a touch of Star Wars. This second helping is packed with action, great fights, lots of booms and bangs, great character development and story. You really feel for these rag tag bunch of rebels as they attempt to take back their lost kingdom from the bad guys. Finished up the first episode nicely and set us up for what's coming next. Really enjoy the intricate plot and story as it builds. A few good twists and turns to keep you on the edge of your seat. Sofia Boutella is an excellent actress and plays the main very well. She brings a lot of feeling and emotions into the story and we learn of how she became who she is as well as all the others in her close circle of warriors. If you want a good clean action sci-fi this is it. Can't wait for the next installment! No questionable content, nudity or a lot of foul language, no real gory parts but they are inferred. So safe for the kiddies. Enjoy.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder must have fallen asleep... like I did.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Slow motion battles AND slow motion farming!
review_detailed_main:
Action delivers, some good visuals, but too much slow motion at the wrong times, and unbelievable (even for science fiction) segments. I fast forwarded through some unnecessary portions.

This film had a simple plot: defense of a planet required for Logisitics / food for the "bad guy" armies. Still confused how a small village cultivates enough food to become a strategic location - wasting so much manpower and equipment in a universe so large where surely there is tech to produce food? Can bring a human back to life but can't mass produce food in a lab? I get it's science fiction but come on, have some reason or explanation.

Anyways, the battle scenes are entertaining, setting aside some wild notions of combat. Too much slow motion - to include farming....guess it was meant to show the band of heroes bonding with the townspeople? Never seen slow motion farming in an action movie before, definite first.

Maybe third time will be a charm?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Spent almost $200 mil for this pile of garbage !!!
review_detailed_main: Let me start with saying Snyder is one of my favorite directors and I always stand by him. I never understood why studios did not let him have full control over his movies. Watchman directors cut and Snyder Cut of Justice League are 2 of my favorite movies. I was always rooting for him to direct a SW movie. Now I understand why studios does not let directors have full control over movies. I can't believe they almost spend $200 million for this movie. First one and this one are one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Zero creativity , horrible writing , unwatchable plot , acting is subpar and directing is unbearable ! Overuse of slowmo scenes for no reason is so cringe. I got second hand embarrassment from watching some of the scenes that tried to be emotional but felt extremely forced and poor. And shame on Netflix for green lighting this project and spending 300-400 million dollar for both movies but keep canceling fantastic shows because they don't have enough viewers or they cost too much !!! Please DO NOT make any of these movies and waste our subscription money for them. Just plain horrible.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: The premise of the movie has a lot of promise and could have been a compelling story. Unfortunately the writing does not take advantage of the stories potential. It is very clear that the story is trying for a Space Western/Star Wars/Lord of the Rings vibe but it does not know how to capture that level of depth. The characters a very shallow and lazily written. There are some good looking scenes that are cool to look at. There are way too many slow motion sequences that kill the pacing and do not serve any real purpose or help evoke any emotion. There is a lot of fluff to make the movies Look good but unfortunately that is as far as the quality goes. The telling of this story falls short of it's potential.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I really wanted to like this move. Too much cinematic drama and not enough actual content. The final battle is good, but 45 mins in all they'd done is harvest wheat. This movie probably only has around 40 minutes of total footage, but they stretch it to two hours by playing 80% of the movie in slow motion. It gets really tiring.

There are some good characters and impressive special effects. Netflix tried hard to make a blockbuster. But they would have been better off than just making a single movie that had decent pace, rather than two movies where they didn't have enough content to fill 4 hours.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Don't believe the haters.

This is a fun movie. It just has a style, and that style seems to offend a whole lot of people. I assume that it is the human interactions at the beginning, the very , well, hippie, interpersonal vulnerability.

Or maybe it is the sheer silliness of coal smoke billowing from space ships.

Or the nonsense of slow moving laser type bolts that perform so much worse than a modern minigun.

Whatever the reason, I think the intensity of the gestalt makes up for it all, for every scifi is flawed in some way.

This movie is all heroics and action and intensity and stakes, balanced by some uncomfortably open human interactions.

In a deeply individual and strong and unique style.

Great stuff from Zack. Long may he be free to make what he wants, its fun.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I love zack's justice league.

I appreciate any movies in netflix even its not so good, but at least watchable. Because we all paid netflix monthly so whenever any movie or series dropped, i appreciate it.

But this. This is kinda the worst movie ever i watched recently. Totally lost respect how can a person have so tiny brain to create such big project.

I wonder what did snyder hope in this stupid slow motion or those wheat or those stupid character stories? Aweness? The hell! They're all sooooo dumb! The part one, it was not good enough. But i appreciate any pretty scifi in netflix. But this? This is whole new kind of time wasting.

A real dumb movie for kids who never watch any good movies all their lives. This is not art. This is ego. Please realize this before you create another mess.

This is definitely down there with madame web.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Nothing new and a foreign sun
review_detailed_main: Zack Snyder has made marvelous movies, but this is not one of them. Cliché after cliché in a tedious succession with virtually no imagination for plot or something else. Perhaps this movie was made for 14 years olds who have never encountered a science fiction movie combined with swords before. For anyone older, this movie can definitely not be recommended. Its length, two hours for each episode, feels due to lack of imagination, dialogue, and excess heavenly choruses instead nearly double, meaning for hours. Waste of money, material, and whatever else was needed for this movie. Infact it was so boring, that I have got difficulties to reach the required length of characters for this review.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: What a unbelievable waste of time and money
review_detailed_main: Seriously, who creates uninspired redundant nonsense like this? I see a movie with 0 original inspiration, plugged together from existing script blocks and visual paradigms. Pathetic. When I think about how much money was spent on this I get sick - just pushing through whatever promises to be mass compatible. I see a bit of Star Wars, a bit of Lord of the Rings, zero original stuff. Simple storyline which underwhelmes on all levels. This is not cinema, this is visual fast food in a culture coma. It just shows that these old people like Zack Snider should just retire and be happy with whatever they created in the past.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Almost ever second of this is awful

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not as bad as some 'critics' want you to believe...
review_detailed_main:
An unjust wave of negative reviews, and while it's def not the director's best work, the harsh criticism seems overly excessive.

The film 'seems' to be targeted for having:

A strong female lead, male characters showing vulnerability and a ethnically diverse cast.

Even Snyder's signature (!) use of slow motion is criticized way out of proportion. The villagers' grueling labor and desperation for example is a returning (copy pasta?) element that critics use, yet the slow-motion in these scenes is clearly for adding emotional weight to the story-line. (given you actually watched the movie)

Critics have taken these, and much much more, aspects completely out of context to undermine the film and influence their readers before even watching it.

I am therefor rating a 10/10 in contrast with all this unfounded and biased negativity imo.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: As a comedy it pretty much delivers
review_detailed_main:
The story is maybe very simple, but the universe is so dumb I have no words to describe the level of dumbness of it.
