But that's crossed such a level that with a beer or two you can have a joy watching it! Really!. Me and my wife were almost dying laughing at so many things at almost every scene of the entire movie. First part wasn't that much funny as the second one. I believe this was one of the dumbest movies ever made at this budget and yet pretending it is not a comedy.

I don't want to go into too many details, many pointed out the crops as the main axis of the movie. I would say coal topic is even more hilarious. At some point you will see it in the movie. We almost died laughing when we spotted it. I asked myself "how much of coal does the ship (drednaut?) require to activate a hyper drive"? This type of questions you ask yourselves every minute or so... Worth watching when assuming this is a comedy. Otherwise please don't.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Where do I start? One of the worst films I have ever seen if I went to a cinema I would have walked out. Acting, terrible might as well place few mannequins in the movie, wouldn't made any difference, the main characters have shallow and cheesy storylines. I had to sit and watch each one of them telling their life story that was exactly the same as previous one, only character has changed. The script was probably shredded first and then glued together because it just didn't make sense. Zack Snyder brought Cheesy to another level which I didn't know it was possible, the slow motion scenes lasted for almost half of the movie I found myself skipping movie forward. The technology, apparently movie is set in the future, yet they use analogue buttons and switches and the rocket engines leave trail of smoke like a Russian Volga car from the 80s, I have even seen an empire soldier contacting his superior over an analogue phone with a cable. I hope Zack Snyder will give up making movies for our sake and save the actors their shame.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: REBEL MOON PART 2 THE SCARGIVER movie review
review_detailed_main:
This part of the film improves on the earlier one. It is much more center-focused, with the battle of the village of Veldt, the planet from which our Rebels are willing to defend this town.

The film is filled with beautiful cinematography, especially in the most underrated and over-hated scene of the wheat being harvested. While mundane, this scene symbolizes the Rebels' commitment to their cause and connection to the land they are fighting for. Knowing they grew wheat and farmed it is impressive (in Real life), a testament to their resilience and determination.

The action set pieces of this part of the film are also impressive because there are many action scenes in this film, and now knowing these characters' backstories, some of which are explained in this film, made me understand their struggles and the sadness they have endured. The fighting choreography also has a ton of weight to it, especially when Atitus Noble (Ed Skrein) goes on a terminator killing spree and his fight later in the film with Kora (Sofia Boutella), which is a blast to see the flips and turns which reminded me a lot of Transformers the Last Knight of the ship tumbling in zero gravity.

Another subject I wanted to discuss was the fictionalized weapons I was unaware of, such as the shot Lava rounds. Laser swords also have a tremendous amount of density in their usage. Yes, the lightsaber swords in this film hit the homage to Star Wars Lightsabers. Still, they have one distinct difference, and the only way to use them is either metallic arms or heat-resistant clothing, which gives the weapons a bit of a dangerous usage for the user.

The characters they have improved on are General Titus, Milius, and Nemesis, as well as Tarak's background, which aids their reasoning of fighting due to the MOTHERWORLD'S corruption & greed that has caused so much pain to them. For example, General Titus disobeying an order from The MOTHERWORLD caused his entire crew's demise. You have Milius, who was one of these very people, a farmer but was enslaved by the MOTHERWORLD, and Nemesis, the death of her child that made her go on a revenge spree; as for Tarak, not only did he lose his father, his mother, and his world he too in many ways suffers from the aftermath of that event. These backstories add depth to the characters and make their actions more understandable.

One of the things I commend in both films is how the MOTHERWORLD is portrayed. It's not an Evil world, but it is a planet that at one time in its political career, and the King of the MOTHERWORLD isn't a 100% evil ruler; however, a ruler that sought war to expand their domain as a ruler would do in colonialism, but due to having a daughter. The Princess Issa (Stella Grace Fitzgerald) changed his perspective in which both parts briefly describe her divine power of what I can presume Rebel Moon's Depiction of the Force, which I am hoping the Directors cut explains more of because the world-building of both The MOTHERWORLD and Veldt as well the magical force implications of the Princess Issa and what she will affect the coming sequels.

One of the topics I did not discuss in both cuts of the film was Balisarius (Rupert Friend), who took over the monarchy by executing the king and queen in a coup d'état and forcing Kora to eliminate the princess. The actor who plays him is good. Unfortunately, in this film cut, he doesn't appear a lot, which impacts the film significantly because we don't see much of him. It does feel like it will lead up to the next movie.

One of my props for the film is its Music. The music in both parts was excellent and evoked much emotion while watching them. The score effectively enhances the emotional impact of key scenes, from the intense action sequences to the poignant character moments. It excites me to hear more of it in the director's cut.

That is, sadly, my complaint about this cut of the film. Many scenes feel intentionally set up for the next movie without fully explaining why said Princess is Alive or how the events will affect future releases. Not only that, but several scenes feel like they were cut between scenes, which I will await to see in the director's cut. I am eagerly expecting the director's cut, as I presume it will delve deeper into the characters' backstories and Lore, especially with the statue of the robot lady that appears in the trailer of the director's cut that had voice lines.

While the film has fewer issues than the prior art, it does suffer at the cost of more action scenes and story, especially with the Rebellion shown in the earlier film and how they arrived at the battlefield. My minor issue is that killing off my favorite characters makes it emotionally damaging because you connect with them as characters.

This film is not the worst thing I have seen, but I can see its potential for this universe to succeed. I am hopeful for the future of this universe, and I eagerly await tomorrow's director's cut. In conclusion, I will give the standard Cut of REBEL MOON Part 2 THE SCARGIVER an 8/10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
It simply does not make sense. It doesn't even make sense or maintain consistency within a 60 second action scene.

Synder wrote the script, produced and directed this. Supposedly it was his "baby" that he has tried to get off the ground for a long time.

But this reflects so badly on him, everything he is involved with just does not work. Yes he can direct a camera but everything else is below what I would expect from a film student.

You have solid actors with zero to work with, a script that a 5 year old likely came up with the plot outline, dialogue so bad I couldn't even laugh, and his visual "style" they only thing he has got going on full display.

I have no idea how he gets job, his movies are all rated average with a couple of exceptions. And those exceptions I think are more to do with marketing then skill.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I must admit i never thought i would say this but ..yes i was wrong thinking that noone ,ever, can do a much worse movie that the last jedi. Mr. Snyder succeeded and i should say,exceptionally well. So, long live the new lord of boredom and stupidity in sci-fi movie industry.

To give you some arguments for the above statement we must start with the fact the movie takes place in a world with highly advanced weaponry,medicine and FTL ships.

And yet......peasant gloriously gather grains like in dark ages,one fights with a little tomahawk against armored infantry with plasma guns and the supreme achievment in movie goofs, a dreadnought class starship aims gun like WW2 battleships or subs by turning some wheels. I went to bathroom due to boredom i came back they were still aiming....i went in the kitchen to pour a glass of scotch to calm my mind....guess what ...still aiming.

Beside these epic moments the movie is like this: half movie peasants gather around, shout something then un-gather or some people (more of them or just a single person) go outside and look very concerned at the sky a quarter of the movie some people keep motivational speeches so boring that even my dog started to howl ,which it never does... and the last quarter of the movie the leading actress moans with different intensities like in some bad simulated sex scenes.

As you see i didnt mention the fact stated by others that the so-called movie is a lame copy made of small pieces glued together from other creations. This is his smallest flaw.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I could't watch the rest of the movie after the harvest scene. It's sooooo stupid, They harvest the wheat by hand!!! Without any machine! And the 3 day of harvest will be good enough to make some breads. And the bad guys are asking for it and doing bad things for a fist of wheat???? It's so stupid! And the plot is so bad, childish and cliché. Shame on all of you for spending that much money for a very poor and stupid scenario. And normally before releasing something like that you show it to some people. Nodoby told anything to the makers of this crap? Even the worst star wars movie is much better than this.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I feel like Zack Snyder is very misunderstood, we keep expecting great and epic movies, that's normal based on the brands he handles, but you don't give him any favours by judging him by the same bar as other filmmakers that truly do put an effort in giving something of quality and deepness.

Things you cannot expect from Zack Snyder: A good script, character development, a well paced rhythm or sense overall as a movie. BUT, it's entertaining and visually stunning. If you are aware of what Snyder can and cannot give you, you'll enjoy it. Awesome action and visuals, of course with too much color editing and slow mo, but that's just his thing.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
'' Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver '' is the second part of the Rebel Moon movies and it's even worse than the first one. Long scenes with no actual purpose, boring action scenes, eye rolling romance, and idiotic characters craft a really boring movie.

First of all, there were a lot of long scenes that were just laughable, like those scenes of the farmers...farming for like the whole first half of the movie while a scottish wannabe antheme was playing on the background and slow motion movements of them drinking water spiced up the scene!

And then there is the romance, which was unconvincing and the two of them had no chemistry...

The whole battle plotline, in addition, was way too predictable, with boring action scenes, and even more boring villains.

At least, the princess part looked promising, but that was left for another movie, so...

Overall, one out of ten.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Was this some sort of Tax Writeoff for Zack Synder??

$166 Million to make both the Rebel Moon movies is just nuts.

There are no big name actors commanding multi million dollar salaries.

Special Effects aren't groundbreaking and does it really cost that much for some people at computers to add some laserfire and explosions?

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder Is the King of sci-fi films
review_detailed_main: Rebel Moon creator Zach Snyder praised Part One: A Child of Fire as an exciting new dawn for the sci-fi genre, featuring a two-part story involving a bustling galaxy ruled by a militaristic regime. However, after two hours and 15 minutes, Part One proved unsatisfactory and half-baked action movie cobbled together from parts of more inspired genre fare. Rebel Moon Part Two: The Scargiver offers only a slight improvement, thanks to its simpler story and more enticing climactic battle, but two more hours of the same shallow characters and plot. The plot of The Scargiver plays out like Seven Samurai/The Magnificent Seven meets Return of the Jedi, with the warrior crew returning to the moon of Veldt to protect the villagers from the Imperium army. With a ticking clock counting down until an Imperium dreadnought arrives, Snyder spends a gratuitous amount of time showing the villagers and warriors harvesting the land. The voiceover of Anthony Hopkins' mechanical knight, James, is confounding and provides little value to the story, except for a late tag-team entry into the fray. "Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver" is the second installment in Zack Snyder's sci-fi series, featuring a group of space-Amish farmers who face off against cartoon baddies with jackboots and glowing swords. The film's trademarks, such as extravagant lens flares and slow-motion shots, are used with abandon, and while Sofia Boutella delivers a balletic elegance in her fight sequences, it ultimately lacks a uniqueness. The film draws from various influences, including Star Wars, Mad Max, Caravaggio, John Ford, European art-house cinema, World War II propaganda flicks, steampunk Victoriana, cottagecore girlies on Instagram, and Wagner's "Götterdämmerung." The score features two types of choirs and a single frame might include a robot dressed like the Green Knight and a Conan the Barbarian clone. Despite its generic content, "The Scargiver" is a delirious, pulpy mishmash of knockoffs. The first "Rebel Moon" was released on Netflix in December and featured a farm boy named Gunnar and a secretive assassin named Kora. The story picks up five days before the squad must defeat a vicious army led by an admiral (Ed Skrein) with a bad haircut and worse attitude. The script by Snyder, Kurt Johnstad, and Shay Hatten is a mix of exposition and soliloquies, with no authentic conversations. The film features primal, pitiless, and agonizing carnage, with Snyder excelling in his ability to kill anyone, even nice people and grandmothers-turned-guerrilla warriors. The film has plenty of death, but little life, with Boutella, the lead, being listless until she can stabbing. Slow motion footage is used in scenes where actors seem to be ordered to ignore food. Snyder's ostentatiousness is unmatched, with his refusal to dial down any of his impulses, such as dramatic smooches and priestly hats. The film's moral debate is reminiscent of Kevin Smith's "Clerks," where the moral debate revolves around the never-seen workers who died building the Death Star for Darth Vader. Snyder shows their faces and mows them down, making it a more realistic portrayal of the battle.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Visually the movie looks great at times, every Snyder movie does. But when it comes to everything else is just messy and unoriginal. Already said about the first movie, it's a blatant Star Wars rip off with a twist of Western and a bit steam punk. Almost not a single scene where I haven't seen something similar, almost not a piece of dialogue I haven't heard before. The story is sloppy, the characters underdeveloped with a weak attempt to make you understand them better (that table scene... ouch, painful). The cast is not given much to work with, some of the more veteran actors get away with it, but it's painfully obvious who doesn't.

Only watch it for the sweet visuals, the rest is a big waste of time.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A new frontier of bad taste
review_detailed_main:
A collection of cliches from all types of films, incoherently blended together: 300, Vikings, Star Wars, Foundation, Dune... the list goes on.

The cast is too good for this movie, which makes me wonder what led them to agree to take part of this insanity.

The lack of originality is not the main problem as there are many ways to tell similar stories, or the even the same story: small planet of regular folks rebels against the mighty galactic empire, led by the "complicated" hero with a dark past. Fine.

But now add all those cliches: light sabers, AI droids, human-cyborg villain, farmers fighting trained soldiers, all the "honor" speeches, etc., and you get 2 hours of unbelievable bad taste. If that is not bad enough, the overuse of slow-motion scenes is nauseating. Why do a slow-mo of folks harvesting????

With the exception of the main villain, the acting is ok, but nothing can save this script.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Too much slow motion for a single movie
review_detailed_main:
Well .. without the slow motion, the movie length it's about... 70 minutes... But.

In the other hand, the dialogue it's dull.

Not a single twist, not a single good acting... I was really bored.

The first one was ok... But this one is hard to watch... Not a single character is likeable or generates enough empathy....

Of there is a continuation... I'm not going to watch it.... It's hard enough to finish this one... I'm watching it 15 /20 minutes at day... I can't tolerate more than that....

An advice? Please, don't lose time with this movie... There was a lot better out there.

Best regards.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
In part 1 there was no story, no characters action was depressing because of slow mo in part 2 just doubled that what I just said, I was bored out of my mind.

And the character history was same ,"You see, I used to be in a nice place and then mean people came and I was sad cause my loved ones died and now I'm in this village defending grain" also it was reading like a wikipedia entries.

Its pretentious, boring, ai written, soundtrack which got worse, there was no story like it was written by 12 year old. The whole idea of big empire coming for grain to small village farmers like wtf Overall no plot, blank characters, boring sci fic 0 out of 10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I don't think we deserve good movies.
review_detailed_main:
One of the best scifi movies I have seen recently, watched both parts together. The movie industry has become a consumer's market. I have noticed this for the past 10-12 years that, people are only consuming big star collaborative movies with nonsense plot, bad acting and mediocre script, with almost little to none emotional maturity, these type of movies only work because there are big face in them. Majority of the movies are such that the actors are playing themselves rather than playing the characters.

Rebel moon also has many familiar faces, but they have solid script, characters have great chemistry, they show emotional maturity which died in the 90's or early 2000's I guess. These movies have wonderful CG scenes. The story is gripping, yes the progression is slow but not boring. The story is in parts so there will be some parts in the movie that is more talkative just build that momentum in the story and depth in the characters.

I guess the audience have become too picky or they have lost interest in connecting with a good story. If these movies would have released in early 2000's, people would have gone crazy. I'm not saying that the movies look old, it's just that people don't like different things anymore.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: And I thought the first Movie was bad

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Absolute trash scipt, poor acting and good visual effects.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zack Snyder has got to be stopped.
review_detailed_main:
I am not a Snyder hater, by the way. I really enjoyed his Dawn of the Dead, Watchmen, Man of Steel and his Owl movie, a movie not enough people have seen.

Sadly, as Snyder has progressed forward, receiving higher and higher budgets, his films have become exponentially worse.

A follow up to the straight to Netflix Rebel Moon, Rebel Moon II picks up where the other left off, which isn't saying much.

Where the first Rebel Moon took place in different locations, with different characters, most of Rebel Moon II takes place mainly in one location with one final battle.

At the end of the day, these movies are Snyder doing his remake of Seven Samurai and Star Wars, except with a lame story.

This proves that Snyder NEEDS a quality screenplay to placed into his hands prior to rolling cameras.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Super exhausting and boring at times
review_detailed_main:
"Rebel Moon Part 2" attempts to carve out its own niche in the space opera genre, clearly drawing inspiration from the "Star Wars" franchise. Unfortunately, this effort falls flat, leaving much to be desired.

The movie is bogged down by excessive flashbacks and backstories, which consume a significant portion of the runtime. These prolonged sequences of dialogue and drama detract from any potential excitement or engagement. Instead of building depth, they make the experience tiresome and monotonous.

The main villain is a disappointing stereotype, lacking originality and depth. His character feels recycled from countless other movies, adding nothing new or compelling to the narrative. This familiarity only adds to the overall sense of redundancy.

Rebel Moon Part 2 is a frustrating watch. Its attempt to emulate iconic space sagas results in a tedious and uninspired film. Save yourself the time and skip this one.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Calling it "Number 2" would've been more accurate.
review_detailed_main:
I kept count of 2 fun actions sequences involving explosions of spaceships and the dialogues can be well-written. There are solid foundations for an interesting lore lying underneath the ridiculous shenanigans, you can see potential for a better story even if the movie doesn't live up to the expectations. Those are the only positives in Rebel Moon Part 2.

The main problem is Snyder spends a minimal amount of time on character development and as a result you don't care about whether or not the rebels will live to fight another day, making the battle feel insignificant in the process and actors acting like emotionless robots for 70% of the time certainly doesn't help the situation.

In the midst of the visual chaos there's something weirdly amusing about watching a director try his best to make something interesting, but failling every single time. There are many death scenes, dramatic moments, inspirational speeches, constant screaming and ridiculously ellaborate action sequences with excessive amounts of slow motion. These moments aren't supposed to be funny, but I couldn't stop laughing at the imcompetente storytelling. If you plan on watching this, make sure to stick around for the funniest cliffhanger in movie history.

If you're looking for a guilty pleasure to entertain you for two hours, you won't be dissapointed. It's entertaining for all the wrong reasons tho. Once the numbers for this sequel show a gradual decline in viewership and popularity compared to the original, The streaming giant will think twice before giving Zack Snyder full creative control over anything. A franchise with 6 movies? I doubt it.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: Here we go again...Just as with the first part , it feels that everything in the world of cinematography (all world as is ) went absolutely upside down... Nothing makes sense anymore : man are women , women are men , some are cats , some are whoever , here is another example of absolutely illogical , braindead people out there , who worship the most stupid movie in existence (Barbie ,of course ))), but in mass criticize and put down this film ... If you'll have any knowledge or understanding of the most amazing universe of storytelling via books and movies , you would see that this film is basically fantasy variation on Magnificent Seven , or it's predecessor & samurais ...No plot , no story ... primitive people ... The story is as old as the first fairy tale : Big bad force bullying good innocents , here comes the help (in many different ways over centuries ))) So ,why not to just relax and enjoy it for what it is :modern fairy tale with amazing action and simple old story....

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: I wanted to like it, I couldn't 😣

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: "the grain is our most powerful weapon"...what the flip?
review_detailed_main:
That's as far as I have managed to get into this ermm 'epic' film, and that's about at the 11th minute mark. The previous 10 minutes was filled with similarly sensibility jarring dialogue, which even Lawrence Olivier could not deliver in anything approaching a believable let alone engaging manner.

Of course I will return to it at some point in time, I finished part one in 3 or 4 attempts, but at least that engaged me for at least the first 15 minutes. Really this whole Rebel moon saga is such a mish mash of 'stuff', that the least it needs is half decent dialogue, overlayed onto a barely sensible script, delivered by minimally talented actors, who are at least competently directed.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Zach Snyder once again proving he's the worst 'talent' around
review_detailed_main:
Where do you start with this? It's like kicking a baby after you've stolen it's sweets. Everyone involved in this truly awful two parter will have known it was going to be terrible. Most Zach Snyder films are.

Sure, in the early days we quite liked the endless slow mo, light flashing, action sequences in the rain trick that has become his one and only enduring characteristic (aside from making generally dreadful films) but this plunges new depths I didn't think possible.

Who gave this man that amount of money on a script that feels like it's been devised by one of the weird little 'adults living in mommas basement DC fanboys' that he seems to attract.

There isn't a single redeeming scene, effect, performance, edit, sound. It's one of the worst things I have ever seen.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I thought the second part wouldn't disappoint, but I wasted my time. There's no science fiction here. Stupid nonsense. Space flights and grain collected by hand with scythes and chains. An evil empire driving a space fleet for the sake of several dozen tons of wheat, well, complete nonsense, and these kings and princesses are straight out of an engraving from medieval France... Nonsense! Both the first and second parts are dull, boring, low-quality, very naive and cheap. The actors are "sleepy". So many great actors and to film such nonsense, disappointed. Fell asleep at 15 minutes. The director's reputation has definitely fallen tens of times.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Title: A Stellar Epic with a Nostalgic Twist
review_detailed_main:
Netflix's "Rebel Moon" is a breathtaking space opera that masterfully blends grand-scale sci-fi with the classic appeal of a timeless Western. Zack Snyder has crafted a visually stunning universe, brimming with rich lore and unforgettable characters. This film is a must-watch for fans of both science fiction and epic adventures.

One of the standout features of "Rebel Moon" is its striking resemblance to "The Magnificent Seven." Much like the beloved Western, "Rebel Moon" revolves around a band of diverse heroes coming together to defend a peaceful community against overwhelming odds. The film's core narrative-outsiders uniting to protect the vulnerable-echoes the themes of camaraderie, sacrifice, and justice that made "The Magnificent Seven" a classic.

The ensemble cast delivers outstanding performances, each character bringing unique strengths and captivating backstories to the forefront. Their dynamic interactions and shared mission create an emotional resonance that elevates the film beyond mere spectacle. Fans of "The Magnificent Seven" will appreciate the homage paid to the original, while enjoying the fresh and imaginative setting of a distant galaxy.

"Rebel Moon" also excels in its world-building, with stunning visual effects and intricate set designs that immerse viewers in a richly detailed cosmos. Snyder's direction ensures that the action sequences are both thrilling and beautifully choreographed, making every battle scene a visual feast.

In conclusion, "Rebel Moon" is a triumphant addition to Netflix's catalog, offering a perfect blend of nostalgia and innovation. It stands as a worthy successor to "The Magnificent Seven," reimagined for a new generation in a faraway universe. Whether you're a sci-fi enthusiast or a fan of classic Westerns, "Rebel Moon" is a cinematic experience that shouldn't be missed.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: We could have done without this sequel.
review_detailed_main: Rebel Moon-Part Two: The Scargiver is another heavily CGI film with a head scratching plot and overused action scenes. I got to give it to Zack Snyder he is pretty consistent with these type of films, just not in the good kind of consistency. There are scenes in this film that seem to be ripped off straight from Star Wars. Also the multiple slow motion action shots get really tiresome after a while. This movie might have been a little bit more enjoyable if it was edited together better. Now before you start to think I'm a Zack Snyder hater I am not! I have enjoyed some of his previous work like The Watchmen or Dawn of the Dead. I feel like Netflix went all in with this movie franchise from Mr. Snyder and are now probably quickly regretting it. Rebel Moon Part Two is a sequel we did not need but got anyways. Rebel Moon Part Two gets a very low 2 stars out of 10.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Trash has never looked so epic!
review_detailed_main:
I watched this Michael Bayism with little hope, considering the first part was a disaster, but I still wanted to see how bad an expensive and so much advertised movie can be. And yep... it's really really really bad.

But hey, we got some budget lightsaber action and laser guns just like in Star Wars, so who cares? Pew pew ...

What else... I absolutely loved the slow motions, they allowed viewers to easily notice how bad the fighing coreography was.

And the music, so good, full of emotion, I loved it! I was perfectly chosen in contrast with the poorly written dialogue and predictable plot.

In the end, the one that did it for me was Leonidas's spartan participating to the action. The abs, the cape, the axe... it was all there. AUGH AUGH AUGH!

Now that I've already listed all the positives, there was one big minus to this movie: the end points in the direction of another one. Please mr. Zack, don't do it! Have mercy on us!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Watching this movie is wasting time; everything about it is stupid, actors are so weak as their characters. The plot is redundant and extremely shallow as if it's meant for children. There is nothing interesting at all, the plot doesn't make any sense, the story is so weak, and the characters are totally unbelievable.

I wonder why they bothered to produce such low quality movie, I think that both the writer and the producer should find other jobs as clearly they don't have what it takes to produce reasonable movies.

Unfortunately I can't give it zero star, I'm believe one star is very generous for such waist of time.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Slow, manupulative, felt nothing for any of the characters.
review_detailed_main:
Part 1 was sorta a fun popcorn film/episode/whatever.. Part 2 starts out sloooowww.. remains slow for 2/3rds of the movie while it tries to somehow get us invested in the characters, fails miserably (Kora's response to her companions opening up about why they fight makes me really dislike her.) and then ends with an entirely predictable and fairly boring bang.

I had "Nuke em from orbit. It's the only way to be sure" running through my head right from the start of the movie so the lazy contrivance of having a few piles of grain literally protect a bunch of villagers from a well armed space force, just made it impossible to take anything in this film seriously.

The timing of their "help" showing up was just the chef's kiss of stupidity.

If you're on the fence about whether you need to watch this to complete the set.. don't bother.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Another great installment of this new Zack Snyder saga, really on par with its predecessor. These are the kind of Zack Snyder movies we've been waiting to see.

I have loved this story since the First Part, its Protagonist and Villain are excellent and this rematch was more than expected, it really fascinates me how this actress fit perfectly into her role and shines in spades, before she had participated in one or another failure like The Mummy with Tom Cruise, but now this actress is on the rise and is the best.

The plot is very good, original and, I must be honest, I have not seen something so well done in this genre since 2005 when George Lucas' "The Revenge Of The Sids" was released.

It is wonderful and amazingly watchable, and by the end you can see that it is only the beginning of a great saga, this time, by Snyder, which when it hits the nail on the head is incredible.

A special section deserves the Soundtrack, which is spectacular and accompanies the film masterfully.

100% recommended if you like films of this genre and even more so if you follow Zack Snyder's style.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Little known fact: when sped up to normal speed this movie has a running time of only about five minutes.

It's not terrible. Visually it is impressive. It doesn't have a plot that necessitates it being two parts, though. The characters other than the lead are generally uninteresting. She pulls off an excellent performance because it's clear her character was well defined. The rest just seem to be around to give her something to react to.

Even though there is no classic, "To be continued..." the ending all but says as much. I sure hope the writers put some more effort into the characters the next time around.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I don't know how even mediocre writers could fail so badly at creating characters we care about at all, create any sense of proper world-building, or even create individual scenes that have any kind of meaningful development.

No, this series is at this point quite obviously going to just be a collection of scenes where things sort of happen and even within that scene there's no rhyme or reason to it. Forget about a larger sense of consistency across the film. I wish I could say that Snyder at least seems to understand how to create cool action. I think at one point in time he probably did - earlier films of his like Dawn of the Dead and 300 seem to suggest he had some clue about this. I don't know what happened, because even the main battle here was frightfully dull and full of nonsense like people rushing at each other with guns so that they could... hit each other with the guns. People look on as their friends get killed about 20 feet away, at which point they rush over to help them after it's too late. Protagonists have clear opportunities to kill their enemies but simply decide not to for no reason. We discover that the ships are powered by... coal. Yes, there are rooms on the ship where people are shoveling coal into the engines. But they also have scanning technology that rivals Star Trek.

These movies should have written themselves. It's a shame, because I really like Sofia Boutella but she deserves a much better franchise than this.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Akira Kurosawa is spinning in the grave George Lukas
review_detailed_main:
This is a horrible hybrid between Akira kurosawa 7th samurai with some of George Lucas's Star wars actions. The plot is seven samurai more or less except it doesn't make sense. Why would be an Empire so bent out of shape about a small villages grain. Empire that has star flying ships, blasters are still relying on grain growing by peasants, doesn't make any sense.

Technology aside it doesn't make any sense that professionally trained soldiers are so terrible at soldiering. Poor peasants are taking them down like rotten pumpkins. There are a few professional Warriors that should fight better than the soldiers, but the rest of the peasants are taking down the soldiers like professional Navy seals. What do they do in their spare time combat training?

Bottom line. Absolutely horrible movie, flashy candy with zero substance.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: It just gets worse and worse
review_detailed_main:
What an exhausting, boring and uncreative waste of time that is only upheld the slighest by its budget and visuals.

Like the first part it offers nothing creative. All characters are badly executed tropes that only add insult to injury as it seems the casting director tried to tick as many quota boxes as possible.

Any worldbuilding that is done is destroyed soon after with a handful of illogical displays.

Be it farmers that live devoid of technology and harvest by hand but somehow their "oxen" drag along a hovercraft.

Or be it futuristic armor that can be pierced by normal steel knifes like the character wore nothing at all.

Or that in a galaxy that large with a rich history, they say, and with ships that jump that somehow a little grain harvest of a little village becomes so pivotal for no reason.

Anything and everything in this movie is carelessly constructed about a vision that is as uninspired as a dead cow.

I even watched the directors cut and its 50% slow motion added to the other 50% of waste of screentime.

I will think twice looking at anything from Zack Snyder again.

I truly believe that even an AI in 2024 could write a better script than this movie.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Never write reviews, but will make an exception for this one

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Sat Morning kids cartoon as a film
review_detailed_main: My inner 9 year old enjoyed this. Just lots of a action, martial art-esq fights, guns, spaceships... what's not to like :) But, that's it. The script isn't the worst ever, afterall the first film holds that title. But it's so basic and ridiculously implausible - only matched by the implausible bullet-dodging nonsense action. I know Star Wars Stormtroopers are hero blind, but this film takes it to a whole new level. In general I thought the cinematography was fine, although all the slow motion achieved was highlighting 'victims' being hit before the strike lands - honestly. The whole film has that pseudo amateur feel of a TV show. I think some ideas are well suited to a cartoon, and no, I don't mean animated film...I mean cartoon.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: So I'm a huge Sci-fi fan and this movie is one of the worst things I've seen since Part 1 of this hopefully 2 part series. The ridiculous details in this movie are so laughable it almost seems there was an attempt at humour like in StarShip Troopers, I mean a space ship powered by coal, a ships gun that is aimed with hand cranks like a World War Two anti-aircraft gun, but then you realize no, these guys are trying to be serious. Serious psychedelic drug abuse can be the only explanation for these horrible details. The rest of the story is filled with characters you can't identify with or like, plot lines that make no sense and just agh, it goes on and on, one flaw after another. I hope Netflix does the right thing here and asks Mr. Snyder to empty his desk and follow the nice man in uniform out of the building. If you were hoping for a new Sci-Fi universe to replace the tired and over exploited existing IP, this ain't it.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Half of the movie is in slow motion, put Zack Snyder in prison. The bad guys' costumes are like World War II uniforms. The costumes of the good peasants are like those of the Mormon community. Nothing makes sense. The soundtrack is infuriating. Zack Snyder has ruined Star Wars twice. It's an insult to true Star Wars fans.

If Zack Snyder has a license to make films, they should take it away for malpractice.

If you couldn't resist seeing it to find out what it was about, then you will do everything possible to forget it forever.

The Walt Disney Company ruins culture once again.

Finally, a waste of budget and acting talent.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: To be honest I was skeptical when I saw part one. I also read the negative reviews of the second part so I was sort of biased to believe that the whole thing has a serious lack of quality. I must admit that was proven wrong after watching the second part. I am not saying that this is a masterpiece, but I would easily rate it with 7 out of 10, and I am actually looking forward for the continuation, experiencing how her story evolves. I am giving a 10 out of 10 rating, as a protest against the negativity of the user reviews, as well as the reviews from experts. This is a streaming movie, if this was a masterpiece, it would hit the theaters instead. Since it is not, we should treat it as such. I am not a big fan of Snyder in general, but if I am to evaluate this as a streaming platform movie, because that what this is, he has actually done quite decent work. I therefore, highly recommend watching both parts.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: The first part put me to sleep after 35 minutes of laughable dialogue. I had nothing to watch on Memorial Day and started to watch Part 2. It started with a scene that made no sense to me, so I went back and watched Part 1. Then I watched Part 2 which is like "The Magnificent 7" with really bad dialogue and corny back stories for the main "good guy"characters. The only thing that makes either part watchable, is the scenery and action sequences. The main baddie is bad for no other reason than to see people suffer. He goes through a process that has already been used in one of the Star Wars movies from the second trilogy. These two films could've been really good with a better storyline and better dialogue.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Seriously, these two movies could have been compacted into one.

Starship Troopers (1997) was good in its honest subversive social commentary. Tonight's movie is lost in its attempt to be grand space opera, but suffering from repeated B-grade movie tropes and over-used stereotypes.

There's nothing new here; but the worst part is mashing together so many ideas from so many great past films and not weaving them together in any meaningful way.

What we get instead is a coal-powered intergalactic war-ship with a giant biological or AI head running it but major weapons targeted using hand-cranked adjustments from WW2 gunnery staff.

Sure, the visuals are amazing. And the music is extremely good.

Just so many problems

...that strangely someone made decisions to approve. Unbelievably bad Dialogue in key moments. Unrealistic actions that are obviously meant to "look cool" but ruin the story with their idiocy.

Best bit: The intriguingly lost robot voiced by Sir Anthony Hopkins.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Fast forward half of the movie
review_detailed_main:
Story is a hot mess and all over the place.

Almost half of the movie is unrelated to the story made people felt like they just tried to make sure it's a two hour movie with only one hour story.

All the slow motion, 5min of singing and suddenly like they were at Thanksgiving's dinner all characters have to talk about their past that we don't care about...

How about just make one epic movie with good story instead of two crappy movies and make people think it's a waste of their time watching them.

I know Bae Doona from sense8 and she was great in that shows, but in this movie she just seems awkward.

I won't waste my time with the part 3 for sure....

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Greetings from Lithuania.

I had no hopes for "The Scargiver", the second movie in the series (and hopefully the last one) after the abysmal first part. Even the first movie somewhat not that bad. This one unfortunately should be skipped by everyone, even some light alcohol did not help me to sit through it in one go. In three evenings I finished it and it's a bad movie is all I can say.

Overall, the director and written of this movie Zack Snyder made two really bad movies. I wasn't the biggest fan of his previous movies, but I did enjoyed them all on some level. Rebel Moon unfortunately is not the case.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Right in the middle of number 2
review_detailed_main:
I am a true Rebel.

When I watch parts of something like a tv show or a movie series, I try and watch it all even if parts of it are really bad sometimes, other parts are good and make it watch in some ways.

This is the case with the Rebel Moon movie series.

Visually captivating at moments and well made at other moments and with some good acting.

Sometimes CGI is so badly done if feel a few nephew's with a decent gaming pc could have done just a bit worse.

But what I truly understood watching RB2 is that they made it all like a superhero movie where all the characters bad or good are characters we already know and are part of POP culture.

Problem is we don't know those characters and we don't care about them because all we know about them from the movies is their dramatic traumatizing painful lost all hope no reason to live backstories!!!

It's full of scenes that should be intense, dramatic, grandiose, happy or sad but we like I said we don't love or feel bad, sad or happy for them.

It's so exaggerated the way they make it and the way we should feel that it feels forced all the time.

Those 2 movies could have been the 2 first 30 minutes episodes of a 4 episodes limited series.

Just by stopping and try to be so literal and and making everything clear and obvious all the time they could cut at least half of the movie length and that is before cutting out all the long montage of people doing a task from a to z all cut in scenes of the most important parts of each tasks you see during those montage.

Another good way to shorten the length would be to cut to the bare minimum the ships coming and going and moving and flying, and more coming or going and grand landscaping scenes with badly done CGI because that scene is sooooooo long for no reason at all and brings absolutely nothing to the narrative of that story that they ran out of money to make it look better than what any youtuber who make videos about how to use blender could do.

In fact those youtuber are going to recreate the whole movies in 2-3 months with better visual effects than the original and use them as the easiest tutorials for beginners 12 years old and up, come on grandma you can do it too!!!

Yes! Your ipad gen 5 is strong enough.

Yep I have lots of spare time and i am not that pleased about it so take that minimum words required.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
I think it's about peer pressure. Certain influential people that seem to have been tasked with spitting on everything Snyder does have set the tone, and the entourage is following. They don't want to seem uncool.

It's a good matinee movie, the way they were made once upon a time.

The first part was disappointing, too messy, but this second part makes up for it. Apart from some pacing problems, it's good. The fight scenes are amazing.

There were several films that failed at the cinemas, Waterworld, John Carter, but became cult classics. This one is a future classic.

And I'd rather see an evolution of the Snyderverse than the commercial garbage that Star Wars has evolved into.

Go, Zack, go.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
This is a review for both parts one and two What can I say? Snyder has proven beyond a doubt he is gunning for Ed Woods crown for worst film maker.

Even with huge budgets and decent actors... this director has created some turds in his time and Rebel Moon ranks up there with Sucker Punch.

The plot and writing and some of the performances in rebel moon feel like the start of a 70s porno... and that's something to behold.

The reason he continues to have a career is because of his rabid snyderverse fans who have never left their basements and support his mediocre skills.

This double feature is showcasing just how bad Snyder is in not just writing but directing.

All I can say in the positive note is thankgod Snyder has been relegated to streaming for the rest of his life.

It took me over 14 attempts to complete watching rebel moon parts one and two And I will definitely not try to watch his directors cut later as I believe I would suffer permanent brain rot and end up like his snyderverse fans.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: A generic spoiler review of Star Wars: Daario Naharises part 2

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: When the voice of Anthony Hopkins is the star...
review_detailed_main:
Watched both rebel movies. 1st movie was a questionable 4 star, maybe more a 3 star. 2nd movie was even worse. I gave it 2 stars because the CGI and special effects were quite good. But the story... oh my.... where to start.... it just doesn't make any sense at all. The worst are the stupid dialogues, they just don't make any sense. And the backstories on the magnificent 7 were just laughable.

With such a budget it could have been so much better. Well at least we now know where Chappie went after his movie. He grew older and got the voice of Anthony Hopkins. Give us an army of 1000 chappies next movie, it'll be finished in 5 minutes. Seriously, James/Jimmy/Chappie was the only interesting character in the whole movie. Long live AI....

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
The writers had to have been on drugs and had a 10 year old with them when writing this. Nothing made sense and it seemed like the writers would do a line, ask the 10 year old what would be cool, and put it in the movie without lead up or explanation, then put it in.

Why would a galaxy spanning empire go to a small village for grain, then fly around to other planets then come back to this little village for bags of flour?

Also, whoever put the fake beards on the actors had to have had a grudge against the actors, the beards looked SO bad to the point you couldn't get past them and watch the scene.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main: I'm not saying this movie went and reinvented the wheel, or is a genre bending story that is good for all ages, but it is a fitting installment in this universe. The fact of the matter is, when I watched this, I wasn't looking for a heady sci di space opera. I was looking for a fun movie, and I got that. I admit the slo mo could be tedious, and the characters have minimal character work, but it's a fun time. Turn your brain off and enjoy the show. I think it is well worth it, and I would be more than happy to watch another few films in this universe if they keep building on what worked and keep improving. But yeah, this is better than reviews made it out to be by a long shot.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: How does Sophia Boutella keep getting work!?!
review_detailed_main:
There are just so many things wrong with this movie, I would like to start by highlighting the best part of the film; and that's the visual effects, that's it.

If you watch it, pay attention to the acting of the protagonist, Sophia Boutella. Look at her fight scenes, her facial expressions, and her delivery... It's awful... And the plot is beyond nonsense, even when disbelief has been turned to zero, it's still a degree of nonsense somewhere bellow sh*t... A better use of this film has been by the voluminous YouTube channels who have created reviews articulating precisely how truly awful the film actually is... Boutella ruined Star Trek, The Mummy franchise, and now the Snider-verse...

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Too many plot holes to count

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Somehow even slower than the first
review_detailed_main:
It's like they were contractually obligated to fill in a 2 hour runtime but only had a 60 page script. Almost every scene was twice as long as it needed to be so the movie was just a slog to get through. So many scenes had slow motion every 10 seconds that made them even longer (seriously: 4 mins of watching people harvest grain wasn't bad enough so they added slow mo to make it even longer?)

The deaths were unearned and seemed to be just tossed in randomly to try to drum up some drama. Even an overly-long scene explaining everyone's backstory (with - you guessed it - slow mo!) wasn't enough to make me care if they died. They were predictable deaths, too - choreographed way ahead of time just based on where the character was or what was going on around them.

Honestly can't say a single good thing about this. It was about an hour long than it needed to be (as was the first.) God I hope they don't release a director's cut because I can't imagine what kind of filler they are going to add in for another 30-40 mins. Just kidding - it's going to be extra slow-mo scenes!

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_title: Not great, but definitely not bad - a decent watch
review_detailed_main:
I would say its a solid 7/10. Nicely relates to part one. Its not Snyder's best work. But its not so bad as some of the other reviewers are making it.

I didn't have much expectation from a Netflix production. But its way better than an average Netflix movie. The movie could have been way better with a big studio and production house behind it. The story is solid but again could have been much better. I heard WB turned it down. I feel it could have been a great movie series with more investments, writers, producers, dialogues, a little more touching portrayal (the story is there but lacks representation). Maybe will get to see more in the extended cut.

Overall, the movie is very good in my opinion. Watching the two movies together back-to-back is better. Don't suggest listening to those giving 1 or 2 rating. They just have some personal vendetta against Snyder. Without any bias, its a solid watch without any nonsense or stupid jokes.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Don't watch this movie. The first one is kinda okayish but this one is just insufferable. I don't know who Zack Snyder is but he is clearly not good at making movies.

I'm not surprised Disney wasn't interested in the script to use for Star Wars. The new movies might be bad but compared to whatever this is they deserve an Oscar.

The story, characters and universe makes no sense at all. The dialogues are extraordinarily cringe and often unnecessary.

Please read some other reviews but I urge you to not waste your time on this movie. You'll regret watching this.

If you are into Sci-fi check out John Carter, the movie flopped but it's actually entertaining.

movie_name: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
review_detailed_main:
Humm, lemme think how can I write a review without spoilers... Oh, wait! There is nothing to spoil.

Formulaic, slow drawn for no purpose except to pad the run time (I'm being generous here).

Part 1 was not exactly good, but I, at least, could see some promise. Could see where it was heading, in it's hushed way. Part 2 is the oppose, in a bad way.

While part 1 hurried along, trying to created several hooks, deal with several issues and unite a lot of people, without stopping in any point to explore the possibilities, part 2 drags... and drags... and drags.... Long scenes of people harvesting grains is just an example, and far from the worse of it.

Sure, this is not as bad as, say, Moonfall or Battlefield Earth. And that is the thing I can say about it.
